review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: A nice hotel, close to the Embarcadero, transit and comfortable walking distance to many restaurants, etc.  Staff very friendly and helpful. Room quiet, comfortable and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Extremely friendly and helpful concierge staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to the Embarcadero Centre and Saturday morning market. Comfortable walking distance to North Beach for restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel and rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms were nice and spacious, clean and comfortable.

review.title: Comfortable bed. Spacious room. Large TV.
review.reviewText: Spacious room with comfortable bed. A very large TV.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room with comfortable bed. A very large TV.
review.negativeRemarks: Water splashing onto bathroom floor, probably because this was a handicap friendly room, thus there was no kerb to contain the water during showering.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to most attraction with downtown San Francisco.

review.title: A great hotel in the financial district.
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was great. They were full but on my insistence that I get claustrophobic in small rooms, i got a suite.
Great check in and lovely room. Just disappointed at the lady in the breakfast place as she kept talking about the price of everything we were ordering and it was rude as we had come with office mates. Just rude service.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms, cleanliness, nearby to our place of work.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast service and manners of people who serve food.
review.locationRemarks: Near market street and embarcadero so lots of places around. Starbucks on the opposite side of the road so easy to get breakfast.

review.title: Convenient location. Walk BART, Chinatown.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.  Especially if you like neatby Chinatown. Friendly staff. Three block walk BART to/fr airport. Busy area. Plenty coffee. Quiet weekends.

review.title: Wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant experience. The staff was able to make special accommodations for us.

review.title: Bed and towels
review.reviewText: For an expensive hotel would expect very comfortable bed and nice fluffy towels, in our room both require change

review.title: Great Financial District Hotel!
review.reviewText: We're former San Franciscans who wanted to stay in the Financial District/downtown area. We'll definitely be back to Le Meridien! The room was spacious and spotless, the bar always had a good crowd, ands the front desk and doormen went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The location is great for walking, shopping, dining, and people watching. Highly recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Large, comfortable room. Good amenities and comfy bathrobe. Impeccable housekeeping. friendly staff. Good gym. Fun bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Do not charge me for in-room Internet access! COME ON!

review.title: Overall a very nice hotel in heart of bay area
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 2 nights for long labor weekend , overall it was a very nice , comfortable and clean hotel . Would recommend to everyone

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
This has always been our go to Hotel, great location, good restaurants . 
Very comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to restaurants and bars
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 2 nights, had a great time in the city, hotel is walking distance to bars and restaurants.

review.title: Beautiful view and clean room.
review.reviewText: I stayed in luxury suite on 22nd floor. Staff was good and room was clean and view,was amazing

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Nice, clean and comfortable room. Not far from Chinatown and North Beach.

review.title: Nice place, location could be better.
review.reviewText: Can't fair the actual room and the hotel. However the financial district is VERY hectic and not walkable distance to much.

review.title: Best hotel in Financial District close 2 EVERTHING
review.reviewText:
This hotel was our initial choice because we wanted to stay in a safe location close to the water and all other San Francisco tourist attractions (i.e.Alcatraz, Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, Golden Gate Bridge, etc) and we found this to be the best of it all! This hotel is in the financial district, which meant that in it's proximity were typical city buildings and water views. My husband and I walked EVERYWHERE -- all within 30 minutes max of this amazing hotel.
We arrived and checked in early and not only did they give us a room but they upgraded us to the 20th floor in a room with a balcony which made our appreciation for this place surpass our expectations. We stayed 4 nights and our flight was late the day we checked out so they extended our checkout time and let us keep our bags with them while we continued to explore the city prior to our evening departure.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff (doormen, concierge, front desk reps, etc) were AMAZING. They helped us with finding best ways to get around the city, where to eat, & more
review.negativeRemarks: My husband & I came back to our room after being out all day and after our room got cleaned our balcony door was left opened (which we weren't fans of
review.locationRemarks: EVERYTHING -- pier 1 market, AT&T park, cable car, trolley, bus, bart (subway), coit tower, alcatraz, lombard st, fisherman's wharf, and MORE :)

photos.caption: View from our room of the water

review.title: Great quiet location!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel! We typically stay in Union Square, but liked this location since is was accessible by foot to most points in the city and it was quiet. The staff was exceptional. We had a beautiful view from the 14th floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Only negative was I ordered a flatbread for a snack from the bar restaurant and it was inedible! You could not chew the crust. Revamp that recipe.
review.locationRemarks: We walked easily to the port, China town, union square shopping, etc.  A really great location.

review.title: Good hotel in a quiet part of town.
review.reviewText: Hotels in SF is expensive, this one is no exception. I do find that $375/night is too much for this hotel since it is not truly 4-stars. It is in good condition, but some parts are dated. We had a corner room with balcony, where it was apparent people smoked on, and there were ashes that were not cleaned. I would only rate this hotel 3-star but I give an extra for customer service and restaurant which were both excellent. I also liked that the hotel was located away from all the tourism but still central to major attractions.

review.title: Lovely Hotel centrally located for my needs!
review.reviewText:
Loved everything EXCEPT no coffee pot in the room.  It's all about convenience for me!!  If I can't make a cup of java in my pj's & have to shower & dress to obtain a cup (cannot leave my room without looking decent!!) I'm irritated.  How about a table on every floor with a pot with cream/sugar.  I'll leave my room in pj's to go a few doors down!!
Thanx!
review.negativeRemarks: Get coffee in the rooms!!
review.locationRemarks: At & t park, ferry building, quaint restaurants, hop on/off bus stop, public transportation.

review.title: Great location! Clean and nice staff.
review.reviewText: We had a room on the 19th floor and the view was spectacular! great comfort, no noise
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe more choices for the breakfast buffet.. Was delicious but only a few items..
review.locationRemarks: Caffes, restaurants, shopping all in walkable distance

managementResponses.response: Thank you for writing about your recent stay.  We are sorry that you were disappointed in the parking prices, concierge and hotel amenities.  We do pride ourselves in being inclusive for families and business travelers alike.  I am sorry that we did not demonstrate this to you and I will share your comments with our concierge team.  We will review our family friendly restaurant lists since there are many in San Francisco.  Again, we appreciate you sharing this feedback.  We are glad you had fun around the Pier and hope you give us another opportunity on your next visit.

review.title: Meant more for business travelers, not for family
review.reviewText: The hotel location was great.  My wife and kids loved all the things going on around the Pier and evenings were nice too, we checked out a few small restaurants nearby that were very accommodating for special requests.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location close to downtown and the Pier.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking was pricey, not much in the way of additional hotel amenities.  The concierge wasn't all that good at recommending family restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants nearby, best if you find them on your own.  Exploring the pier was lots of fun with the family.

review.title: Feel front desk staff need improvement
review.reviewText: I would rate Over all experience as A+ but need some improvement at the front desk
review.positiveRemarks: Location, rooms and A+ and extra courteous services of gate / lobby staff
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk service. Too slow location is excellent with walking distance to major attractions
review.locationRemarks: Lotion is excellent walking distance to major attractions and restaurants

review.title: The people make the hotel
review.reviewText: It's located well (sort of between everything) and the people are just wonderful.

review.title: My only choice in SF
review.reviewText: Excelente location, service, price, amenities. There really isn't anything to complaint about this hotel - maybe only the fact that I cannot live here :)

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experiences.  We are sorry about the dirty towels and the response you received from us.  While the manager was truly sorry for you not having cleaning towels we could have also offered to send some up to your room. We will share this review with our entire team so that we can learn from this.  Thank you for letting us know about the buffet as well.  While it is competitively priced we want you to feel you received what you are paying for.  We will review our offerings with our culinary and service team.  Our parking prices are also competitive to the local market but we would be happy to help you find less expensive options on your next visit.  We do have in and out privileges with our parking which is a good value compared to the local lots.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to welcome you again soon.

review.title: Bad managment
review.reviewText: After my first night no ones shows to clean our room... we come back to the hotel at 11:30pm and fund the dirty towels on the floor...nothing was done.. I had to shower and re use the dirty towels that I had lifted in the bathroom floor. I went to take to the hotel manager and she just said I am sorry... ridiculous... 4 start hotel w no customer service. I will never stay in this property anymore.. the didn't offer me nothing.. I had breakfast there one time and the breakfast buffer is sooo poor and expensive... not worse it.. its better to got across the street and get a coffee etc.ANOTHER ABSURD IS THE 70 DOLARS VALET PARKING DAILY FEE
review.negativeRemarks: CHANGE MANAGEMENT TIME AND REVIEW PARKING CHARGES, BREAKFAST IS BED (NO OPTIONS).
review.locationRemarks: GOOD LOCATION

review.reviewText: The décor and ambience of the hotel and room were warm and welcoming, without pretense.  The staff was helpful, even loaning me a tie as I'd forgotten to pack one and no shops were open before my morning meeting.

review.title: great staff, great view, great time
review.reviewText: I was very happy with my stay at the Le Meridien. Thanks in a large part to Callie and Lara. They were instrumental in making my stay the enjoyable experience it was.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to the bay and tourist stuff, as well as the city and convenient for exploring the area.

review.reviewText: Great hotel, friendly staff, good location, and comfortable accommodations.
We had great service, a beautiful upgraded room with amazing city views. We will def be back.

review.title: Great hotel in the financial district
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at Le Meridien. The room was not super luxurious - just very nice. It's a good space, with a nice view through floor-to-ceiling windows. Good design, nice materials, good attention to detail (like electrical and Usb outlets by the bed and at the desk where you want them.
Absolutely great, professional staff. Unique as always. Good job, Le Meridien

managementResponses.response: Thank you kindly for taking a moment to leave this great review. While we're happy to see how much you enjoyed our location, guest rooms, and amenities, providing value to our guests is one of our top priorities. While we work hard to ensure our pricing is competitive compared to the local market, our management team will take your comments into consideration moving forward. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back again soon!

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Great location with nice rooms and facilities, downside is they nickel and dime you for every little thing that would come standard at other hotels.
It was an excellent hotel to stay at.  The customer service was great

review.title: Great stay in the City
review.reviewText: Fabulous location. Walking distance to North Beach and the ferry building. Spacious modern room with a view. Our new "go to" SF hotel

review.title: Quite and clean
review.reviewText: This hotel is really nice. We stayed in an executive room it comes with a bay view.  We stayed on Saturday so it was quite because this hotel is located in the Financial  District. There was a fare amount of restaurants to choose from. We also went to a comedy show. Which is in rock throwing distance from the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and the room sizes is awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Comedy club, parking garage is two blocks away, plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from

review.title: Elegant hotel
review.reviewText: It was an exceptional stay very pleasant and quiet property the associates were very friendly and very knowledgeable about the hotel. If you don't know where to go to in downtown just ask them and they will gladly assist you. I would definitely come back !
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are nice and clean also if you are hungry during the night they have in room dining 24 hours available.
review.negativeRemarks: An electronic bill send to an email address would be awesome . I've stay at the W hotel and they send an email about all the charges made to the room.
review.locationRemarks: Location is nice and there are so many things to do they're several restaurants and bars there is a shopping area as well as tourist areas nearby.

review.title: Great Central Location in Financial District
review.reviewText: Had a great time! There were a couple days the hotel was being picketed by a local union early in the morning, but overall we really enjoyed our location. We stayed on the 8th floor- would recommend that location or higher if you're sensitive to traffic.
review.positiveRemarks: Great TV's, Large shower, and fast elevators.
review.negativeRemarks: Notification of picketing events and expected response.
review.locationRemarks: Peet's coffee and tea around the corner is a great place to take your hotel newspaper and grab breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel in a decent area.
review.reviewText: We stayed in a regular king room, the room was spacious and the bedding was comfortable. We had a nice little corner view of the bay bridge! It seems like the amenities in the room have been upgraded recently. The thing that could have been better is the water pressure in the shower but overall it was a great stay. The location is pretty good. Let's be honest SF has a huge homeless problem and in the financial district there are considerably less than union square and the sort. The hotel was withing walking distance of the piers and markets near the bay bridge and made for a nice walk down. There are coffee shops all around this hotel. If you are looking to go out at night the Uber rides will cost you around 20 dollars to get to the popular local bars, so not bad. One thing to note about parking is there is a parking garage on battery street withing a 30 second walk of the hotel. I think it was $34 dollars for 24 hours but I got it for $25 (no in and out privilege however) using an app called spot hero. The valet at the hotel charges $65 and parks in the same structure (they do allow in and out). We got the hotel on a deal for around $250 and considering how expensive all of the hotels in SF are I would consider this hotel a good deal and would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower.

review.title: Nice location , trendy rooms , friendly staff
review.reviewText: This is our second stay at this hotel. We stayed in a superior king room on the 23rd floor . We were really happy with our over night stay. It's close enough to walk through the embarcadero center across the street . We had dinner at Tadich grill around the corner . Really nice area . Even though the weekends most things are shut down on weekends being in the financial district the hotel itself is worth the stay . We will be back again .

review.title: Really nice hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed staying in this place while visiting SF. Location is really convenient, a lot of stuff is within the walking distance. Staff was also really nice and fast.

The only problem was that if you have a loud neighbors you'll hear them, this is annoying especially late in the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Probably doors between the rooms (internal doors which connect with adjacent room) should be better insulated.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of great restaurants in the area.

review.title: Central Luxury
review.reviewText: Great staff!! Just amazing! They really go out of their way to help you! The hotel gives easy access to Market St shopping and fisherman's wharf. The view from the room is just breathtaking!
review.negativeRemarks: Add HBO.
review.locationRemarks: Really close to Market St, Columbus St, Transamerica Tower, Coit Tower with easy access to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: A day on the town.
review.reviewText: We're new to the area, having moved across the country.  We wanted to stay in San Francisco overnight, so we booked late.  Room was clean and the staff were courteous and professional.  Don't bring a car into the city!  Parking for one night was about $70.  Great location, an easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: You're in the heart of the city.  Plenty of bars, restaurants, boating trips.

review.title: Modern hotel close to embarcado
review.reviewText: Loved staying at le meridian hotel. It was very modern, clean and spacious. Located in the financial district but close to walk to the embarcado and short walk to cable cars. Quite a noisy city in general but wasn't too bothered as high up. Fridge in room and tv etc. Complimentary teas and coffees daily and fitness suite well kitties out.

review.title: The best hotel stay experience EVER!
review.reviewText: WOW! Allow me to elaborate! The staff was so nice and amazing! Laura at the front desk pulled out a map and showed us places to eat or which direction to walk. They held our luggage for us when we checked out until we had to leave for our flight while we were out and about in the city. The room was amazing as well as room service. I would definitely recommend this to anyone staying in San Francisco!

managementResponses.response: We appreciate the time you took to share your experience with others!   We look forward to having you back again in the future!

review.title: Attending conference
review.reviewText: I needed to book a hotel near the Embarcadero and Le Meridian was my best choice.  Although rates are very high in the financial district is San Francisco, at least I got a four star hotel for a much more reasonable rate than the hotel where the conference was being held.  I walked about 3 blocks, or so, but it was a gorgeous day!  I look for quality & value and Le Meridian fit the bill!  Absolutely beautiful hotel!

managementResponses.response: Excellent photos and we certainly appreciate the kind words.   We look forward to having you back next time you're in the area.   Cheers!

review.title: Luxury
review.reviewText: I absolutely love staying at LeMeridian. It is a bit pricey but well worth it. I always feel safe when I stay there and that is a priority for me

This was our third stay and was great.  the bed and bedding is superb.  The hotel staff is really friendly.  we did not use the pool or other stuff as we spent most of our time goofing off in the city.  This is a favorite place to stay for us.

managementResponses.response: We are definitely a financial district hotel, but we are pleased to help all of our guests unlock the destination and make the most of their stay in San Francisco.    Please do join us whether on business or for pleasure.

review.reviewText: primarily a business hotel because of the neighborhood, the rooms are lovely and comfortable, the bars and lobby energetic and the staff warm and professional.   we would definitely stay here again on a non business trip as well.

managementResponses.response: Thank you very much for this feedback, James. We're thrilled that your experience with us was great! We pride ourselves on providing the highest caliber of service, and we're so happy to know you enjoyed this, along with our amazing location and comfortable accommodations. We hope to welcome you back again very soon!

review.title: Excellent hotel close to attractions
review.reviewText:
Staying in the financial district removes you from the crowds of union square and the unpleasantness of fisherman's wharf. Bing close to the ferry building is great for nice food/coffee.

The hotel is very comfortable with well appointed rooms, very polite and helpful staff and feels like a quality product throughout.

photos.caption: Ban bridge night view from room

managementResponses.response: Thank you so very much for sharing! We're thrilled we accommodated you so well on your weekend trip, and we appreciate you letting us know. We hope to welcome you back the next time you decide to venture back to San Francisco!

review.title: Great location fun to walk
review.reviewText: Mom and I headed down for the weekend to enjoy the bay.  We arrived early only to be greeted with a smile and told we could check in a room was available.  Boy oh boy was I glad to hear that.  We heard up to our room to relax and get ready for a fun filled day in the bay.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your comments with us regarding your recent stay. We are pleased that you found so many things enjoyable, including the friendliness of our staff, our amazing location, and your comfortable, well-appointed room! We are happy to hear that we seemed to accommodate your business needs overall, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We are sorry, however, that the design of the lobby wasn’t quite what you expected, and we’ll be sure to relay this feedback to our management team. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to make your next stay with us worth five stars, as we certainly do hope to welcome you back again on your next return to San Francisco.

review.title: The hotel in business district and close dining.
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby, while clean, was not as inviting or comfortable as I had hoped. The staff was friendly. The central location within the business district was quite attractive, as it was close to dining, and transportation and the Bay Bridge and pier.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was quite and well appointed for our business purposes.
review.locationRemarks: The central location within the business district was quite attractive, as it was close to dining, and transportation and the Bay Bridge and pier.

review.title: San Fran trip
review.reviewText: This was the second hotel my girlfriend and I  stayed at during our trip to San Francisco and by far the best overall. Upon arrival we felt very welcomed by the hotel staff who helped with our bags without our request. Our check in process was smooth and quick. The rooms were very spacious and clean with a very modern decor. This hotel is located in the financial district which is a much nicer part of San Fran than our first hotel, which was in the heart of downtown. I highly recommend this hotel to all!

review.title: Nice hotel in financial district
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and the staff was so nice and willing to help with any questions. Check in and out was extremely easy and the beds are amazingly comfortable!! Definitely coming back soon!

review.title: Nice location can walk to everywhere.
review.reviewText: Had a nice visit to the city for a weekend getaway
review.negativeRemarks: The onsite restaurant is really not very good the 333 club I believe it is called.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for writing about your recent stay, and please accept our apologies that you were disappointed with your room accommodations. We are required by law to ensure that a percentage of our rooms are fully accessible, and please know that we would have done our best to move you had we been aware of your dissatisfaction. The design of our accessible rooms may look different, but they have the same features and amenities as any room in the hotel. With that said, we are truly very sorry to hear of your unhappy experience, and we do hope you enjoyed other areas of your stay with us overall.

review.title: They booked us in a room for people with disabilit
review.reviewText: They booked us in a room for people with disability
review.negativeRemarks: They booked us in a room for people with disability
review.locationRemarks: They booked us in a room for people with disability

review.title: Great city!  Excellent hotel with awesome service!
review.reviewText: Beautiful modern hotel.  Great staff, amazing service and attention to detail!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for writing about your recent stay, and please accept our apologies for the cleanliness issues you experienced in your room. This certainly comes nowhere close to the high standards for service and quality that we’re known for adhering to, and we’re so sorry and embarrassed that you dealt with such a rare exception to our regular conditions here. We have already begun taking action to re-coach our housekeeping team and ensure that no similar incidents occur in the future. We understand that cleanliness is a basic expectation at any hotel, let alone an esteemed Le Meridien property, and we apologize again that we did not live up to that. Thank you again for your honesty, and we hope to see you in the future so we can provide you with the stay you deserve.

review.title: Great location downtown
review.reviewText:
Absolutely dirty room! Had to call housekeeping to come back and clean again. Even after that found stains on drawer, either coffee or beverage, sticky!
Not very impressed from a hotel of this level and pricing.

review.title: perfect business hotel in every way
review.reviewText: Great location. Gorgeous room. Attentive staff. My favorite San Francisco hotel.

review.title: Excellent Value When PrePaid
review.reviewText: My entire stay was comfortable.  Stayed for 6 nights.  Given a corner room. Spacious.   Very surprised that it was relatively quiet considering we were 5 floors above Battery Street traffic noise. Only issue was the carpet was not vacuumed when we checked - cleaned the next day though.

review.title: Quick Trip
review.reviewText:
The room with upgrade was amazing! 

The valet price is shocking! (Not told till billed) 

The bar staff need retraining (only 4 customers in bar. Three staff chatting with each other.  I waited several minutes before giving up and walking away)

review.title: Nice hotel at CBD area. Close walk to Chinatown
review.reviewText: The hotel is really comfortable. Two double beds can fit two males and two females. Room is big.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location,safe and close to everything . Wonderful staff and Art Deco hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars and ferry

managementResponses.response: Hello, and thank you for your comprehensive review. It seems that your stay was a mixed bag of positive and not-so-positive experiences, which is never our goal. We appreciate your compliments on the areas of your stay you did enjoy, like your beautiful view, our amazing food and our perfect location! However, I do apologize that you were not completely impressed by your upgrade or the amenities in your room. We agree that a tattered bathrobe is not at all up to our standards, nor is an ineffective thermostat or dirty windows; please rest assured that we’ve relayed your comments to our housekeeping and maintenance departments to ensure all of these issues are remedied right away. We agree that attention to detail is critical in providing a quality experience, and that is a point we’ll be emphasizing heavily as we re-coach our team based on your feedback. We thank you again, and we hope you’ll give us the chance to redeem ourselves on your next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: New Years Stay
review.reviewText: Upon our arrival, our Superior Room with one king bed was not available and we were offered an "Executive Suite upgrade with a bay view."   We reluctantly accepted.  For an executive suite that was supposed to be an upgrade, I expected a little bit more. There were two twin beds but only one bath robe; and it was tattered and not very comfortable.  A couple of more large bath towels would have been nice also.  In 2 days, we never could quite figure out an optimal setting for the thermostat.  No matter what we did, it would either get too warm or too cold. On a positive note, the view was quite nice although the windows were very dirty.  The room service was excellent and the hotel food  we had was above average.
review.positiveRemarks: Our view was nice and the room service was excellent.  It would have been nicer if the 3rd floor restaurant was open during our 2 day stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The only restaurant was actually in a bar.  The bar's atmosphere dominated the room.  Needless to say, dinner conversation was virtually impossible.
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent for our needs in that we were a short walk from the embarcadero where we enjoyed a New Years Eve cruise.

review.title: Check in hiccups
review.reviewText: The hotel evidently had a computer issue and any reservations made the day of check in or the day before didn't register.  The line was ten deep to check in and very slow.  I had purchased the Expedia package including breakfast.  I had to produce my confirmation as they didn't have it or the rate available.  I had to call again the day after check in because the check in clerk hadn't noted breakfast included.  The room was beautiful and the restaurant on the third floor was very comfortable and the staff was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the rooms were great.
review.negativeRemarks: They had only two people checking in at first and the check in line was ten deep.  They should have prepared.  They finally put a third person in.

review.title: Nice hotel, $70/night parking left a bad taste
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying here. We did not like the $25/night rollaway bed charge and $70/night parking charges (this is rip off - as soon as the San Francisco economy cools off, nobody is willing to pay these rates. Management needs to re-think this, otherwise I guarantee it will be impact their business
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the Embarcadero, Ferry Building, North Beach, China Town and Public Transit
review.negativeRemarks: Clean up the act on Parking Charges

review.title: Easy walk to China town
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the money. The check-in  counter experience could be improved. Doormen were great!
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed! Free coffee was available on the 3rd floor, not in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Leave space in the refrigerator for the guest to put a few things. The refrigerator was completely full of drinks to sell the guest.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to China Town.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: In upscale area near downtown Market Street. Easy walk to Embarcadero (Fisherman's Wharf), to BART. to shopping. Quick, easy access drive to the freeway. As a San Francisco native, this is one of the top areas that I can recommend for a pleasant, hassle-free stay in The City. The hotel is a very nice, modern, clean highrise with excellent staff and service. Has a quaint bar lounge too. Beware however, Valet Parking at the hotel ain't cheap... $70, which is not too bad if staying multiple days (we only stayed one night, so it was a pretty big hit for that). I would recommend a nearby parking garage, which has got to be about half that cost (except garage will not likely have in-out privileges, which the hotel does - we walked or Ubered everywhere we wanted to go, so we never used our car). Great hotel, will return.

review.title: Contemporary and upscale
review.reviewText:
Critical to know that the valet is located on Clay St and NOT available from the Battery St side, as the address implies - especially since traffic in this area is typically extremely heavy (you feel like you are sitting in a parking lot) and these are all one-way streets. So if you've driven down Battery St, you will need to go around the block to Clay St. 

Usually stay at Argonaut on Fisherman's Wharf when I come to SF and favor 4- and 5-star hotels. This was the first time staying at this hotel, and found it to be comfortable, contemporary and upscale. Compared to the accomodations received at Kimpton Hotels, this hotel had fewer but room was very clean and the staff were friendly but not as attentive. This used to be the Park Hyatt Hotel and is located in a convenient area - short walk to shopping and the Ferry building.

No Keurig or coffeemaker in my room - had to  request one; and while they responded promptly, it was disappointing that they only brought an electric teakettle & cups MINUS any bottled water, tea, (or coffee), cream, sugar, or spoons.  All things considered, I would stay here again.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for staying with and providing your feedback. I am truly sorry about the noise from the group outside and completely understand how frustrating this must have been for you. Although we do not receive any warning about when the protestors will gather and can legally do nothing to intervene, we do want you to know that it is rare for them to be here. Lately, it has been very quiet without any disturbances, and you experienced an unfortunate exception when the activity resumed for a temporary period during your stay. Since none of the protestors are affiliated with our hotel, we have no ability to alter this situation, and although it is out of our control, we hope you will accept our apologies that the noise disrupted your sleep.

 

I am also concerned to know that you experienced some issues in your room, and I wish that our management team had been alerted of them prior to your departure so we could do everything possible to make your stay more comfortable. 

We hope that on your next visit to San Francisco, you will give us another opportunity to provide you with the relaxing, high-quality experience you expected and deserve.

review.title: Unfortunate loud protesters.
review.reviewText: Couldn't sleep due to loud protesters and the room wasn't 100%.

managementResponses.response: Thank you very much for taking a moment to share your experience with us. We're delighted to know that your overall stay was worth five stars and that you had so much fun in San Francisco! We're a little disappointed to know that you felt breakfast was overpriced, but we do feel that we offer great value given all of the delicious options to choose from. We sincerely thank you again, and we can't wait to see you the next time you return to the area!

managementResponses.response: That is truly so great to hear, and thank you for letting us know, Robert. We aim to provide all of our guests with a five-star experience, and it is the best feeling for us when guests let us know that we achieved our goal! We are excited for our next chance to welcome you back for another equally wonderful stay.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback and your patronage. We recently completed a comprehensive remodel of our guest rooms and have received wonderful feedback so far, but we understand that everyone has different tastes and are sorry to know that the style of the restroom was not to your liking. We are happy, however, that you enjoyed the balcony, and we hope that overall, you enjoyed your stay in San Francisco. We hope to welcome you back again in the future!

managementResponses.response:
Hello, and thank you for your feedback. We absolutely sympathize with you regarding the early-morning disturbance caused by the protestors during your last stay with us. We understand how hard it is not to get a good night’s sleep, and we truly regret that you had to experience this.

 

Unfortunately, as the protestors have no affiliation with the hotel, we have no control over their actions. The protest was carefully carried out within the letter of the law as set down by both Federal and City ordinances, and we are unable to interfere with the protestors’ legal rights.  Also, it is true that they were at the property for a three days this week, but prior to this, they were not here for months. We unfortunately have no way of anticipating when they will be here. 

 

We are a non-union hotel with wonderful and passionate associates who work in a very supportive and respectful work environment. In fact, our Associate Opinion Survey came in at 93% associate satisfaction for 2015.  None of the protestors that have protested in front of our hotel are associates of our hotel. We compensate our associates well and provide complimentary meals, affordable health insurance for them and their families, a 401K with a company match, and three days of Zumba (complimentary) in support of their health and wellness.

 

We do sincerely wish there was more we could to support our guests and associates in these instances, and we are truly sorry that you were disturbed. Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments.

managementResponses.response: We truly appreciate your feedback, and we're so glad to hear that overall, your stay with us was great. review.title: Great quick stay
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it's very close to my San Fran office - I didn't realize it was part of Starwood.  Despite my lack of recent or heavy Starwood 'activity', they still treated me exceptionally well (they upgraded my room, which includes little perks like free bottled water).  They also had complimentary illy coffee in the morning - VERY nice perk. Also probably one of the larger, nicer fitness centers I've used at a hotel.  I'd recommend this hotel and stay there again myself.

managementResponses.response: Hello and thank you very much for your feedback. I am sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations during your recent visit with us. I apologize for the mechanical issues you experienced with your room accommodations. The comfort of our guest is our first priority, so I was happy to hear that once these issues were brought to our attention we were able to resolve the problems and offer compensation for the inconveniences you experienced. In the end, I appreciate your balanced assessment of our hotel and I hope that you will give us a chance to make up our shortcomings in a future visit.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: We booked at Le Meridien months ago for our stay last weekend. We were looking forward to a nice hotel and weekend away. The location is great. Lobby was nice with an adjacent bar with great drinks and snacks. At first glance the room was impressive. We were located by the elevator which was loud with people coming and going late at night. The bathroom was poorly planned. A light over the toilet and one in the shower. No light over the vanity which made it incredibly hard to see. The bathroom door was clunky and didn't close all of the way. No privacy whatsoever. On the 2nd day after an uncomfortable, hot night we discovered our thermostat didn't work - on our way out we reported it to the front desk. The asked when they could have someone show us how to use it. Clearly that was not the problem.......an engineer went in to fix it and they left a msg saying it was fixed. Sat night was incredibly loud again being near elevator, but thankfully room was cooler. Upon checkout the agent was gracious and listened to our concerns. She comped our last day's breakfast, which was nice - however the experience and room in this hotel certainly was nowhere near a 4* hotel. if you're looking for a great location this Hotel may be great for you. If you're looking for a comfortable experience with a bit of luxury then you should keep looking. Has potential but definitely does not live up to its advertising.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the views, the bedroom area, Windows, the restaurant (though a bit on the expensive side) and the bar in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk service, bathroom lighting and shower area. Wifi in room would be nice, based on the price.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants, only a few blocks to the Califirnia Street Trolley. Great location to get to multiple tourist destinatioBs. Very walkable location.

We requested a room that faced the water which was a nice touch.  Staff were great to deal with, and hotel had a clean and mostly contemporary look to it.  They include complementary tea and coffee at the restaurant in the hotel, but I wish they would add some free snack items like fruit and pastries.

Very pleasant stay overall and I would stay again!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for writing. I am sorry you were disappointed by the time the bar closed. Our posted closing time for the bar is 12am and unfortunately we cannot stay open later on New Year's Eve for the safety and security of our guests. Based on the history of the night, the majority of the bars in the area close at this time on NYE due to the large event at the Embarcadero letting out. It would not be a comfortable place for our guests if the huge crowds walking from the event came in for a drink. We appreciate you staying with us and hope you have a great 2015.

review.title: Close to the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: The location was excellent for walking to the Embarcadero, the Ferry Building and ChinaTown. It was also close to Union Square shopping. Public transportation was easily accessed. The Wharf was a good mile long walk. The location of the hotel being in the Financial District made finding evening dining options rather tricky.  The hotel staff at reception was mediocre. One or two of the concierges were excellent but other staff members were inept and not helpful.  Staff should know the hours of the in hotel restaurant and Bar 333. The comfort of our room was lovely, always cleaned well and relatively quiet. There is a fire station nearby and that was loud being that we were on the 5th floor. Overall it was a good stay and I would recommend the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and linens were very nice. The bathroom was also very nice.  Everything was cleaned very well each day.
review.negativeRemarks: Train the staff to be welcoming, to offer you maps of the area upon check in and to know the hours of their own restaurant and bar. Hospitality!

review.title: Great location near embarcadero
review.reviewText:
Location allows you to walk to most sites or to take local transportation which is frequent and well-priced especially if you are 65 and over. BART is a 5 minute walk and the best way to get to the airport. Lots of great restaurants around and priced for every budget. You do not want a car in SF as traffic is horrendous downtown.
A Safeway (grocery store) is a 10 minute walk and Fisherman's wharf is about a 20 minute lovely walk along the water.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quick check-in and courteous staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of furniture: armchair was terribly stained.No in-room coffee/tea but staff provided it when requested. Uneven daily housekeeping.

review.title: Great location in the Financial District
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel because of the location. After reading other reviews about it we decided to stay here instead of the Fisherman's Wharf area, where it is noisy and touristy. We were able to walk to the Exploratorium with our two children ages 12 and 5. There is an outside shopping center called Embarcadero Center with boutique shops and restaurants.  We were able to walk the entire distance of the center all the way to the pier section/Port of San Francisco (there are some stairs, walking bridges and escalators within each of the four buildings. The Exploratorium is down at pier 15, so it's about 8 blocks total if you walk through the Embarcadero Center. There is also a playground across the street from the Port of San Francisco pier area where we wore out our 5 year old. 

By walking through the Embarcadero Center using a series of staired bridges connecting the Embarcadero Center, we were to walk to the pier area without having to cross any streets below the bridges. There are other ways/streets to get to the Exploratorium, but going through the Embarcadero Center was the most convenient and safe way for our family.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean, quiet and in a great location. Employees were very accomodating and friendly. We were upgraded to a larger room on the 13th floor
review.negativeRemarks: The parking situation. Valet parking only at the cost of around $50 plus tax! The prices of food in the restaurant was expensive, so bring snacks!
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is close fairly close to everything. There is a movie theater across the street in the Embarcadero Center. Lots of restaurants in the area.

review.reviewText: We stayed here thanksgivings weekend. Awesome staff. Great location. we never used our car the whole weekend. Parked it across the street in the city parking lot. The location is great and clean. Super safe.

review.title: Very good hotel for the money.
review.reviewText: If you need a hotel room near The Embarcadero this is a great place to stay.  Clean rooms and comfortable beds.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Second time we stayed there. Well located, great staff. Breakfast typically S F expensive but good. Will definitely return.
Nice and clean. Have stayed at this hotel many times.

review.title: Absolutely Amazing Stay
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to suite when we arrived for our 3 day Thaksgiving weekend.  Clean, comfortable and nice location.  Had to book an additional night due to canceled flight, upgraded AGAIN.  The views of the Bay Bridge and Coit Tower were gorgeous.  Cindy at the front desk was kind, knowledgeable and gave us a once in a lifetime experience.  SO THANKFUL!  Will definitely return!!!

review.title: Nice at this price
review.reviewText: We got a great price during an Expedia savings event -- almost half of the regular rate! Would stay here again at this price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location -- walking distance to the Ferry Building, excellent restaurants, Chinatown and North Beach.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to request a coffee maker -- but it was delivered immediately. Parking rate is stiff (currently $50+ a day). Noise from other rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Wayfare Tavern and Alfred's Steak House are walking distance/excellent. Also, the Ferry Building Marketplace/Farmers Market and Union Square shops.

review.title: room next to great party
review.reviewText: very cool room, great views, great location. We were attending great party next door and the location was perfect. Very romantic and the views of the Bay Bridge was amazing. Great memories.
review.positiveRemarks: layout, mirror in bedroom, very comfortable bed. Great SF views
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker in room.
review.locationRemarks: Bentley reserve for party right next door

review.title: Great location in Embarcadero area
review.reviewText: Staff was great - got me into a room early and very helpful on exit. Everything you want when traveling.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for writing to us about your recent stay. I am sincerely sorry about the dirty bedding and carpet. There is no excuse for this and there is definitely no excuse for you having to ask twice. I can assure you that this is not the level of service or cleanliness we pride ourselves in. We are sharing your comments with our staff to insure this doesn’t happen to others as we are deeply embarrassed by this situation. We hope that when you are in San Francisco again you will give us another chance.

review.title: Business trip to SF
review.reviewText: I was disappointed. This is allegedly a high end place to stay. My bedding was not clean. I had to ask TWICE to get new bedding. Carpet is dirty. I will likely not return.

review.title: Great Hotel centralized to key destinations
review.reviewText: Valet staff was excellent and very friendly. Front desk was courteous and got us checked in quickly. Met all my requests for my stay. Room was clean comfortable with a beautiful view of the bay bridge.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel: centrally located with a view!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay in San Francisco.  Having a beautiful room with a view to the water was incredible.  The staff were very friendly and helpful; whether it was questions about our stay or recommendations for our trip, everyone was very accommodating.  We were upgraded to a junior suite which gave us a beautiful view and a very spacious, modern room.  While the room was cleaned everyday, and its only a minor complaint, there was some garbage and dirty dishes left in our room throughout the stay - no big deal, just a surprise given the quality of every other part of our stay.  We really look forward to coming back to San Francisco, and we'll definitely stay at Le Meridien again!  Thank you!
review.negativeRemarks: While our room was beautiful, it was strange that there was not completely cleaned everyday.  It was no big deal, just strange.
review.locationRemarks: Very central - easy walk to the Market, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square... Everything!

review.title: gorgeous view for the Bay. close to Columbus
review.reviewText: the place was almost as big as my apartment.. nice living room, clean, comfy bed. nice entertainment console.
review.positiveRemarks: gorgeous view for the Bay. close to Columbus for bars/restaurants. close to public  transportation (BART, bus)
review.locationRemarks: gorgeous view for the Bay. close to Columbus for bars/restaurants. close to public  transportation (BART, bus)

review.title: good。stay
review.reviewText: close to anywhere。bed is very comfortable. room is nice size, staff is helpful.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. You are right to expect better service from us, and we are disappointed to hear that our associate was less than courteous with you. It is not the service we pride ourselves on. We are sharing this interaction with our staff to use as a training tool. You deserve much better as a guest of our hotel, and we hope that you will give us another chance to show you the real, world-class experience upon which we’ve built our reputation.

review.reviewText: Bellman was very rude he was upset we didn't park there he said u better we back in 15 mins. Or well charge u 15 dollars it sure wasn't a nice greeting when we get there. Told them when checked in all they said was sorry. We've stayed before never got kind of treatment

review.title: Ok hotel for business travel in heart of financial
review.reviewText: Room was ready for updating; furniture worn, bed comfortable, on 5th floor felt like the room was in a dark hole between large buildings
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection in business center poor
review.locationRemarks: 20 minute walk to Alcatraz ferry; Starbucks across the street.

review.reviewText:
This hotel is beautiful and modern.  Very clean too!  The room was spacious and light.  Big windows and a huge, plush bed.  The bathroom was also very large and modern.

I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Fabulous bed, fabulous view
review.reviewText: The beds were sooooo comfy.  You just sink down into them.  The view out the window was superb, with views of the bay and one of the bridges.  Excellent concierge service -- always there to help with anything and they got us tickets to Alcatraz when they were technically sold out.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, service and complementary tea and coffee in the dining room in the mornings
review.negativeRemarks: Amenity bottles are impossible to get shampoo, etc. out of.  I spent over 5 minutes trying to get shampoo and conditioner out of the hard plastic .
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Nob Hill a few blocks away as well as Ferry building.  Market Street very nearby with all the major shops.

review.title: Nice hotel situated close to the water
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a very nice place to visit...thoroughly enjoyed my time there.
Lovely view (partial Bay Bridge and water). Great restaurant for dinner! The bar is a great scene - some of the locals come by for happy hour specials.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review and your continued loyalty. . I am pleased that we exceeded your expectations on so many levels and we look forward to welcoming you back!

Thanks,

Emma S
Guest Relations Manager

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel! I usually stay once a month for work. The staff is amazing and very helpful. Sometimes I have to check in early  and usually my room is upgraded wich makes my stay even better.! The hotel is close to, shopping, restaurants, entertainment and transportation

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff is great the hotel is very clean comfortable in a great location. I would definitely stay here again.

managementResponses.response: Please accept my sincerest apologies for the unsatisfactory stay you had during your time with us. What you described here is not the level of service expected of our employees and our product. We are reviewing the cleanliness issues with our team to insure that our standards are met. We also appreciate your comments about the unfriendly bar staff. These will help us in our daily training meetings to improve for the future. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and we hope we have an opportunity to see you again the future. We have high expectations for ourselves and are all sorry we missed the mark on your experience.

review.title: Dirty Floors/Carpets, smelly rooms,garbage in hall
review.reviewText: unfriendly bar staff, no coffee maker in room, outdated hotel not at all what pictures showed or what was described view was obstructed of the bridge

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A great trip requires a good nights rest. We got it at the Le Meridian, Bed was very comfortable. Room Clean, spacious and quiet. Bonus points. Great view of San Francisco Bay.   Food was delicious in the restaurant and the bar.  The concierge was very helpful and gave us great suggestions of what to do and see in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Food was a bit pricey, but was definitely delicious.

review.reviewText:
excellent location and the price was right 
wouldstaythere again
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: nest good transporation

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel for access to Town / Shops and Fisherman's Wharf which is a pleasant 10 / 15 min walk away easily accessible.  Safe area never felt slightly apprehensive walking around the are at anytime lots of coffee shops and a supermarket in the Gateway area about 2 mins round the corner.

Must have the most comfortable bed I have ver slept in.  Gym is good too, only thing missing is a pool, but then you can't have everything.  Amazing views of the harbour and Pyramid building / Coit Tower.  Well worth the money.
review.positiveRemarks: The views, bed comfort and location.
review.negativeRemarks: A swimming pool would have made it near perfect.
review.locationRemarks: As above, great for accessing everything BART station is only 5 mins easy walk so didn't have to wast money on Taxis to airport.

review.reviewText: Very comfortable, quiet room. Great view of the bay.

managementResponses.response:
We are all pleased to hear you had a wonderful stay & we look forward to welcoming you back!

Many Thanks,
Emma S
Guest Relations Manager

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Wonderful room, amazing views, helpful staff... We will return to Le Meridien!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for staying with us! Unfortunately due to being in a city there is not a lot of parking spaces which is why the rates are so high. Our pricing is competitive across similar hotels in San Francisco. I hope that your time in SF was enjoyable regardless!

Guest Relations Manager

review.title: Nice hotel close to the embarcadero and downtown
review.reviewText: Beautiful San Francisco but parking rate throught the city, it is extremely expensive. This problem discourage anyone to come back.

review.title: Awesome Experience
review.reviewText: Everything was consistent with most of the reviews I read before booking this hotel. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Concierge took care of us and was always available to help. We had to call as we got locked out of our room safe. Within 10 minutes, someone was there to address the problem. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff. Check in/check out took less than 2 minutes. Location was perfect. Short walk to downtown or the Waterfront
review.negativeRemarks: The price of breakfast was too expensive in comparison to everything close by. Price of parking does not encourage anyone to rent a car
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do and see along the waterfront. Easy walk to Coit tower and downtown. Need a car if you want to visit Golden Gate park etc..

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: I couldn't have wished for a better hotel stay while visiting San Francisco. Very clean and comfortable.

managementResponses.response:

Many Thanks,
Emma S
Guest Relations Manager

review.title: Easy access to everwhere we wanted to see.
review.reviewText:
a quick walk to the bart, Chinatown, Little Italy, Embarcadero, Union Square. 
Sbucks across the street closes early though!! 
Very tidy room, comfy pillows!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for writing. We appreciate you letting us know about your experience at the hotel. I am sorry about the noise you heard in your room. San Francisco is a bustling city but we understand how disappointing it is to be woken up from noise. Please accept our apology and I hope despite this negative first experience you will stay with us again next time you are in San Francisco.

review.title: Noisy rooms
review.reviewText: Not sure if they really have noise concealing windows or not. I was virtually kicked out of my bed by some people shouting slogans very early in a day outside the hotel. It was as clear as there is nothing between them and me on 14th floor.

review.title: Great Hotel in the City
review.reviewText: My partner and I stayed over the weekend for a mini getaway and it was absolutely beautiful. Quiet side of town although extremely close to the piers and Chinatown if you don't mind the walk. We discover a small walk way from third floor out doors above the streets that takes you all the way to the street before the pier. Love the wide windows!
Nice location.  Rooms were ok.  Staff were ok too not too friendly or helpful.  Just ok

Nice proximity to the Ferry building, heart of the SF financial district. Good breakfast place across the street (Elephant Bar) and the Tadich Restaurant is a classic dating back to 1849. Lots of walking required.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Best: morning street fair for local artisans

review.title: Great stay in SF
review.reviewText: Best vacation in 7 years. Rode bicycles over Golden gate bridge, took harbor tour, rode the cable cars, went to the Academy of Science in golden gate park, and did LOTS of walking. Weather was near perfect everyday, with high around 70 and lows about 60. Found some very nice places to eat, too. John's Grill was excellent. Last day we rented car and drove along US 1.  Looking forward to coming back someday soon.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Room was very clean. Staff was super helpful with recommendations on places to eat and how to get around SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, except a cheaper rate!
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to Market street, cable car, and only 3 blocks to pier 1.

review.title: Nice business location
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located in business district.  Informal meeting facilities are wonderful as is the outdoor spaces.
review.locationRemarks: Minutes from the waterfront and other sites in SF.

review.title: San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was good. Close to Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39. Hotel was comfortable. Parking pricy $61 per night, we did it for the ease and convenience.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Love the modern décor. Incredibly spacious for a city!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, staff was amazing, room was quiet, bed was comfortable.  Close to China Town and union square which was nice.  The dessert menu is epic.  Would go back for sure.
Very pleasant hotel.  I wish the work out room was on an upper floor with windows though.

Staff was excellent.  Bath towels were kinda chintzy for such a place & there was no top sheet on the - just
the duvet, kinda weird.
review.negativeRemarks: Towels & a top sheet.
review.locationRemarks: Good location near the Embarcadero.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for writing to us about your recent stay. I am sorry that your stay left you feeling under whelmed. That is really is disappointing for me to hear. I hope you got to experience many of the local attractions as there are so many great things to do around us and our concierge team would be more than happy to help organize a memorable trip for you. We hope to see you again in the future.

review.reviewText: A really underwhelming hotel at a really high price.

review.title: Great business hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed for one night. Room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom is was a bit small and outdated. Staff was very friendly at the check in. Great location and walking distance to embarcadero, ferry marketplace and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and size of the room
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms and bathrooms as they are getting tired.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants

review.title: close to everthing we needed
review.reviewText: A great way to celebrate my birthday with wonderful eateries close by and beautiful walks. Highly recomended, the staff were very helpful and friendly, would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very modern and clean, close to the pier, within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: A dinning room that is available for evening dinner.
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping on Market street. A few minutes walk to the pier,

review.title: Expensive, but worth it!
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at Le Meridien San Francisco several times now.  From my point of view, it is perfectly located for a number of reasons.  If you are lucky enough to get a higher floor with a view of the Bay, you are in for a visual treat.

The rooms are very comfortable, especially the beds, and the staff with whom I dealt with at every level were efficient, friendly, and really seemed to be glad to work at the hotel and assist guests.
review.positiveRemarks: Superb service, comfortable rooms, great atmosphere, good location.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything, with one exception.  There is a new "art installation" in the lobby.  The art is modern and in my opinion not very good.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you want to see the Giants at AT&T Park, if you have business to do you're right next to the business district.

review.reviewText: Concierge was the best! I loved going to them every morning, they would help plan out the day!
review.negativeRemarks: Ac didn't get lower than 65 but was ok

review.title: Friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for its close location to the start line of the S.F. Marathon which my daughter ran.  The staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay.  We were always greeted with a hello and "welcome back" by the doorman.  The concierge provided us with helpful information about places to eat and how to get around.  We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location for San Francisco Marathon
review.reviewText:
Only 5 minutes from the start line.
Comfortable!
Understanding staff regarding shabbat access, thankful for that.
review.negativeRemarks: The room bathroom needs a real door, not a sliding door.
review.locationRemarks: Race start, Union Square, Chabad San Francisco

review.title: Pretty good.
review.reviewText: Was a nice hotel. In the financial district, so hardly any restaurants open nearby... Place across the street (elephant & castle) was TERRIBLE. Service was awful and we walked out the second time. Pretty close to the usual areas, but cans can be expensive... The hotel reaturant is even more expensive. The parking fee is ridiculous.... It was nice, but I would probably go somewhere else next time.

review.title: This property was ideally situated for our visit.
review.reviewText: Staff were great, room was spacious and comfortable and easy access to the North Beach neighbourhood as well as the Embarcadero/waterfront piers.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room comfort and helpful, friendly staff.  Nice city/partial bay view from the 21st floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in room and newspaper delivered to door.
review.locationRemarks: For us, this property was in a perfect location.  Easy access to various modes of transport (cablecar, bus, streetcar, BART, ferries) .

review.title: Close to Financial Center, Shopping and Restaurant
review.reviewText: I was attending business meetings in town and wanted quiet comfortable place with plenty of nice restaurants within walking distance.  The staff were very helpful and professional. My stay was very comfortable and relaxing.

review.title: Great location, very clean hotel, responsive staff
review.reviewText:
It was a nice stay. Although the hotel is trying to look more like for rich people and all visitors and the staff tried to keep standoffish look, at the end of all everyone was very kind and responsive, so I'd rather treat this as a tribute to European style than a real wish to show their superiority. 

Room was clean, calm, ample, and had a very nice view at the city center. The furniture is modern, new, the bath is roomy, comfortable... the bed? the bed was too big and too cozy for one :)
Rooms were clean, large and well laid out.  Beds were reasonably comfortable, lighting was excellent, enjoyable view from the windows.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely rooms, large, each room had a view of a section of Bay Bridge and the Bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could use a little more training.  Our electronic room key stopped working and it took three trips to the front desk and the manager to get in.

review.title: Modern hotel
review.reviewText: The room was a very good size with an incredible view! However the air conditioner was not at its best. Aside from that it was excellent and I would recommend it to anyone.
nice hotel with great location and friendly staff.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Very nice modern rooms, comfortable beds, great staff, nice view
review.locationRemarks: Close to businesses that most close early, but just hop a trolley to go where we wanted

review.title: Great.............
review.reviewText: Great Hotel...... Like to stay again............Good place to move around from hotel location

review.title: Great views
review.reviewText: We stayed in a executive room on the 17th floor. It had great views of the bay. We could also see the bay bridge.
Very nice hotel. Enjoyed our stay. Just be prepared to pay $65 per night if you need to park your car.

review.title: Nice hotel close to piers and BART
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for it's proximity to the piers and to the train stations as we were going to tour alcatraz and were going to 4 baseball games in Oakland. The hotel was very nice and was only a ten minute walk from the train and a 25 minute walk from the piers

review.title: Nice hotel but not for a long stay with family
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and staff. Bed not very comfortable. And not very many place to grab a quick bite. Housekeeping was very good. Walking distance to fishermans wharp and Alcatraz attraction. Recommend not having a car because parking is 33.00 a night.

review.title: Nice location, close to transit and restaurants
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff. Close to public transit, Chinatown, Little Italy.

review.title: Great hotel to stay!
review.reviewText: Clean hotel on very convinient spot. If you like shopping: Embarcadero is next door!!! Everything is in a walking distance!!!

review.title: Beautiful, clean hotel near the pier!
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect, from check-in to check-out. The staff was kind enough to hold our belongings in store after check-out while we went on the Alcatraz tour. We will be back. I cannot imagine staying at another hotel in San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Furniture, bedding, room arrangement, clean and functioning gym with complimentary headphones and apple!
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints, it was an oasis
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero Center, Pier, Boudin café, Chinatown a few blocks up, Bart a few blocks away, Buses and cable cars all nearby

review.title: Honeymoon in Heaven
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and the view was amazing. We were able to walk and ride public transportation everywhere. The hotel staff is very helpful.  I recommend this hotel. My husband and I will definitely return. We upgraded for a very low cost. This hotel was perfect for us!

review.title: First time at hotel and was excellent
review.reviewText: Tried this hotel because they had a promotional rate going on.  As this was my first experience with this hotel, I had no expectations except seeing the rating on expedia; for which I have booked many hotels and flights.  Staff was great.  The room was great.  I had a excellent view (your room may vary of course).  It is easy walk to Embaracero BART ie easy to get around; especially back to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallways look like they could use some cleaning (carpet and wall scuffs).

managementResponses.response: Hello and thank you for your feedback. I have been in contact with the Valet Department and they are aware of your situation and are in the process of opening a claim with our insurance company. I do apologize that this happened and we will do what is necessary to ensure that your tire is repaired to your satisfaction. Again our apologies for this inconvenience.

review.title: Hotel staff was great. Valet is aweful
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was amazing this entire trip and the rooms were wonderful. Unfortunately the valet was a different story. I was forced to pay $120 in valet fees even after they curbed my car wheels right in front of me. They used it as a bribe. "We will pay for your parking if you don't have us file a claim." Obviously the wheel was going to need replacement and the whole situation was not handled professionally

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great staff. Close to BART station.
Very nice, the only down side was the Union Workers screaming when we first arrived.
review.negativeRemarks: No Union Workers picketing

review.title: Fabulously modern hotel
review.reviewText: My stay was great but a few things need attention. I would consider staying at this hotel again but would make allowances for a couple of things. The rooms are very spacious, modern, comfortable and stylish. The bathroom was large and I loved the cleanliness of everything. The restaurant is no longer used. It is now a breakfast only room which was a pity as I chose the hotel due to it having a restaurant as I don't know the city to go find places to eat. This is annoying as Expedia are still showing and labelling as such 11 pictures of the hotel's "restaurant". On check-in the noise coming from the very full bar with it's loud tecno music made me ask if that was the entrance to a club. I also had to ask the receptionist to keep repeating her questions as I could not hear fully what she was saying as it was so loud. Turns out the bar doubles as a small menu evening restaurant - far too loud and full for that I'm afraid. The staff were wonderful and attentive and the concierge delightful. Don't get a room near the elevators as my room was as I could here them whoosh up and down all night. I was woken very early by protesters in the street who are in dispute with the hotel but the receptionist was very apologetic and moved me to a higher floor on the other side for the rest of my stay and gave me a free breakfast which I appreciated as her hands were apparently tied as the protesters were legal. Views from the rooms are amazing on the higher floors
review.positiveRemarks: Attentive and helpful staff, lovely modern rooms, beautifully comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: A hotel this size needs its own restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great as near buses, Metro, cable car and streetcars to all sites further away. Fabulous street market nearby at Ferry Building on a Sat'

review.reviewText: This is a really nice hotel. It's ran by Starwood and is very comparable to a W. Location is perfect. My only concern was that we booked a double bed room with free valet parking. When we checked in, they did not have a double bed room. They did give us a suite and a rollaway bed... however, we would have preferred the double bed room that we asked for when booking. They also did not have the free parking on record, thank goodness we had the email confirmation from Expedia. So I would say good hotel, just save your email that Expedia sends you when you book the room because chances are you will need it at check in.

review.title: High price, for a so so stay
review.reviewText: With the expense of the room I expected an excellent hotel stay. Don't get me wrong there were positives with the comfy bed, friendly staff, modern decor, and beautiful view but I was disappointed about a few things. Number one being that the vents brought in the smell of marijuana being smoked in another room and it was nauseating, second that the walls were paper thin and I was able to hear my neighbors conversations late at night, and third was the 54 dollar a night parking fee (across the street the garage is 32 a night, just go there). Overall, I won't be staying here again.

review.title: Not my idea of a good time...
review.reviewText: We spent three days around New Years Eve. Perhaps they were overloaded? Initially, you should know that parking is $53 per day which is ridiculous! They have a text system to let the valets know you need your car, but even when I gave them 10 minutes notice, the car was never ready to go. They had trouble with their card key system, so our keys didn't work. Twice! The room was nice. Bed was comfy and the bathroom was nicely sized. The bar (and especially the bartender) were AWESOME. The family in the room next door had a screaming kid which was a serious issue. But my main beef with them was housekeeping. When we arrived, the room was not really clean. The bed was made, and the bathroom clean, but there was an empty water bottle under a chair and a few papers scattered around on the desk and floor. There were no robes, so we called down and were told they were out of them till the next day! On NY Eve day, the room was poorly serviced. Empty glasses and bottles were left in the room.(I put them in the hall) They left a notice on the bed saying no guests, no partying, etc. Would have been nice if they disclosed that before booking rooms over New Years Eve! Regardless, we (quietly) had a few friends over. Drank some champagne and had some munchies. The next day, the room was again "cleaned" meaning they made the bed and changed the towels. But everything else was left a mess. Empty bottles and room service trays left everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The bar was very nice and the bartender suggested a few local spots that were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Was ok.. The most dissapointing thing was the dirty bathroom...looked like no one cleaned it before the previous guests: the bathtub was filled w long dark hair, and the sink and the mirrors were filthy.. Overall was ok, but if wouldn't give it a 4 stars.
