review.title: Best place under 150$ budget in SF
review.reviewText: Comparing with several hotels I stayed in SF, this one is the best one and in a reasonable price!

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location, but lots of charges
review.reviewText: We did enjoy our stay overall in this hotel, but some things were disappointing. Parking is hugely expensive as is the internet. $12 per device for internet is crazy. The food is also very pricey. $17 for oatmeal and a pastry? $14 drinks? Go elsewhere for your food- (Drinks at Comstock or Elephant & Castle across the street, or Mexican breakfast at Tlaloc around the corner). The room had a nice view which we were told was an upgrade as the our room was still not ready even at 4:00pm. There was confusion at the desk and it was not a good experience there. Very shallow bath tub so not a good place to soak. Only one robe offered in room. Overall it was good, but would not stay again unless I had a really great rate.

review.title: Good location, surly service, bad wifi, noisy room
review.reviewText: We had a very disappointing experience here. The service was rude and brusque at check-in, not at all welcoming. The extremely overpriced wifi service in the rooms did not work (log in page never loaded), and people were using the free wifi in the lobby instead, leading to a crowded, strange, uncomfortable vibe in the lobby inconsistent with the chain's luxury image as people hung around with laptops and pajamas etc. to get online. Finally, although the pictures in this hotel's listings on Expedia made it appear that only one class of room has connecting doors (and we booked a higher class specifically to avoid connecting doors), many of the rooms apparently have connecting doors, which would not be a problem except that they carry noise so clearly and loudly between rooms. The room adjoining ours had a small child or baby whose crying and screaming we could hear through the door for several hours (on our wedding anniversary, no less -- so romantic...). Since we had seen the rude treatment another guest received when asking if there were any other available rooms while we were checking in, we felt that asking to switch rooms might lead to an even less pleasant experience than an infant screaming so loudly it seemed we were in the same room. Obviously, babies cry. That was not our complaint. I fault the hotel for putting an infant in a room with poor sound isolation. Furnishings were also dated, carpets stained, overall not a good experience. Will not return.
review.positiveRemarks: The view from our room was great, bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets could be cleaned or replaced, more attention could be paid to placing guests with noisy children in rooms with better sound isolation.

review.title: Great location but not for the weekend

The location - in the financial district - gives great access to public transport, the Ferry Building, Market Street, SoMa, lots of other things. But on the weekend the local area is pretty dead, as nobody lives nearby, they just work there.

review.title: Excellent hotel, Wonderful staff..
review.reviewText:
We were in the city for ballet & shopping. My daughter wanted to stay here as she has enjoyed this hotel in the past. I usually stay at the Parc55 which is a fabulous place if you want to walk to Union Square/shopping!
The staff was impeccable! Very friendly. They took care of everything we needed. The valet staff are superior to any other. Our car was always waiting for us no matter how quickly we arrived for it!
The hotel was also very easy to get to and from. The room was in great shape with everything you could need. Pillows were high quality but down so they flattened out a bit too much for me. The bed, although not the best I've ever slept on, was quite comfortable.
I would highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay in this area of the city.

review.title: Isn't it funny how one poor customer service
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at the Meridien several times, and always enjoy it's comfortable and cozy feel, great room rates, and proximity to Union square and Embarcadero. A shame then that our stay last week was spoiled by a hotel parking attendant. I pulled up in front of the hotel and sat in the car whilst my wife ran in to pick up her overnight bag at reception. There was a car in fron of me loading their stuff as well. The back of my car was over hanging the entrance to the concierge parking area slightly. You could still have driven a truck through without any concern. The young attendant came over and told me to move. I explained my wife would be out in literally 1 minute, he insisted I move. I told him I would move as soon as someone needed to drive in.. Nope, you have to move now. I moved the car around the corner and walked back to find my wife waiting for me at the curb.

I understand there are rules, and safety issues at play here...but really?? Have some common sense. Ruined the entire day for me. I hope Karma does it's thing.

review.title: The best non-boutique hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: For a big, non-boutique hotel, Le Meridien is my new favourite. Big clean, modern rooms, friendly staff. Location is great too. I stayed there for a conference that was held in Union Square, which is a 15 minute walk. Likewise, about 15 minutes to walk to the pier. Would stay again. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great hotel, boring area
review.reviewText: The bar and lounge area were amazing! The drinks, wait staff and lounge were just the right amount of hip I was looking for. The rooms were large and clean, the bathroom basic, the hotel was quiet and the staff at check-in and the concierge desk were exceptionally friendly and helpful. It was a fabulous hotel that happened to be in the business district, about a mile walk from most activities/restaurants. Fortunately the weather was quite nice during our stay and the walks to Fisherman's Wharf and the Union Square area were actually fun and allowed us to see other parts of town that we wouldn't have otherwise visited (ex. Chinatown, SoMA). I would definitely stay here again!

It was a little awkward at the end of our stay because we waited for the valet to bring our car for 30 minutes. They were extremely busy, and when I was finally able to ask an attendant what was taking so long, he said my car had been parked in the street for the last 20 minutes. HUH? I never saw my car because there were so many others blocking it. Other than that, it was nice, but for the rate, I would rather stay at the Westin.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Great mid-range hotel if you can get a good rate. Main complaint was the parking situation. I couldn't figure out self-park (don't pull into the Le Meridien garage like we did!), and valet set-up is really complicated. If you can park elsewhere, do it. Rooms comfortable and on the large side for San Fran. Very impressed with the layout of the closet/storage space and bathrooms. Plug-in internet available which was fast. Dark entryway, light for closet could be improved. We had a great view, and the location is near like 1000 coffee shops and places to eat. However, this is the Financial District and some coffee shops are not open on the weekends. Very pleasing stay.

review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating
review.locationRemarks: Nice pizza place around corner

review.title: Convenient hotel for business
review.reviewText: Nice SF location and convenient for business trip.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great experience, great staff and location. Hotel is in walking distance from many locations.
review.negativeRemarks: Swimging pool can be added.
review.locationRemarks: Its located in financial district. Fishermans wharf is near by walking distance.

review.title: Night out in the city
review.reviewText:
Check in by 5 and got a side view of the bay bridge wish we had a better view but it was good enough.
Pro
great location
2 blocks down from the pier
couple blocks towards china town and northbeach and westfield mall and union square.
Room clean and bed totally awesome slept like a baby!
Turn on the TV it has a channel on repeat of where to go and eat or what to do while your staying here.
Cons
no free wiifi charge on your account
no free parking- park around the corner for $32 a night but no in an out. but i think the hotel valet for $60 so just self park. But i didnt have a vehicle this time around :p
AC made a racket noise and only one Robe and hair dryer wasnt all that great so ladies bring your own blow dryer.
review.positiveRemarks: Great locations and room clean and comphy
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from the pier walking distance to china town west field mall and northbeach

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Everything from the front counter, valet and the rooms was above standard. Would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Door man had an aditude.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do.

review.title: Local getaway
review.reviewText: I've stayed a here a few times and have had a great experience each time.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of parking on the weekends is near everything to do in sf

review.title: Nice hotel and very clean.
review.reviewText: There was a great view of the bay from our room. We were close to everywhere we needed to go.

review.title: Good Location to everything and nice stay
review.reviewText: Its nice hotel and a great location to everything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, whether business or pleasure, to stay here.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience- would recommend this hotel. Location is perfect for exploring the City.

review.title: Center of financial district
review.reviewText: Hotel very nice overall. Only two complaints: my "non-smoking" room smelled like cigarette smoke -- not recent smoke but definitely a smoking room in the past. (Hotels seem to think that a room can be changed to non-smoking by changing the designation. Hah -- it smells like smoke until it's completely stripped and redecorated.). Also no free WiFi. At this price level, I expect free WiFi in my room, since everyone on the planet now uses it daily. Hotel staff super nice and helpful. Very clean everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet service
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Embarcadero

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: The one negative: We arrived at 1:30. Told that room would be ready at 3:00. Returned at 3:00 -- room still not ready. Room not ready until 4:00 PM.
review.positiveRemarks: Located in a convenient downtown area -- close to transit.
review.negativeRemarks: The full breakfast offered is far too expensive. Cut the price to $9-10, and you would have three times the number of guests taking breakfast.

review.title: Service doesn't feel like a 4 star
review.reviewText: If you had stayed at a 4 star hotel before, you probably won't be impressed with the service. I didn't feel the eagerness to serve from the staff and the hotel culture. It's an OK experience, but I didn't get the wow experience I am used to getting from 4+ star hotels. In the end it's good enough, but not great.

review.title: Top Notch Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location; directly next to Embarcadero Center; short distance from the Wharf. Beautiful upscale hotel. Double bed room was spacious; view of the ocean. Concierge was helpful with dinner suggestions. Valet parking w/ in and out privileges; you can text them when you want your car. Had breakfast at the in-house restaurant. Pricey but good. Would have been nice if they had laundry machines and free internet, but I've learned that you usually don't get that at an upscale hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: free internet; shouldn't have to pay given the high price of the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Embarcadero Center. Just a few miles from Golden Gate Park, Japantown, Chinatown.

review.title: Nice Hotel, awesome location.
review.reviewText: Overall good experience. Short on the amenities and a few small issues for the price but it seems that it just how it is in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was always friendly and the location was very centrally located.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a sliding door on the bathroom that didn't provide much privacy. Not enough light in entry way of room. No coffee/tea provided in room.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero, China town, close to BART, Cable Car, MUNI.

review.title: Le Meridien August 2013
review.reviewText: Well after a long drive we were greeted by someone on reception to be told that we were being booked into a twin room and not the king that we provided. Who would have thought that a gay couple would not want to sleep in the same bed and in a San Francisco of all places. Other than that the hotel was a good place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Training of the hotel staff

review.title: Spacious rooms and a great view!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly. They allowed us to borrow a garment steamer to steam a dress and a suit. While the room service I ordered was very steep at $25 for a bowl of oatmeal , they did have free coffee daily on the 3rd floor.
review.positiveRemarks: The room we had on the 11th floor was very spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have liked a coffee maker in my room.
review.locationRemarks: We were only a few blocks from the mass transit, which we took to and from the airport. There were more than enough restaurants to choose from.

review.title: Nice view of Bay Bridge - Financial District
review.reviewText: I would go back to this hotel again. Very convenient location. I could walk to most of my appointments.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, nice view. Very convenient.
review.locationRemarks: I went for a business trip and found this location ideal.

review.title: Great hotel In the Centre of Sanfransisco
review.reviewText: Very clean and spacious rooms. Modern design, in the centre of town but away from the noise. Easy to walk around and get to all major attractions.
review.locationRemarks: Financial Centre, fishermans wharf, china town, market street. 10 to 15 and you're at union square.

review.title: Disappointing stay
review.reviewText:
I asked for a quiet room. I was given a free 'upgrade' and was assured that the rom was very quiet. Instead, the room that I was given overlooked a very busy street. And, even though the room was on the 15th floor, I heard loud traffic noise, which kept me up all night and defeated the purpose of getting a costly hotel room. The parking was over $60 per night, which made the stay even more expensive. Lastly, the bathroom had the smell of body odor.

Upon checkout, the front desk staff did not ask me about my experience, which led me to believe that they didn't care. I was too tired to relay the experience to them and just wanted to leave.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice building. Good geographic location. Nice view of the Bay Bridge. None of these things mattered to me, though, since I wasn't able to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Quietness of room.

review.title: Convenient downtown stay
review.reviewText: The hotel for the conference I attended was full so booked here instead. The room was quite nice and clean and good size.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to the piers, North Beach area and Yerba Buena areas.

review.title: Weekend fun gone awry
review.reviewText: Previous stays here were great. This time was disappointing. No toiletries were provided in the room on the first day, tv didn't work (appeared to be a battery in the remote issue). These issues weren't discovered until late in the evening due to a quick check in before heading out to a cruise on the bay. Hoped to report it to the front desk the next morning, but didn't want to wait behind 8 people in line to check in. On Day two, the service for breakfast in the hotel restaurant was awful. No attempt to warm up our coffee until I flagged down a server, first cup was stone cold by then. Our request for hashbrowns with breakfast resulted in an inedible pile of grease. Thankfully a phone call to the front desk resulted in the remote and tolietries problems being fixed at the end of day two and a final breakfast in tge resturant was much better. However, I was pretty disappointed overall with a hotel that usually provides much better service.
review.negativeRemarks: See above. Better preparation of rooms for guests and improved service in the restaurant.

review.title: Great hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice and close to Chinatown and the ferry building. It is in the financial district so be warned that most eateries around the hotel is closed during weekends. The room is clean and comfortable. The front desk was nice enough to upgrade our room and was chatting with us and smiling the whole time we were checking in. The only thing I did not like was that valet parking was really expensive and right around the corner there is a cheaper parking structure about half the price. Come to think of it I did not see any entrance to a parking garage on the hotel property so maybe they are using the public garage next door. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are nice and the staff is really friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is really expensive.
review.locationRemarks: It's a few blocks from the ferry building which was a nice walk. Most restaurants and cafes around the hotel is closed during weekends.

review.title: Community service weekend
review.reviewText: /rm clean staff very friendly. loved the softness of the bed/ Things were neeat and clean/ Haye the charge for internet and the rip off for parking but then youre in San Fran
review.positiveRemarks: not downtown in unon sq which is really great when you need to rest on a Sat night.y quiet in financial district on weekend .

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: The room was spotless and the hotel staff were friendly and as polite as I have experienced anywhere in the world. The people at the front desk were so helpful on all our questions about San Fransisco and the places to see and how to get around. A wonderful hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The consierge. She was very knowledgable and very friendly. Nothing was too much trouble.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay for wi fi
review.locationRemarks: Great location with restaurants and bars nearby. Close access to ferries and public transport.

review.title: Lovely, Modern, Convenient, Breath-taking Views!
review.reviewText:
I got a fantastic corner suite on a high floor which was simply amazing. I could have stayed for several weeks. No complaints, other than the room service menu is a bit un-interesting and lacking in options. Plus, the food wasn't very good.

However, everything else was top notch!
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was spacious and nice. Views were fantastic. Loved having a bedroom and a living area.
review.negativeRemarks: The food. It's simply not very good.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of touristy stuff and great if you work in the Financial District. Lacking on food delivery and shopping options.

review.title: Amazing view!!!
review.reviewText: Amazing view with the triangle windows with an awesome 180• view. Check in girl told me wr had the best room (for a double full bed) in the house...put us next to an elevator...not so nice. Everything else was spectacular! Except...Don't use valet for $62 a night...or the one they suggest $40ish. We spent $30 a night just a block away...research before ;$
review.negativeRemarks: Staff!!!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf and shopping on market

review.title: Nice hotel with bay view
review.reviewText: Loved my room loved the view very well clean. I would recommend to anyone especially couples who wants to have a romantic night with the city view.

review.title: Lovely hotel, fantastic stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great place to stay in san Francisco. We would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the AirTran station which makes it very easy to get from the airport to the hotel. great shopping great restaurants great experience

review.title: Nice, but $54 for Parking?!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice, and well-located if spending any time near Embarcadero. But $54 is obscene for overnight parking. Even midtown Manhattan (NYC) isn't that much. For hotel a hotel guest, this is extremely greedy. Also, like all hotels which charge for Internet use, it's a horrible public relations misstep. You'd get more goodwill for free wi-fi, which costs the hotel virtually nothing. Of course it's. source of revenue, but a very stingy one for guests.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Staff nice. Nicely appointed room.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wi-fi. And a reasonable overnight parking charge. $54 completely absurd for a hotel guest. Just advertise the room at $50 higher, would be fairer
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants; the Port.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText:
Walking distance to everything and loved "NOT" BEING NEAR FISHERMAN'S WARF (best part).
Perfect for business travelers and couples.

Concierge were both excellent. However, check-in at desk was not welcoming and quite abrupt.
review.negativeRemarks: Overnight Parking fees are outrageous (and this is coming from a New Yorker).

review.title: LE MERIDIEN HOTEL, SAN FRANCISCO - SUPERB
review.reviewText:
My family and I loved San Francisco and we had a wonderful time staying at Le Medridien hotel and we will come book again when we go back to San Francisco. Service was excellent from reception to room cleaners and specially the servers at their 3rd floor dining. We opted for the "eco green" by not changing towels/sheets for the duration of our stay and they have rewarded us with vouchers which we used for our last day breakfast at their dining facility.

My only not so good room comfort was the bed as the middle too caved in but we managed. Location was excellent, smacked in the middle of everything.
review.negativeRemarks: THE BED WE SLEPT IN
review.locationRemarks: SUPERB, SMACKED IN THE MIDDLE OF EVERYTHING

review.title: Top SF Hotel, close to the waterfront.
review.reviewText: Fast & efficient check in by Bernadette to a wonderfully spacious high floor room. Very comfortable bed and a very quiet room with wonderful views of the Bay bridge. Well stocked minibar and great in room amenities. Very nice workout room too!
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the large comfortable room with free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: A coffee shop in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to everything, especially the waterfront which is where all the action is.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with this hotel. The rooms were fairly large and the beds were most comforting. The hotel is conveniently located close to shopping areas, restaurants and transportation to other parts of the city. The Ferry Building with the Piers is within walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Home away from home.
review.reviewText: Loved our room with a great view. The beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was yummy and service excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper parking rAte.

review.title: Yew
review.reviewText: Great hotel, good location, only had to walk half an hour max to get anywhere, great staff, nice clean big rooms

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The location is perfect- walking distance to Chinatown, Little Itlay, the Embarcadero, the Exploratorium and Coit tower. The staff was very helpful- they recommended a fantastic Italian restaurant for dinner (Barbacco) and gave us a phone charger when we lost ours. They even upgraded our room to a business suite for no particular reason. The room was very comfortable and had a great view of the Bay Bridge. Frankly, I cannot think of anything that could have been better about our stay at this hotel. If you can get a good deal on Expedia, do it!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable, the staff was helpful and friendly and the location was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the Embarcadero, the Exploratorium, Coit Tower, Chinatown or Little Italy.

review.title: Convenient hotel god location
review.reviewText: Clean , modern hotel, quiet, a good price from Expedia. Not the most welcoming, but it's not a resort type hotel: we spent only one night, didn't meet a lot of staff. In the Financial center, near Cable car and Embarcadero/ferry's building. Very good restaurant nearby: Perbacco's. For breakfast: Café de la Presse...

review.title: Awesome Hotel in Quiet Financial District Area!
review.reviewText: My wife and I went to SF for our first year wedding anniversary, and we were impressed with the conditions and service of the hotel. When we did our reservation through Expedia (The experts on reservation) we made a note about our special occasion, and the hotel's guest services "Troy" upgraded us to a junior suite with an awesome view of the city and the bay area, and included in our room a bottle of wine with chocolate-covered strawberries. Our room was comfortable and in excellent conditions. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone, but specially couples.
review.positiveRemarks: Let just say, everything. Especially the contemporary interior design and service of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: They should improve, nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!! Close to Chinatown, Ferry Building, Market Street, incredible restaurants and scenic views!!!! To everything you want to visit.

review.title: Pleasantly predictable
review.reviewText:
This is easily a 4 star hotel experience. The front staff is friendly and efficient, rooms were clean and the hotel is well maintained. A good location for getting to places by foot or cab. We had a car and the parking was efficeint if a tad expensive at 55 bucks a night.

We would recommend this hotel as a well priced alternative in an expensive city.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, efficient check in and out.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheap with towels and soap
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get around town location.

review.title: Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: In a week when hotel rooms were scarce, I was lucky to score a corner suite at Le Meridien. The three nights I spent there were among the most comfortable in my many trips to San Francisco. Floor to ceiling windows in the living area, bedroom and bathroom all with Bay views and a balcony off the living room - all for $400 during a peak period. It was like a small appartment - large bath with a separate WC room - all in granite tile.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value for money - professional staff.
review.negativeRemarks: sofa rather than easy chairs in the living room - and new upholstery.
review.locationRemarks: easy walk to many things - financial district, Embarcadero, Ferry Building

review.title: Fantastic View!
review.reviewText: I have every intention of returning to this fantastic hotel! Our room was everything you could ask for - clean, comfortable, spacious, well decorated, quiet - with an amazing view of the Bay! We only had one meal in the restaurant and it was very good. Service was exceptional in the hotel and restaurant. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel is excellent - close enough to walk to many things but with good transportation available! I highly recommend this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: I was disappointed there was no gift shop but shopping is close by.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is very close to embarcadero shopping. The location, in the Financial District, is excellent. The area is clean and safe.

review.title: Wonderful few days
review.reviewText: The room was fantastic. Clean and beautiful!! My best experience though was with the front desk. Check in was very accommodating as well as check out. The people we worked with did everything they could to meet our needs and I am most appreciative. Very positive experience!

review.title: Great hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: Easy walking distance to the Embarcadero, easy access to the Bay Bridge. Very pleasant staff, nice room.

review.title: le meridien, san francisco
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff. Great location. Quick walk to waterfront and Ferry Building.

review.title: Good hotel for a weekend stay in the city
review.reviewText: We've stayed at this hotel twice so far. It's a very nice hotel with pretty close proximity to Tadich Grill. Parking could be pretty expensive here so I recommend parking at a closeby parking lot on Clay St. We were upgraded to a studio size room which was great although we did find the couch was a tad dirty looking. The hotel itself is pretty quiet but you could hear loud flushing toilet noises.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel, perfect location.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it was close to the 2013 SF Marathon start line. There was an Expedia mobile sale (30% off!), so I jumped right on it. The agent at reception was quick to check me in, and I wasn't asked to fill out any info cards, or listen to any extra information that I didn't need. I was up to my room incredibly quickly, and the location was perfect for my event. Nice and close to Pier 39, the Ferry Building, Alioto's, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, quickness of being checked in, comfortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The room wasn't fully cleaned when I arrived. There was hair all over the shower wall, and the window was left open (leaving the room freezing).
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ferry Building, Embarcadero, Giants baseball, Alioto's.

review.title: moy excelente
review.reviewText:
We have good stay very nice invironment we are close to the financial district we arrived there on saturday afternoon and we thought its very remote but we are wrong its a weekend.
the hotel doesn't include breakfast but we like the place.

review.title: Great location and value
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed Le Meridien. It was in a nice, quiet section of the city (Financial District) but was still close enough to all of the attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: While the hotel looks modern, some of the common areas and in-room linens could use "refreshing."

review.title: thirtieth
review.reviewText: It was great overall experience I would do it again in a hart beat.

review.title: If you have to be next to the Embarcadero Center..
review.reviewText:
Needs a makeover. Dated Holiday Inn feel to rooms despite glamorous public areas. Bathroom only marginal. Bedding exceptional but overall furnishing of the junior suite w
was somewhat drab although I had a spectacular Bay view. Valet did not have their act together at times. Front desk very good although when taking room service orders they could be more familiar with their own menu. Room service food was
mediocre. I wasn't able to finish anything I ordered. For the price I'd give up the view and stay elsewhere. It's really only convenient for the business traveler.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of food

review.title: Great value and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Stayed in a studio suite and had a really good nights rest! Staff was pleasant and fast. Considering the location of the hotel (proximity to north beach, embarcadero, and downtown) the prices were very reasonable. Because it's located in the FiDi, the streets are so quiet!
review.negativeRemarks: Though the tv was awesome at the foot of the bed (stayed in a studio suite) I felt it was too much of a wall and blocked a bit of natural light.
review.locationRemarks: North beach is a brisk walk away. A really fun comedy club is across the street!

review.title: Comfortable hotel, good location in financial dist
review.reviewText: Stayed over a weekend the hotel was quiet, comfortable bed, and nice fitness center.
review.negativeRemarks: At check in, hotel front desk gave me my key and said "any questions?" Not helpful or welcoming at all, did not give any instruction on parking.

review.title: Great value for what I paid.
review.reviewText: We got a low, corner room at a pretty good price for the City. Bed was super comfortable, bathroom was a generous size, and the balcony (although in an odd location, door leading out from the bathroom) was a pleasant surprise. I would have liked the room to be higher, but ah well. I would probably say the toiletries could be upgraded. We had to call to get a coffee maker, but this is not a service that is advertised. I was told slippers would cost 3USD each, but they eventually sent them up for free. Towels were nothing to write home about, and there was no free breakfast. I did like the fact that they served illy coffee in the morning on the 3rd floor, but I imagine it's not much extra cost to just offer it all day, no? No pool or spa at the location, and in general, the property is showing it's age by just not being modern enough. For example, the in-room CD-player screams turn of the 21st century (but being Nakamachi, the system was still pretty decent), and the cabinets are a bit worn. All of this nit-picking aside though, the hotel was still a very comfortable stay, located in a decent location. At the price we paid, I would certainly recommend it to other people. And the bed, oh, the bed! Quite comfortable. Not quite a Westin dream bed, but pretty close I guess!
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of facilities, toiletries, no free breakfast, and high parking costs.
review.locationRemarks: This area is pretty dead on the weekends. I liked it because it was still walking distance, but tourists may want to be more in the thick of things.

review.title: A little pricey...but quiet and comfortable.
review.reviewText: My wife and I were looking to escape the chaos of having three young girls, so we planned an overnight in SF. I chose this hotel and really enjoyed it. We took the Ferry in from Vallejo to avoid parking because it is so expensive in the city. The walk from the Ferry building was only a half mile, really easy. Also, we were there on the weekend and since it is in the financial district, it was super quiet. We enjoyed our room on the 22nd floor overlooking part city and part Bay. We enjoyed the lights on the Bay Bridge at night. We walked across the street to the comedy club Punchline and had a hilarious evening. When we got back we slept great in our clean room. By the way, we loved the drapes in the room because when closed our room was pitch black! The hotel may have been a little pricey because there were no amenities like free breakfast, pool/hot tub, etc.. But it was just one night and we were thrilled to get away by ourselves.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricey
review.locationRemarks: Accessible to the Ferry and all the Piers

review.title: Perfect business hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the financial district of SF. Perfect if you have meetings in the area.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel for the price. The only down side was the $54.00 parking per night. Otherwise a very nice hotel with great views.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern/elegent style, great views and location in the financial district.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking at $54.00 a night is a joke.

review.title: Nice hotel, bad location
review.reviewText: Room and overall hotel is very nice, clean and comfortable. Staff are a bit stuffy but ok. Price seems right but if driving to hotel factor another $32 per night for off sight parking. Business district in San Francisco is very hard to get around and finding dining options within walking distance becomes a full time activity.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel could be a lot more accommodating to the non-business traveler.
review.locationRemarks: Unless you are looking to drink at the bar across the street or want to spend all of your time looking at cheap nicknacks in China Town, not much to d

review.title: Great View
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, clean with a great view. Check in and out was easy. Walls are kind of thin so we could here the people next to us.

Good location. You can have easy access to public trans that will take you everywhere and anywhere in the city.

review.title: Super stay
review.reviewText: Location great.Staff super.Would stay again.Easy walk to most attractions
review.negativeRemarks: Could not make a cup of tea in the room

review.title: One of the BEST hotels in SF!
review.reviewText: Once of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed! Modern well-maintained contemporary style hotel facility with outstanding staff that were cheerful and helpful at every point of our visit. While most hotels have less than satisfactory restaurants, Le Meridien's kitchen is outstanding! Although a bit expensive, the food quality is well worth it if you prefer to eat in-room or don't have time to explore other options nearby of which there are many! We ordered breakfast in-room and it was superb! Hotel has everything including a very nice workout facility except a pool - not a big deal when considering the quality of this hotel! You won't be disappointed.
review.locationRemarks: In financial district near the south Piers. We walked (an easy 5 minute jaunt) to Pier 3 to board a Hornblower dinner cruise to tour the bay sites.

review.title: Perfect for business travelers and tourists
review.reviewText:
Stayed at Le Meridien on 5/25 for one evening.
The hotel room was very comfortable and well maintained.
Close to the Ferry Buliding, Embarcadero shopping and
convenient to the financial district.
Highly recommended if you are looking for a more
tranquil stay in San Francisco and you enjoy walking
to see the sights and sounds of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was spacious
review.negativeRemarks: The room service menu was very expensive, but there are very good restaurants nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for business travelers and tourists looking for a more relaxed San Francisco experience.

review.title: Qualitiy Accomodation
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText:
First time in San Fran. great hotel, friendly and helpful staff, great safe location, close to Pier 33 and Cable Car routes.
20 minute (max) flat walk to Alcatraz landing

review.title: Top points
review.reviewText: Great location for business or sightseeing as it's just a few blocks from the Embarcadero BART station and cable car route. Hotel itself was very clean, professional, and welcoming. Workout facilities were perfect and the room was spacious and comfortable. I only ate at the hotel restaurant once (for breakfast) but was very impressed. Also, I really wanted sushi the first night I arrived and the concierge recommended an excellent place.

review.title: Birthday Weekend
review.reviewText: Great location, room views were amazing. We parked at Embarcadero One Parking garage which is right acroos the street. $32 for 24 hours

review.title: 23rd Floor View!
review.reviewText: We loved staying here and wish we could have stayed longer than one day! We had an amazing view of bay side from the 23rd floor! Absolutely breathtaking! It was wonderful and if we are ever back in San Fran we will stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: The view, the newness and freshness of everything and how modern the feel was!
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is $61 per night that is a little on the high side and the internet had to be paid for $12.95 per 24 hrs. Low grade hotels offer free wifi
review.locationRemarks: The location was fabulous! It was centrally located to pier 39 and all that surrounds that area.

review.title: In town for the Giants game.
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly and attentive. Got an upgrade for some reason, but it was a pleasant surprise. The room was roomy with a large bathroom with shower and tub. Nice, comfortable king-size bed. View was of highrise across the street, but that wasn't a problem for us. Our stay was nice and the location is fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Locations, cleanliness, comfortable bed, luxurious accommodations
review.negativeRemarks: The $54 parking fee. I think it's a bit much and even if it was much less, I'm not a fan of the hotel industry's now-common practice of charging
review.locationRemarks: Walked to the Giants' game. Had a bite to eat before the game in the Ferry Building.

review.title: Pleasure & taste without pretention!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at Le Meridien San Francisco. The decor, colouring and finishing touches throughout were amazing. The staff were attentative both to me/other guests and cared about the actual hotel (I noticed one member of staff literally tweaking by half a centimeter the position of a chair in the lobby to ensure it was positioned correctly!). The food was also wonderful. A big hi and thank you to all the staff at breakfast who really looked after me! (Main grip please please have real butter - the foam stuff says cheap & is tasteless and contradicts the overall impression of the hotel). I had dinner a couple of times at the hotel and was impressed by the creativity and mix of flavours. As for the cocktails? Let's just say the Sidecar is now my cocktail of choice. I am a very discerning customer - overall the care and attention was on the genuine side of friendly and courteous and I didn't feel staff were merely hustling for a tip. The $5 discount/or points card in exchange for saving on cleaning your room for one day is a great idea and keeps the envirnoment in mind. I would definitely recommend and go back! Thank you Le Meridien!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff! Courteous, friendly and warm. Decor - clean, modern and tidy. (see my email above). Think tasteful without the prentention.
review.negativeRemarks: The foamy rubbish that passes as butter. Baffling & very bad choice for a hotel that otherwise has great attention to detail! Genuine butter, please!
review.locationRemarks: Good location for China Town & buses to the Piers. About 15 min walk to Union Square. Very good for those working around the Financial District.

review.title: Modern and comfortable
review.reviewText: Spent the weekend at Le Meridien and I'm really happy I chose this hotel. Convenient to get to from the airport via BART, central to downtown, short cab rides to other neighborhoods. The giant bed was exceptionally comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: 4 days in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was a very nice experience, love it , room very huge, lot of space, cleanness, impeccable, close to the shore only 10 min. distance walking to Embarcadero- Promenade Street and Market Street.. Over all 5 star.

review.title: Really convenient and immaculate,clean hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic location ,easy to walk all over the city from here. Rooms are gorgeous and immaculate. Restaurant on ground floor a little pricey but excellent food,good seafood. really enjoyed our stay her and would stay here again.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel overall, and it was in a good walking distance to my conference hotel and to the water. The only thing was that I could hear noise from the next door which was connected by a door (you can lock it for safety) which was not sound-proofed. I also wished there was a coffee/tea maker in the room. But other than that, I enjoyed my stay there with a beautiful view of the water and bay bridge:)
review.positiveRemarks: View of the water and bay bridge
review.negativeRemarks: noise from the neighbor
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located for the purpose of my stay (conference).

review.title: Great hotel for a weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Friendly and accommodating staff, great room with a VERY comfortable bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Yummy room service and getting a late checkout was no problem
review.negativeRemarks: The smell of the carpet -- seemed like there had been a powder or something put on the ground to help eliminate odors, it was a little overpowering
review.locationRemarks: Great location and easy to get around anywhere in the city

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, happy to recommend. Clean, convenient for my purposes. Nice hotel for the price as well.
review.locationRemarks: Great for me

review.title: Pleasant stay.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was easy to get to from the Airport. Took the Bart and then it was about a 5-10 min walk from the Embarcadero Station.
The front staff were prompt and helpful.
The room was clean.
The bed was probably in need of replacement as the mattress dipped in the center. Not good for a bad back.
They had a good sized fitness center.
The hotel was about a 10-15min walk to Market Street, Chinatown and the Pier.
Since it is in the Financial District, not much open on the weekends. Sunday there were almost no restaurants open for dinner. Had to go out to Market street area.
Other than that I'd stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Most things were in 15min walking range.
review.negativeRemarks: the bed was a little lumpy and dipped in the center.
review.locationRemarks: the location was great except on Sunday's everything's closed in the area in the evening.

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: Very nice staff. Concierge is helpful in navigating the city and making plans and arrangements. Very close to the financial district and Embarcadero. We had a very enjoyable stay. Would stay here again.

review.title: Found our peace in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were presented with clean and tidy accomadations. The staff was courteous. We would stay there again. Pretty decent gym. Quiet hotel. Well located making it easy to access everything we wanted to do.
review.negativeRemarks: Doormen
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to access the wharf and downtown. Well within walking distance to the ballpark.

review.title: Ill be back!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. The bed was so comfortable, the location was amazing, the staff was really nice, overall the hotel was a beauty. Can't wait to go back.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: So close to everything!!

review.title: Great room, service, and location
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel. Everything was excellent. The service, the room, the view, everything. The only reason why they got a 4 out 5 on room comfort was the fact that I could hear noise while the water was running in adjacent rooms. Not that big of an issue since we spent most of our time outdoors.

The hotel was close to the ferry building, transportation, and shopping. There's a restuarant and Starbucks right across the street which was nice because room service prices were too much for us.

Our flight was out San Jose and the staff there was really helpful in finding the most economical way of getting there ($30 for two people).
review.negativeRemarks: Noise while adjacent rooms were using water
review.locationRemarks: Ferry building less than a 10 min walk. Public transportation really close; 5 min from BART. 15 min from Union Square, and Starbucks across the st.

review.title: Le Meridien, holiday in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, looks new, staff are very friendly and consistently helpful. I had a couple of small issues that I raised and each was addressed immediately and effectively. For me the ability to respond to a concern is usually the best measure of a good hotel and they were excellent at doing that. I have used Le Meridien elsewhere on business, this was the first time on a pleasure trip and my wife thought the hotel and service was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: bed was very comfortable, room size was excellent, fastest elevators I can remember
review.negativeRemarks: on arrival room we expected was not available (fixed immediately the next morning), problem with the phone in the room (we rarely used it, though)
review.locationRemarks: excellent access to all the amenities of downtown San Fran, close to the piers and easy access to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy walking distance to waterfront and Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: No pool

review.title: Incredible Stay
review.reviewText: I wrote under my special request that I would be proposing to my girlfriend, and would like a nice view of the bay if possible. Hotel staff upgraded us to a suite for free. They were extremely friendly, and overall wondeful. The hotel was superb!

review.title: Fine hotel for both business and pleasure
review.reviewText: Perfectly pleasing hotel. Some nice views, friendly staff, in-line with expectations.

review.title: Great hotel for location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a perfect location just a few blocks from the BART, and across the street from the busy Embarcadero Center. In three blocks you're at the Ferry Building where you can enjoy an outdoor market and dozens of fun stores and restaurants. If you want you can board the ferry and head to Sausalito or Marin. The staff at the hotel was terrific, especially the ladies at the Concierge Desk, who went out of their way to help me figure out how to use mass transit to go across town to meet a friend. The breakfast room is too dark for my taste...I need bright lights in the morning! But free coffee was offered and very much appreciated. Wonderful views from the rooms!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable room with windows that OPEN!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The interior-facing room I was first assigned suffered from noise of garbage trucks
review.locationRemarks: Well located to downtown, mass transit as well as pleasant walks along the bay.

review.title: Walk almost everywhere!
review.reviewText: We booked Le Meridien for the location. Our room, an executive bay view, was beautiful and the bed was more than comfy. You can walk to Chinatown, North Beach, the Ferry Building, Fisherman's Warf and the great shopping around Union Square. There is a convenient covered parking garage on the corner across from the hotel ($7 for all day Sat & Sun!!). We are looking forward to another weekend break.
review.positiveRemarks: Th room with its expansive views and comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby renovation which is due to be done within weeks.
review.locationRemarks: Close to most everything.

review.title: Will be back again!
review.reviewText: Wonderful, friendly, helpful staff at front desk and out front...or just about anyone we passed!

review.title: Great location. Minor nits for the $$
review.reviewText: Not enough lights and had to keep asking for towels (why give 3 towels when you register four guests). No fan in bathroom so windows steam up. Waited over 45 min to get car from valet. They clearly forgot about it when we asked
review.negativeRemarks: Poor ventIlation. Slow valet service
review.locationRemarks: Great location for downtown

review.title: Great location, friendly staff and service
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nicely maintained and it is in center city, close to everything. The rate is very reasonable. We had lunch in the hotel restaurant, and the food is great. I am very happy with the staff and service in general. The hotel encourage green living. If you do not need room clean and change of towels, they give you $10 credit for bar/restaurant.

The only thing is that we booked a king size room as a couple. But the room has only one chair which means, one of us has to sit in bed when we are in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, good service, friendly staff, well maintained facility.

review.title: Cloud 9
review.reviewText: Comfort and style at its best!! From the outside it doesn't look do glamorous but once you step inside its very classy!! The views were killer and the rooms were amazing!

review.title: Great Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located on Clay street and easy walking distance to either the financial district (1 block from the Transamerica building) and 4 blocks from the Ferry Building. It was under construction and upgrade on the first floor so we were upgraded to a wonderful room with an exquisite view of the Bay. Staff was extremely helpful and nice. Rooms are big and comfortable and has an excellent gym. You are right next to the Embarcadero Center and you can walk outside upstairs all the way to the Ferry Building across elevated pedestrian bridges. In that area this is a wonderful place to stay. They have in and out parking, but you can park across the street in the Embarcadero center for $36 day and have access to store shopping items (no in and out but you are crazy not to use mass transit while in the city).
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for Embarcadero Area and North Beach

review.title: Expensive and parking sucks!
review.reviewText: Really expensive Valet parking and NO self parking!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: So close to everything in SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful! The rooms are amazing! You won't want to get out of bed! Staff inside is ok, the guys that work outside are great! Super friendly & helpful with directions!

review.title: Romantic Getaway
review.reviewText: Fantastic view of the bay, the bay bridge and Coit Tower. Room was beautiful, clean and quiet. We had the executive suite and it was plush and very comfortable. Very nice stay and would definitely recommend to others.
review.positiveRemarks: The room by far. Views were fantastic
review.negativeRemarks: Bartended was not very friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great - close to the Ferry Building and a short cab ride to the Orpheum Theatre (which is why we were up there).

review.title: Solid 4-star hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This is a solid four star hotel in the heart of the financial district. It is a great location as it is a short walk from cable cars, Ferry Building and shopping district in downtown San Francisco. The staff was friendly and accomodating. Room was large and comfortable with very comfortable bed. A little bit of street noise (even from the 10th floor) was a moderate drawback. The lobby was being renovated (in January 2013) which made entering the hotel a bit of a nuisance. Overall however it was a very good experience and we would definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, comfortable rooms, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise
review.locationRemarks: Heart of financial district, near Ferry Building, near California cable car line

review.title: can't wait to return.
review.reviewText:
everything about our stay at le meredien was delightful! check-in was simple and uneventful. no lost reservations or given wrong room type. our room 808 was very nice, floor to ceiling windows and a view of the bay bridge. the rooms have a modern feel. i appreciate an in-room safe which they did provide. the bathroom was roomy and a lighted makeup mirror is always a nice touch.

my husband and i were in town to host a dinner party at our daughters apt and we realized we didnt have enough tablecloths. we started making calls to party rental stores which are mostly all on the peninsula and wanted to charge over $30/each. i took the chance of asking the conceirge who offered me the tablecloths with my word that they'd be returned. perfect! they were delivered to my room less than 15 minutes later. as you can imagine, that scored major points with me.

paying $90 for parking per night for my oversized suv was a bit steep, but there is a parking garage around the corner for $32/night.

the reception area is being remodeled so there is some construction going on. no big deal. just take a service elevator to the second floor.

we had such a hectic weekend but coming back to our nice, comfy room made it a little easier.

thank you le meredien, we'll be back.
review.negativeRemarks: parking costs
review.locationRemarks: perfect. close to restaurants, shopping and the embarcadero.

review.title: A regular business hotel.
review.reviewText: We had booked a superior room but we were given a small room; they never left complimentary water bottles in our room despite having reminded the on duty staff one night. The hotel was under renovatin and the temporary main entrance had just one lift for all!

review.title: Horrible stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is dreadful. The windows leaked air. The heater made a beeping noise every 12 seconds all night. The mattress was so sunken in the middle it was like sleeping on a hammock.
review.negativeRemarks: When I booked the hotel it advertised free parking and internet and when I arrived the htoel did not honor the free parking.

review.title: Great location for business and Family
review.reviewText: Although the Lobby was under renovation, the overall experience was great. The room with teh double beds was large and spacious.

review.title: Clean and Comfortable hotel with subpar service
review.reviewText: The hotel overall was clean, quiet and comfortable. no complaints on that front. It is roughly a 15 minute walk to Union Square. As its in the financial district, most places (almost all places) are closed on the weekend, so no luck on even finding a coffee place near by in the morning. The concierge service at the hotel was less than pleasing. They were very uninformed, could not provide us with proper information on where to eat, go or even directions on how to talk transportation around the city. They seemed completely uncaring and uninformed when we'd ask them any questions. The staff at the hotel are not very nice nor do they feel the need to even smile when you're checking in/out or about the hotel or speak to you at all unless they need to.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff were not nice, service was completely not something that is a focus in this hotel
review.locationRemarks: Financial District. not in the city centre, but not far either

review.title: Relaxing in the City!
review.reviewText: The hotel was undergoing some renovations but the staff really made you feel welcome and made sure there were nothing we needed. Our view from our room was beauitful!

review.title: Disappointing customer service
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was arrogant and provided poor customer service. They gave us the room key cards like 10 times and none of them worked at first attempt. Overall had a really ordinary experience, there was nothing special even on Christmas weekend in this hotel and would never recommend any of my friends to stay here.

review.title: Nice hotel, better when lobby gets fixed.
review.reviewText:
Lobby was under construction.
Elevators were slow
Arrived at 5:30pm, room was not ready yet.

review.title: Great comfy and spacious room.
review.reviewText: Very comfy bed. Great customer service. Hotel was close to Chinatown, the warf and little Italy. I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice Hotel, restaurant needs some work.
review.reviewText: The 3rd floor restaurant served a breakfast buffet that was dreadful. Other than that, the hotel/room/staff was very good.

review.title: Under renovation, but not an inconvenience
review.reviewText: Hotel is currently undergoing construction on the main/lower floors, but they're doing their best to minimize the impacts. There were no problems with noise, traffic, or elevator availability. Hotel common areas were clean and the room was very comfortable. There is a delicious restaurant a block away called Georges - yummy oysters and seafood!
review.negativeRemarks: Room service food was limited.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadero Center is just a walk across the street/overpass.

review.title: Great view, horrible service start to finish.
review.reviewText: I can share that from start to finish, they were consistently rude and unhelpful. I had to bell my luggage from my car to the room and back to the car. They were rude at check-in and over the phone. They seemed to be short staffed on top of the poor service. I did like the room and the view though. I'll give them that.
review.negativeRemarks: The service was dreadful.
review.locationRemarks: Near union square and a few blocks from the piers.

review.title: Lobby renovations made this a bad choice
review.reviewText: Arrived by cab at hotel. Location was perfect. But I couldn't decide how to go in because the lobby was walled off. It seems the hotel was conducting a major renovation of the lobby and other common areas. I'm an attorney, and I was meeting a witness at the hotel to prepare him for his deposition the next day. We couldn't find a place to meet other than my room, which was awkward. A nice hotel should have a meeting place. The improvised bar was also not very nice or available. Worse, each morning I awoke to the sound of jackhammers. It was also hard to get in and out of the hotel, because we couldn't go through the lobby; we had to ride a freight elevator to the second floor and then switch to the main elevator. The staff wasn't very helpful or sympathetic when dealing with these problems. I think the hotel should have informed Expedia and other travel sites about the work; when I am paying luxury hotel prices, I expect a luxury hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Waking up to jackhammers
review.locationRemarks: Centerally located in financial district.

review.title: No in room coffee?
review.reviewText: Would be nice to have coffee in room versus having to walk down to lobby. Maybe I missed it, but couldn't find it in room.

review.title: Need to reduce the outside noise from getting in.
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely but there was construction going on in the hotel that was really loud in the middle of the night. That was a bummer. I expect loud outside noises in Union Square but not in the Financial District at night on a Saturday?!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Embarcadero and Ferry Building. Good location.

review.title: REVIEW
review.reviewText: WHAT YOU SHOULD EXPECT FROM A HOTEL IN THIS PRICE RANGE

review.title: Beautiful spot for a San Francisco getaway
review.reviewText: We loved our beautiful room and view and service was wonderful! However, the hotel seems to be under renovation ...so no real lobby, bar or restaurant. Welso were sad that true room service ended at 10:30 in the evening. Otherwise it was a delightful e xperience.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately the hotel was under construction so the lobby was a bit uninviting but don't let that stop you from coming here! The staff immediately placed me on a higher floor so I didn't hear any noise.

This is a great hotel. Bigger and comfortable rooms, great location, great workout room! I would definitely return to this hotel whether for business or with my family.
review.positiveRemarks: Great price for an upscale hotel
review.locationRemarks: within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping

review.title: Great location for business
review.reviewText: Over all the hotel is great. They were under renovation and not all the facilities listed on the web site were available to us. Also, housekeeping was somewhat inconsistent with what they do in the room during our three-night stay.

review.title: Great hotel for families and business travelers
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at this hotel. Great staff, very friendly people. The only thing I didn't like at all was the bed even though it was a luxury suite. Way too soft.
review.positiveRemarks: The bathroon was my favorite part of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The least favorite thing was the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Good location but far from Union Square.

review.title: Bad decor won't dampen a good experience
review.reviewText:
Decor is circa disco era, but the staff is friendly and the other amenities are pleasing.

Brown carpets and dark cabinets? Really?

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Large nice rooms and comfortable bed. Walkable to the Ferry Building.

review.title: Great staff and incredible views of the City
review.reviewText:
Initially, I wanted to stay in Union Square but Le Meridien was offering free internet (normally $10 a day) and free parking (normally $50 a day) so I decided to stay. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to Union Square. There are not many attractions in the immediate area during the weekends.

Overall, I loved this hotel. The room had an incredible view of the financial district and of the Bay Bridge. Everyone on the hotel staff was highly professional and extremely helpful.
review.locationRemarks: it is a little walk from Union Square and the area is somewhat vacant during the weekend.

review.title: Nice overnight stay
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at Le Meridien. We were on the 22nd floor and had a great view. The hotel is located near several places to eat and is easy to get to. The only downfall is the expensive ($61.56) overnight parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: As expected for a Le Meridien. Will stay there again

review.title: perfect view of the bay through the downtown sky
review.reviewText: very accomodating staff. We accidentally booked the wrong dates and yet they were very flexible in changing them thru expedia. We loved our stay there and will return with every trip.
review.negativeRemarks: weather
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: highly recommend! good quality and value!
review.reviewText: we had a wonderful stay at le meridien. the location was great, the hotel was clean, the staff attentive. the price on expedia was the lowest we could find, which made it even that much better! we would certainly recommend the hotel to friends.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed, could see the water from our window, price.
review.negativeRemarks: flushing the toilet was very noisy, coud hear the room next door every time they opened their door
review.locationRemarks: fairly convenient to BART and getting to the waterfront.

review.title: Nice hotel overall!
review.reviewText:
Great hotel experience! The bed was extremely comfortable with big soft comforter and cushy pillows! Bathroom very large and full of amenities! Didn't need the scale though!
Good central location to walk or take transportation to areas of interest. Would definitely return!
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy above me when trying to sleep!

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Great hotel - it's very modern and in a great location. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only negative is the parking situation, the valet service is very expensive. The hotel is walking distance to many wonderful restaurants and the piers.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to good restaurants.
review.reviewText: Our room had a great view of the water. And the hotel was located within walking distance of great restaurants.

review.title: NO REGRET
review.reviewText:
VERY FRIENDLY, HELPFUL STAFF~!! VERY CLEAN HOTEL. NICE VIEW,
LOCATION IS GOOD TOO. IF I GO BACK, I WILL STAY HERE FOR SURE!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Everything was good, I got upgraded to a better room. However, I did not check the windows and was unaware that they could be opened and I received a rude awakening early in the morning thanks to the SFFD. Overall, I was pleased with the stay.

review.title: Great Hotel for Weekend Away
review.reviewText: We were there for the Columbus Day Parade and Fleet week. We made the decision last minute to go and were having trouble finding rooms. Expedia made it very easy and we loved the Meridian. Walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Checking in was easy and the staff was fun and accomodating. Beds were very comfortable and the rooms had great views and lots of natural light which we love.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Views, comfortable beds and nice stafff
review.locationRemarks: It was walking distance to BART, North Beach and the Embarcadero

review.title: Very nice hotel down town.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel- conveniently located, clean, up to date nice bathroom. I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: There was some fragrance throughout the lobby. It wasn't an awful smell, but it wasn't to my liking, so that was a bit annoying. The elevator music was terrible. Every time I walked into the elevator I felt I was in a dance club. That wasn't the feel I was looking for during my stay.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: We really like the location, the attention was good, they offer you shuttle services to the airport, all you need for your stay is ok in this hotel.

review.title: Not a pleasant stay in San Fran.
review.reviewText: The overnight check in staff was deplorable, dishonest, and unhelpful. They claimed my reservation through Expedia was not sent correctly when it was. They were rude and unaccommodating. The bell staff was not around at except during the morning hours to help in finding a taxi. It's far from anything within walking distance unless you want to go to a business meeting. The rooms are ready for an update BADLY! It's also very noisy. You can hear everything going on around you both inside and outside the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The cool corner windows providing amazing water and city views.
review.negativeRemarks: Not very quiet or well insulated with RUDE staff
review.locationRemarks: Only good for business travelers.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, largely friendly staff
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine, beautifully furnished and convenient location. The staff was very friendly on check-in and check-out, but the staff at the hotel bar and in the lounge area were less so.

review.title: Comfy and modern for the price
review.reviewText: Very relaxing room. Modern, chic and very comfy king bed. The place was pleasant and very clean
review.negativeRemarks: The tub. There were dirt marks
review.locationRemarks: Financial district

review.title: Fabulous hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a wonderful location. One of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. Views were phenomenal!

review.title: quiet, comfortable room for business traveler
review.reviewText: great hotel for business traveler. big room, comfortable bed, super quiet room, nice sitting area and desk in standard room. only issue is that because of location, finding a place to grab a quick bite right near the hotel on saturday and especially sunday is difficult, as most lunch/breakfast places are closed. but starbucks across the street is open and a shirt walk to bus/muni ride takes you to any number of great restaurants in the city.

review.title: Perfect getaway!
review.reviewText: When I checked in the lady at the front desk told me that parking was included in the package. Well, when I checked out, I noticed they had charged me for it. But since I was told that my parking was included, they honored what the lady told me and took it off the bill. Great customer service!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to the wharf

review.title: Great hotel for couples or family.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. I would recommend it to my friends and family.

review.title: awesome place to stay
review.reviewText: this hotel was great, fantastic location in a lovely neighbourhood with great views of the bay.the rooms were well sized and very clean and the staff were always very helpful especially the concierge.
review.locationRemarks: financial district with great access to public transport and most things we needed

review.title: Nice for business...or pleasure!
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, conveniently located, and good staff. We've been booking this hotel for a few years now and the quality and price can't be beat!

review.title: Awesome for couples!
review.reviewText:
I loved this hotel! From the moment we got there everyone was so nice and helpful. Stayed on the 23 floor with a view of the bay bridge it was awesome. And when you walk in the lobby door it smells amazing!!!!
The only bummer is we were only there for one night :(

Also, stopped in at the lounge bar near the lobby for a drink before heading out. Bartender and server were both knowledgable and friendly. I am General Manager of a restaurant in Santa Barbara and I was impressed!
review.negativeRemarks: wanted to have an early dinner in the restaurant around 5:30 and it wasn't open
review.locationRemarks: right in the heart of the financial district, only about a 5 minute walk to the ferry building

review.title: Perfect for SF marathon runners/attendees
review.reviewText: If you are palling on running the SF marathon, then this hotel is a perfect option, being that it is only located a few blocks from the start\finish lines!!!

review.title: A+++
review.reviewText:
The staff were very inviting & helpful. The decor was modern & very up to date. Nice little bar in the reception area.

Close to the bay bridge and a 30 min walk to fishermans wharf.

review.title: Great value and awesome stay!
review.reviewText: The wait staff in the bar was disappointing. Service was extremely slow and unfriendly. The drinks were expensive and not particularly good. On the other hand, we received excellent care and service from the concierge and front desk. The 12th floor room had a fantastic view of the city and bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Really comfortable and clean rooms with excellent views.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel bar - it was expensive and the drinks were not particularly good.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location - walking distance to Farmer's Market, Ferry terminal, great restaurants and shopping, Chinatown, BART and the financial district.

review.title: Great room with a view!
review.reviewText: Great location for a place to stay in SF! The staff was great and we got a beautiful room with a nice view of the harbor(thanks Josaiah!). They have valet only parking, and the only dampener in the stay was that our car was dented on the front bumper by someone who parked. The channel selection was limited, but you are in SF and have plenty of stuff to do outside. I would definitely recommend this place for peaceful relaxation overlooking the bay!
review.negativeRemarks: Valet
review.locationRemarks: 4 blocks from chinatown and quick cab ride to fishermans wharf

review.title: Fabulous all around!
review.reviewText: Very impressed with this hotel! Reminded me of my stay in new York city...high quality!

review.title: Nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: I would stay here again without hesitation, the room was great and the location of the hotel is excellent. Just don't drink in the bar, I paid $28 for 2 shots of vodka.
review.negativeRemarks: The bar sucked! Way too expensive.

review.title: Very Romantic
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful room with views of the Bay Bridge, Coit Tower and the Bay. The bed was so comfy and the comforter kept us warm. We brought champagne with us and sipped it watching the Bay. Very romantic. We often stay in the city and Le Meridian will be our first choice. Thank you and thanks to your wonderful staff
review.positiveRemarks: We booked online and got a fabulous rate. It was quick and easy. The view and the bed. We liked the swivel TV as well
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee in the room
review.locationRemarks: the location was perfect for us. we could walk to North Beach, Embarcadero was across the street.

review.title: Great hotel near the waterfront
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and conveniently located near many local attractions. My wife and I were visiting on vacation and found the financial district to be a nice quiet option that still had many dining options and entertainment was easily accessible.

review.title: Nice and fancy
review.reviewText: Have to pay for internet, which I think should be free at all hotels by now. Otherwise, great experience. They helped me schedule my airport shuttle.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Was last minute booking . Had excellent experience with staff and enjoyed cleaniness of hotel, would recomend , and stay there again. Happy customer

review.title: Great hotel for couples!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! My boyfriend and I checked in late and the staff was great about keeping our reservation! It had a great view and was nice and clean! Loved this place!

review.title: Just a great hotel.
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to an executive suite with bay views and we were quite pleased! Room was beautiful, clean, and super comfortable. Staff very sweet and friendly (especially the valet!). Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location and quality
review.reviewText: great location, clean, great size room, and no issues with services. Free coffee and tea with newspapers in the morning. We used it as our base for tourist trip with friend.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to everywhere in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Great Downtown Hotel w lots of food and shopping.
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, great location in the Financial District. A Starbucks and Peet Coffee just across the street as well as many restaurants from take out to sit down nice. A huge mall across the street with great upscale shopping.
Hotel HAS AWESOME WINDOWS- huge from floor to ceiling. If you like light and an open feeling then this is for you. My only complaint is the pathetic WI-FI connection. Takes forever to load pages (and you have to pay $14 for it!).

Staff was exceptional and courteous. All in all, a great experience.

review.title: Good idea, bad planning.
review.reviewText: I'd give them Superb except for an inconvenience I had: they shampooed my rugs and treated the chairs/seats the first full day I was in the room. OK, I get it, you're making the place clean and nice, but I had to change rooms. Thankfully they had another room available and I moved. It just wasn't very well planned on their behalf, as the rug was moist and whatever they used as a chemical was making me sneeze and even they found it necessary to open the slider as wide as it would go....not what I needed after a trying day at work! Also, not what I expected for the cost of the room. If it were a Holiday or a Hampton....OK, maybe...but not at this price. Other than poor planning/ coordination of their maintenance, I'd give them high marks. Oh, to be fair, a note in my room said my room MIGHT have extensive cleaning done and if I didn't want this done I could put the do-not-disturb sign on my door, but then I wouldn't have had my room cleaned for the 4 nights I was there....sorry, not an option.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance planning issues.
review.locationRemarks: Near all the locations that I needed on this trip, plus more GREAT restaurants within walking distance than I could possibly go to in my 4 night stay.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Great personnel. Friendly and efficient service!! Not a single issue. Clean room and very comfy bed.

review.title: Very centric.
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel and great location. Staff was really nice (mostly anyway). I had an issue with my bill and they fixed it right away.

review.title: Very nice hotel with great rates.
review.reviewText: Modern hotel, very clean, helpful staff, nice views, and great rates. Location in Financial District quiet at night and on weekends. Somewhat of a walk to restuarants and a taxi ride to tourist destinations.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean and well appointed roooms. Modern design features.
