review.negativeRemarks: Location in Financial District not always the most convernient.

review.title: Great getaway for couples
review.reviewText: Great place for couples to getaway to. 1/2 mile walk to North beach or $6 cab ride. Tremendous value for money in non- crowded part of SF on weekends.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel restaurant/bar

review.title: nice hotel, damaged my vehicle
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel; unfortunately my car was damaged by their valet service. We will see how long this takes to get it resolved. I understand that accidents happen, and certainly, I will revise this review should they resolved this in a timely manner.
review.negativeRemarks: damaged car by valet service
review.locationRemarks: excellent location; near all major attractions in downtown and financial district

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Very nice Financial District hotel, high-rise with great views, within walking distance to many shops and restaurants, the Embarcadero Center, the Ferry Building, Pier One, BART stop is about 2 blocks away, however many of the shops and restaurants close early (around 7pm) and many are closed completely on the weekend, however North Beach/Little Italy/Chinatown are within walking distance in the other direction. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the food/drinks from Bar 333 were wonderful! I have stayed in Fisherman's Wharf previously and would definitely recommend this hotel and this area of town over FW, due to the better quality of hotels, and less of a "tourist trap" area.
review.positiveRemarks: location, location, location! very friendly staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of open restaurants/shops in the area on Saturdays/Sundays

review.title: Perfect location, beautiful hotel
review.reviewText:
The location in the embarcadero was within walking distance to numerous historic and fine restaurants. Shopping is convenient and the farmer's market at the Ferry Building is just a few blocks stroll.

The hotel room was first class with fine bedding, furniture, and ample size.

Highly recommended!

review.title: Great staff, well-kept and clean rooms, great food
review.reviewText: The entire staff at the hotel was very professional, friendly, and customer service oriented. The rooms were very clean and modern, including the bathroom which had plenty of counter space for personal belongings.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Location was great for us. The hotel is close to the Oakland Bay Bridge, which was convenient for our mid-vacation drive to Yosemite.

review.title: Holiday in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a good location. Just watch out for the free room upgrade to the suite next to the lift control room, as these room can be noisy.

review.title: Great location and staff.
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel is surely great. Rooms are comfortable, no coffee makers in the room though.
I would love to give it 5 stars but the problem is, if you add the regular parking fees, then you're better off in a more upscale hotel, with bigger bathrooms, etc.
The concierge did an excellent job! Very pleasant staff members altogether.

review.title: Lovely Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel. The staff was very friendly and everything appeared well managed. The lobby area was a little cramped and it was necessary to navigate through inconsiderate groups of people that collected in commonly used passageways. The morning coffee service in the lobby bar area had high quality coffee. However, if you did not get there early it would run dry quickly. I did not notice vigorous monitoring by staff and had to request more coffee from the front desk. The view from the 22nd floor was magnificent but the windows were dirty. The room was very comfortable but noise from adjoining rooms was noticeable, and not just through the door- toilets flushing, heavy footsteps above, banging and whatnot. The noise was sporadic and not wholly unexpected given the holiday weekend. The hotel's proximity to restaurants of all levels and in all directions is outstanding. Everything is walking distance- including the Ferry Building area with it's artist booths and farmers market on Saturdays, and North Beach (which is slightly uphill).
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and cozy. Outstanding view from the 22nd floor. Close to many restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Probably just the dirty windows.
review.locationRemarks: Since it is in the financial district, weekend traffic is light.

review.title: The room was clean and the staff was very friendly
review.reviewText: The room was clean and we got a very good deal. I will stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Lication was great walking distance to farmers market and union square

review.title: Lovely
review.reviewText: Fantastic Hotel. Right in the Centre of everything and comfy beds.
review.locationRemarks: Right near some amazing restaurants and cafes and a 20min walk to the piers

review.title: Lovely
review.reviewText: No hand soap and no hair dryer the first night we arrived but both of those appeared the next day. Hotel restaurant was overpriced.
review.negativeRemarks: over-priced restaurant
review.locationRemarks: great location..close to public transportation & activities

review.title: Meridien hotel review
review.reviewText:
Great location for visitng North Beach and Chinatown restaurants and close to Market and California streets. The bathrooms have sliding doors, not conventional hinged doors. kind of odd.
The rooms do not have individual coffee makers but plenty of free coffee in the lobby. Great views of the Bay and Treasure Island and the Bay Bridge with overall a nice atmosphere and lobby.
We really like the place.
review.negativeRemarks: sliding bathroom doors
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for hitting great dining spots.

review.title: very convenient
review.reviewText: it's very nice and chic but no coffee machine in the room...staffs are very nice and clean.convenient location and easy to walk to everywhere. my family took cable car three times...cablecar station is close to hotel and also tour bus(big red double decker bus)station is right in front. also ec center is right in front....pretty much everything is right there for you.even starbucks....
review.negativeRemarks: my room. it's noisy.
review.locationRemarks: great location.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. The concierge was wonderful!
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location!

review.title: The Wall trip!!
review.reviewText: Very nice,people were friendly and located in a great area.The parking seemed a bit high but that's S.F.

review.title: My stay at Le Meridien
review.reviewText: Check-in was chaotic!!! What a madhouse! While the workers were very friendly, there was no crowd management at all and so people who walked in way after others were getting helped first. It would have been far easier to deal with the wait if the line had been managed and we were helped in the order we arrived.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of crowd management during check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Nice central location to the "downtown" area of San Francisco.

review.title: Stay here in SF.
review.reviewText: My stay at the Le Meridien in San Francisco was outstanding! The room was very clean,spacious,quiet, well appointed and had an awesome view of the bay. The bed was comfortable and I had a great night sleep. As nice as the room was,the staff was more impressive. Wake up call from a pleasant human not an electronic recording is a nice touch. Consierge suggested some delicious restaurants. Definitely will stay here again. Also walking distance to waterfront activities a plus.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly,helpful staff and great room with spectacular view.
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to waterfront.

review.title: suited us well
review.reviewText: Le Meridien suited us very well - room was spacious and tastefully furnished, very comfortable bed and furnishings. The hotel was in a good location for the things we wanted to do in San Francisco

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great Location if you are attending the Giants Game at AT&T Park.

review.title: Great location: Close to shops and waterfront!
review.reviewText: Great location, close to the waterfront, delicious restaurants and shopping. The room was super comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Super close to waterfront, shops and restaurants

review.title: Excellent - would certainly go back and recommend!
review.reviewText:
We thought this hotel was excellent and suited our needs perfectly. After arriving at 6am, we were allowed to check in early free of charge.

The room was fantastic; clean, comfortable and well kept, with a great view of the bay. Staff were helpful and polite and the concierge staff were among the best I've experienced - particularly Laura, I think her name was, who became our personal San Francisco city guide. All staff were extremely knowledgeable and happy to help. The location was good too, only a few minutes walk from all forms of public transport (so really easy to get around the city) Ferry Terminal, shops and restaurants etc.

We really liked the idea of being able to refuse housekeeping in return for vouchers for breakfast. Given that we were only in the hotel for a few days not having housekeeping for a couple of them made no difference at all. A great idea!

All in all we thought this was a great hotel, and the price was extremely reasonable too.
review.negativeRemarks: Food not cheap, although very good.
review.locationRemarks: Good. Only a few minutes walk from all forms of public transport (so really easy to get around the city) Ferry Terminal, shops and restaurants etc.

review.title: Great hotel for Business, Travel or weekend breaks
review.reviewText:
Really liked this hotel. Good location for access to Trams and Muni. Union Station is about a 15min walk. Quiet area in the evenings.

Hotel Lobby and lifts have 'uplifting' music which is different to other hotels.

I travel a lot and I couldn't fault it. I got this hotel on Expedia with a 30% off promotion. Great deal
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay for internet access
review.locationRemarks: Central to Wharf(s), Union and Market Street.

review.title: No WiFi!!
review.reviewText: A business hotel. Good location. Charge for Wi-Fi in room!!!. Reception staff just OK, concierge team great.
review.negativeRemarks: everything is extra

review.title: Clean and elegant place to be
review.reviewText: love the time I was there and I will going back again for sure.

review.title: Nice place near Embarcadero
review.reviewText: We got a suite and it was like a small apartment, spacious bathroom and nicely appointed. I am not sure that i would stay there again though. Based on the amount of time that we spent in the room (2 days) I could have stayed elsewhere and accomplished the same thing for the price. I could have gotten a free breakfast, points and other amenities elsewhere, but wanted to try something different. Note that I had already spent 6 nights at a different hotel earlier in the week but opted to stay here for the bigger room size and because the wife came out to celebrate our anniversary. The location was not bad - close to Embarcadero where we could easily walk a couple of blocks to the F-train and get to the Wharf, walking distance to North Beach and Chinatown and only a few blocks from the Bart stop. The hotel was also surrunded by Starbucks which was nice. I thought that we had gotten one of the bigger suites, but apparently there were others which had balconies. One more thing, the way that windows are set up you get a view of the Bay bridge, but the neighbors above can also seen right into your bedroom or your living room if u don't draw the curtains. So you could be putting on a show if you are not careful.
review.negativeRemarks: visibility into neighbors room
review.locationRemarks: Close to a lot of things if you know where you are going

review.title: Decent rooms, great location!
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance to BART station (Embarcadero), Chinatown, Ferry terminals, farmer's market and lots of great shopping and restaurants. Rooms were very spacious, spotlessly clean and comfortable but a bit noisy (we were on the 5th floor and could hear street noises very clearly#. We were especially pleased by the comfortable beds and excellent linens. For the price of the room, we were extremely disappointed to learn that there was an extra charge of $13 and change to get wifi. Free wifi was only available with code #from Concierge) when in lobby area. Free coffee every morning! I would rate the services as average - nothing spectacular but not terrible. Pretty decent gym.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location! Clean, spacious and comfortable rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level and extra charge for wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to BART station (Embarcadero), Chinatown, Ferry terminals, farmer's market and lots of great shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Great Easter Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Suberb! Great room with a beautiful view. Clean, well appointed and comfortable. Excellent hotel staff and valet staff. Thank you Expedia. Superb experience.
review.negativeRemarks: older rollaway beds
review.locationRemarks: Financial district is between Union Square and The Embarcadero

review.title: Special evening out
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed overnight for a getaway. We had a dinner cruise from pier 3 and walked to and from our destination. Hotel was very quiet, despite some of the other reviews we read. Very nice amenities for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was so comfortable. Like sleeping on a cloud. The concierge was helpful. Room was very clean and modern.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful views of the city and within walking distance to our evening on the Embarcadero.

review.title: Stayed here twice
review.reviewText: I have stayed in San Francisco twice and both times I picked this hotel. It is clean and in a very nice convenient location.

review.title: Surprise find with good value for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel in a good central location with easy access to BART/MUNI as well as walking distance to the Embarcadaro Center. Dog friendly and they don't allocate special rooms for that nor do they charge extra for your pet stay like so many other hotels... a nice surprise!
review.negativeRemarks: Bar in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: Central and in walking distance (like most places in San Francisco)

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
Really good location.
For the price, the food should be better.
review.negativeRemarks: dining
review.locationRemarks: in front of embarcadero center, 3 blocks from Chinatown

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great room with a bay view. Room service was prompt, food was excellent. Staff was very polite and helpful.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Location is good where easily access to public transportation. Concierge is friendly and helpful, and provides accurate information. Breakfast is expensive.

review.title: A little hotel with great customer service
review.reviewText: Excellent service all around, reasonable price and comfortable accommodation.

review.title: Hmmmm
review.reviewText: Some of the staff was off putting. Over priced for they level of product and service.
review.negativeRemarks: Door personell
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Le Meridien - Good spot
review.reviewText: We came in and spent Saturday night there. The room was very nice. The location was great. It was within walking distance of the Embarcadero restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were great and bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The fee for parking was expensive = $90 for F150.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel located in heart of San Francisco. With in walking distance of everything.

review.title: Had a really nice time
review.reviewText:
The staff are super responsive and breakfast in the restaurant was really good. Decor in the lobby and rooms is uber-modern.

Free WSJ/SF Chronicle/NYT/USA today can be found in the lobby. Free coffee in the morning too.
review.positiveRemarks: Large room for a modern/urban hotel - the bathroom was huge and had nice finishes. HD cable in room.
review.negativeRemarks: Linens were a bit tired, the robe with a hole in the rear. The mattress needed to be replaced - it was a little lop sided.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district - very close to the Embarcadaro and the Cable Cars. 12 blocks or so to Union Square.

review.title: Excellent hotel.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, room was very spacious and came with all the necessary facilities. The lobby, restaurant and other areas of the hotel had a great atmosphere and the staff were always very helpful. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the financial district.

review.title: Perfect for romance!
review.reviewText: The hotel is fantastic. My girlfriend and I stay here regularly. Room service in the middle of the night could improve, but everything else is fantastic! I love this hotel!!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The only thing that I can say bad about this hotel applies to most hotels. They charge a lot for the room, why gouge you for more money for Internet access. I just walked over to Starbucks and got wireless for free
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Room was awesome, only 1 downside was no coffee making facilities would have liked to have a coffee maker in the room. Bathroom was amazing. Staff very helpful and attentive. One thing we did find strange was we asked at the concierge desk how to get to highway 1 to start our coastal trip and the guy said we would only be able to go so far as part of the road was washed out. On the map he showed us it meant we could only get to Carmel!! he said it washed away 2 years ago and hadn't been repaired, as it turned out it was fully open, perhaps they should keep abreast of the current situations, I'm sure a lot of visitors will be looking to do the same trip. Otherwise they were very helpful. Thought the charge for wifi was a rip off so went across the road to try free wifi at Starbucks, it was closed but you can get access when you are in the pub next door. As an fyi - pub food was awful so wouldnt waste you money.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to the Wharf and Union Square. Comfort of the rooms and bar/restaurant areas.
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee maker. Charge for wifi
review.locationRemarks: Seemed safe enough walking around whatever time of day. Handy for the Ferry Building.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great modern hotel with huge rooms. Short walk to the cable cars and trolleys. Easy 10 minute walk to China Town, 15-20 minute walk to fishermans wharf. We would highly recommend this hotel to all. Complimentary coffee and tea available in Reception in the morning.

review.title: Weekend Visit
review.reviewText: The hotel is really well maintained and upscale. The only reason I give it any 4 star ratings is because the location is limited in its access to food. It is really close to Embarcadero. The views from the rooms are of the Port of San Francisco. Its a great hotel and considering space issues in SF, the room size was really good.
review.positiveRemarks: Incredibly comfortable bed and AMAZING view, even from the 9th floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Location did not have many food choices.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Embarcadero, walkable to Union but lacked non-pub or take out places to eat.

review.title: Awesome Hotel, awesome time!
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel, they upgraded me for free! Le Meredian rocks!! Took a girl here for a night out in the city and we had a great time! If you have an ipod, bring it, they have hook ups in the rooms.

review.title: SF weekend
review.reviewText: Great place in a great location. Walked to everything. Off site garage parking way less expensive than valet.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect to walk to restaurants,embarcadero,farmers market

review.title: Nice hotel that's quite business focused
review.reviewText:
Nice large room. Very comfortable bed and modern bathroom. Carpet was a little old and some of the furnishings need to be updated. Good view out of window.

The location is what can only be described as a little out of the way. Fine if you don't mind walking and it's reasonably close to the bottom of Market street (15mins).

The included toiletries are not very good so best bring your own!

Overall not bad if you get a discount from Expedia or similar.
review.negativeRemarks: Older fittings, carpets need a good clean .
review.locationRemarks: A bit out of the way located in the financial district. Not much open at weekends or evenings around the hotel.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Excelent hotel! Very good location, close to the Ferry building and Telegraph Hill. Very clean, the rooms are beautiful. You should pay for Internet. The breakfast is too expensive. I would stay here again definitely!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: I never thought I would say this, but the pillows were TOO fluffy. I didn't even think that was possible, I'm all about fluffy pillows. But, that's hardly a reason to not stay here. The location is good-close to the ferry terminal which has lots of places to eat. It's a walk to any other 'sights' in SF though (I walked everywhere since it was great weather). When we checked out, we left our bags with the hotel and came back a few hours to collect them-two hotel workers then spent about 15 minutes searching for our bags. I was dealing with checking in with our stupid airline (note: never fly US Airways), but if I hadn't been preoccupied I probably would have been a little annoyed. However, everything turned out fine in the end and I would recommend this place! Beware, downtown SF never really quiets down, there were sounds of the city all night long.
review.locationRemarks: Near the ferry terminal, which has lots of places to eat. Once you walk down to the terminal you take a trolley to fisherman's wharf for $2

review.title: Pleasing, comfortable, classy!
review.reviewText:
Concierge was knowledgeable and super friendly! Everyone had a great attitude and were very courteous! The front desk was accommodating to our every need, and boy were we needy.
The room was a double queen. Nice view of the BayBridge between the two skyscrapers. Comfortable beds, sound system was good. Phones worked. Coffee maker upon request was delivered. They were switching to an HD system so maintenance was done briefly while we were in the suite getting ready. Room was spacious enough to have a comfy sofa, a chair and a desk on the opposite side of the beds. Loved the long mirrors on the wall. Water pressure was good in the bathroom- loved the extra magnifying mirror by the sink!
Clean, comfy and classy. Definitely worth the money!
We were on the 17th floor. :) No noise at all! Felt safe on the street,.although everything closes early in the Financial District. Great location! It's a stroll to Chinatown and the Ferry Building.

We will surely stay at Le Meridien again!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds, spacious living space, mirrors galore!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything closes early in the Financial District.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! 10 minutes walk to a lot of touristy areas and to transportation!

review.title: Experience in Le Meridien
review.reviewText:
There is no clear instruction from the front desk about the facilities of the hotel.It was at the end of the stay did I found out I would use a complimentary room business room that there was such a room existed.
Trying to order room service on a Sunday is like trying to pull a tooth from a child we ask for pasta and were told there was none then change the order to chicken and was told there was none and this is only 8.30 pm.
We were there 3 days on the day before we left our room was clean but they did not give us extra soap or body gel and that was the only 2 items we use think they would check how much was there in a tiny bottle? And towels left on the bath was still there!!!
If you want food and not get room service unless you wants MacDonalds or Subway or a Pub or Resturant there is no other take away open after 8 pm.
But what gets to me is when I asked a concierge about transportation to the airport a couple of dy before I need it he told they can't book a taxi but there was a town car for $65 I did not book anything with him but left it on the day itself I was told it cost me $50 for the use of the town car. So I do not think they are very honest.
review.locationRemarks: Close walk to Fisherman Wharf, Chinatown and Union Sq. Food in the night a bit hard if you want to takeaway.

review.title: Le Meridien SF
review.reviewText: Le Meridien is centrally located and also close to all major forms of transportation. The hotel was friendly and accommodating. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and clean.

review.title: GREAT STAY
review.reviewText: Front desk ( Josiah ) very friendly. He put us in a nice room as it was our 30th anniversery.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and nice view 22nd floor
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Park in Embarcadero 1 parking garage across street $32 a day versus $52 for valet.

review.title: Just ok.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, and clean, but the elevators took forever, and we were charged for items that we did not use. Overall, for the money - I would stay somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms looked like they needed to be upgraded.
review.locationRemarks: The location was convenient.

review.title: Valet?
review.reviewText: Our favorite hotel to stay in San Francisco. The location is great, away from the downtown traffic with accessible parking on the street (metered). Everything went well from check-in, to the accommodations, to check-out. Our only issues had to do with the valet parking. Calling ahead for our car took longer than it should. We ended up waiting for our car several times. I even had to remind them. Also, the water pressure was low on the 23rd floor. Otherwise, we had a most enjoyable stay.

review.title: Recommend for everyone
review.reviewText: Hotel is well maintained. Staff are elcoming and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Convenient. Close to everywhere

review.title: Anniversary Trip
review.reviewText: We were celebrating our anniversary and had a wonderful time. It was located in a great area.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and comfortable, also the customer service was awesome I would love to stay again if I had the chance.
review.negativeRemarks: There wasn't an auxilary cord to use wish there was one in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39 and close enough to everything walking distance or taxi ect.

review.title: Review of Le Meridien, SF
review.reviewText: The only negative experience occurred when I ordered breakfast delivered to the room. The pot of hot water for tea was brown. The small jar of orange marmalade had been opened and partially used. Upon returning to the room to address the problems the wait staff offered little explanation other than that the hot water must have gotten mixed with some coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: Contemporary with great service (except as noted). The downstairs bar gives one a view of the passing humanity, sometimes interesting in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: See comment about room service.
review.locationRemarks: A great locations in downtown SF. A public parking garage is just across the street.

review.title: Creme de la Creme.
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, courteous, beautiful and location, location, location
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi extra dollars. Free wifi across the street at Starbucks.
review.locationRemarks: Financial District...AMAZING

review.title: Great for couples or business travelers.
review.reviewText: We got a great rate so decided to try it out and see what it was like and see a different part of town. Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in the finance district and would seem to cater more towards business travelers. Would not really recommend for small children or families. More of a "business" feel to it than a vacation feel. Did not see any children, no pool area, or any area really for kids. Second floor is all conference rooms and third floor is a restaurant. Business center on the first floor.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, modern, rooms with great views. Extremely comfortable bed and pillows!
review.negativeRemarks: None really.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district close to the Embarcadero. Close to trollies and buses or walking distance.

review.title: Highly recommend.
review.reviewText: Wonderful, highly recommended hotel. Couldn't have been happier for my first visit to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Style, and quality of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location. View of the Ferry House, Bay Bridge and Beautiful City (Financial District).

review.title: Mother and daughter weekend
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for a long weekend with my daughter. We were very impressed with everything. Great location. Quiet room. Incredibly helpful staff. I had only been able to book a King bed at the time of booking, but requested two doubles instead - which we got without any fuss. We also got SPG points even though we booked through Expedia. The friend who dropped us off was given a few hrs free valet parking. The rate did not include free wifi but we were able to get an hour's access a day free on request. The hotel also offers a $5 voucher to use in the cafe/bar if you choose not to have room service on any day - which suited us perfectly. The two people on the concierge desk were incredibly helpful. One of the best hotel stays I have had. Couldn't fault it!

review.title: Loud guests and Unresponsive staff
review.reviewText:
Very nice room and hotel.
However, the staff and management did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to quiet or kick out our neighbors who partied loudly all night. My wife called to complain at 3am and I called again at 4am. No security, no response. Nothing.
The next morning the front desk said the entire hotel was partying.... Gee, thanks.
review.negativeRemarks: Unresponsive staff
review.locationRemarks: FiDi on the weekends is a ghostown

review.title: WOW!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I decided to splurge, so we stayed in a room with a Bay view. WOW! What an experience! The room was modern, chic, clean, comfortable and topped off with a floor-to- ceiling window that flowed from one wall to 1/4 way around the next -- the whole sensory treat was mind blowing. I can't say enough about how special this was. We will go back and will, also, highly recommend this to our friends and family.

review.title: Location, location, location- pick carefully.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in the financial district and was very clean, efficient but not likely to be attractive to tourists, families or children. We had a car so not too worried about being near public transportation. Room was comfortable, large and clean, fairly quiet. Towels felt thin and not very fluffy. Bed very comfortable and cozy /warm. Concierge staff was very helpful. Directions were spot on for driving directions and suggestions. Our rate included parking but if you had to pay, parking was a hefty $52/night for valet. Did not eat in the hotel but room service was available. Chose this hotel due to the rate and included parking and felt we got a great value but probably would choose a different location next time. Many shops and restaurants were closed at night and on the weekend we were there.

Only one issue with billing as I had confirmed when checking in that the parking was included. The final bill had the parking added and I had to have the charges removed.
review.negativeRemarks: Location and thin towels
review.locationRemarks: Located in the financial district. Area is mostly dark, closed and very few people out at night.

review.title: A gem in the financial district
review.reviewText: I am in San Francisco every six weeks but had never stayed here. I will stay here again. The lobby bar served good food, the room was clean and well appointed, and the views from the top floors are fantastic. It was very quiet. The restaurant on the 3rd floor is not open for dinner, but you can eat in the lobby bar instead. This is a great location if you wish to be in the Financial District.
review.positiveRemarks: The employees at the front desk were very friendly and efficient. The room and view were lovely. It was very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is very expensive, as it is elsewhere in San Francisco. It also took awhile to get our car.
review.locationRemarks: The location is much quieter than staying in the bustling Union Square area. It was perfect for a quick walk to the Ferry Building.

review.title: No Shampoos in the room
review.reviewText: They did not have shampoo in the room. When asked the front desk they send someone to bring it immediately except he brought several shower gels and conditioners. I w

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: Good value for the money, and still within walking distance to Moscone Center and Union Square. Third stay in this hotel for convention.

review.title: Good on the whole, but lacks badly on some areas
review.reviewText:
The room was nice, clean and spacious, but the hotel lacks badly when it comes to the amenities, the very small lobby and lacks even more when it comes to the dining options.
Breakfast was quite good, but outrageously expensive. It is a shame that the hotel doesn't provide with any other quicker and less pretentious options.
The room service is even more outrageously priced - even for those whose company pays the bills, with and addition of 21% service charge, on top of all other charges.
At dinner the hotel offers only the Bistro - a small area in the small lobby. Unlike the breakfast - the food was plain bad and service lacked as well. We ordered the French onion soup and Croque Monseiur combination - which turned out to be a blackened (i.e. burnt) sandwich and a soup which consisted mainly from croutons. The sandwich was obviously had to be sent back and when it reappeared it was soggy, but at least not burnt... The staff decided to compensate us with a chocolate cake, which we didn't need or eat. It would have been better not to charge for the sandwich then give a random dessert, or rather, not serve such a food to begin with.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of dining options
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Ferry building, Market street and Union Square

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was our first visit to Le Meridien. The location is fantastic and close to shopping and eatieries. The staff was very pleasent and hospitable towards my wife and I. The room was very clean and well decorated. I really appreciated the white down comforter which I think more hotels need to consider. There was no question the bedding was clean and fresh. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my friends or anyone else who would like to stay in San Francisco away from the noise of Union Square and Market Street.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Good location away from but not far from Market and Union Square.

review.title: Weekend at the meridien
review.reviewText:
Hotel was just okay. There were cheerios on the floor in our room and our mattress pad
was dirty and stained.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This is primarily a business' mans hotel and is in the middle of the financial district. Nice hotel with good views for the higher floors if you're facing the right direction. Nice facility, friendly staff, only had breakfast in the hotel which was very good. We were able to book a fantastic rate for the room with parking included which is typically $50-60 in San Francisco.

review.title: Most enjoyable break
review.reviewText: Hotel location excellent. Room very roomy, very nice decor. Tea/coofee was not provided in the romm but on request a coffee maker was provided.Service by hotel staff was xcellant. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to others.
review.negativeRemarks: Very minor, tv remote control had an info button that did not work
review.locationRemarks: Very central to lots of the tourist sites of San Francisco.

review.title: Not so great service
review.reviewText:
Had a few problems at my stay.

1. I paid for the parking for my stay with my reservation. Then I found a bill under my door on the morning I was leaving saying they charged my credit card I left for incidentals for parking. (which is $52 a day).

2. I used the laundry service and was told when my laundry would be finished and planned my schedule on that time. They were not available to bring my laundry for about 40 minutes. Then they lost two of my items and had to go back to laundry to locate. Put me an hour behind schedule...

3. Went to have breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Ordered the buffett and was told there were no eggs out yet. Waiter said he would have the cook make me the scrambled eggs. When theycame they smelled like seafood and must have been mixed with something besides eggs and oil. Very dissastified and grossed out my eggs smelled like fish.
review.negativeRemarks: poor quality in restaurant quality control.

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was a good choice. Unfortunately when we got there they didn't give us the room type we had requested and said that it was the last room they had, that if we wanted they could send us to another hotel. The next day, they gave us an upgrade to compensate, but we did have the discomfort fo changing rooms. Otherwise, everything was great.

review.title: Very good Hotel. Recommended.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Front desk staff were helpful. Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful. Room was good size, well appointed and clean. Hotel services were good. Hotel location is good. Walking distance to many attractions, including the Ferry building, Fisherman's wharf, Alcatraz boat landing and downtown shopping. Public transport and some shops are close by. Room service is a bit pricey. Overall, very happy with our stay and would recommend to others.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, great location and the staff went out of their way to help you.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Very central - easy access to sights and public transport

review.title: Great hotel, very comfortable and chic
review.reviewText: We had a great time and loved the hotel. We were sad that there weren't drink making facilities in our room, and the area was pretty dead in the evening, but that's what you get from the Financial District. It was very convenient being so central, and so near so much transport, so it wasn't a problem that stuff wasn't open. We stayed over Christmas, and the hotel service didn't falter, which was useful. Loved that we could get a $5 token in exchange for forfeiting a day of cleaning - came in very handy!
review.positiveRemarks: The comfort, the central location and the good service
review.negativeRemarks: Not having a kettle in the room!
review.locationRemarks: It's quiet in the evening, but central and quiet. There's a fire station down the road, but that's only noisy a couple of times a day.

review.title: I recommend
review.reviewText: Its clean, comfortable, staff and service is ok, concierge information is excellent and excellent location for exploring San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge information and localization of the hotel - excellent
review.locationRemarks: very, very good

review.title: One disappointment after another.
review.reviewText: We checked in and I immediately went to our room to run a bath for our child. I noticed black hair in the tub. A total turn off. Then I called the desk because we booked a room for 3 and there was only a bed for 2. The front desk staff told me we would have to get a rollaway bed for an additional $25. So I was transferred to a hotel manager who told me I would have to pay because I booked a room for 2. However I booked for 3 and I had email conformation of that. She then realized I was correct and then also said rollaways were free for children. But then we had to call to check on it three times and was finally delivered at 10 pm. And they knew we had a four year old. Our studio suite offered no coffe/ tea. We had to pay $2.50 for a tea bag. And no bottled water either. We ended up having to buy 4 bottles at $4.50 each from the front desk.So for a "nice" hotel that was. It busy the service was very off. Not helpful at all. And with all the choices in San Francisco I would not stay at this hotel again. We travel often and are very good at critiquing hotels. Maybe try Hotel Vitale down the street. That is a beautiful hotel with great service.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.
review.locationRemarks: Few blocks from the warf area. Good location.

review.title: Romantic getaway
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our romantic getaway from the kids and responsibilities at home! We would definitely stay again!

review.title: Good but needs real free internet and car park
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, close to downtown and touristic areas.
Beautiful view from the rooms. Quiet and safe area around the hotel.
Disappointing things :
- no parking included and it's $32 a day to park your car in the parking close to the hotel.
- wrong advertising about internet. To get it for free you need to go on the laptop dedicated. In the rooms, there is no free internet, $12,95 per day for a very low internet.
- only one bathrobe per 4 people room
review.negativeRemarks: no internet

review.title: recommend
review.reviewText: My room requests were not recognized. CD player did not work. one bar of soap. all is else excellent
review.positiveRemarks: location, good looking room with good view, parking deal, professional friendly staff, very clean, quiet
review.negativeRemarks: minimal to low on bathroom amenities ( soap, washcloths )

review.title: Best hotel in the bay area.
review.reviewText:
great location, best value, attentive and courteous staff, clean and spacious rooms, comfortable bed.
Walking distance to Bart Station, Embarcardero, Chinatown, and Union Square.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Everything was good except our reservation through Expedia requested two double beds but the hotel only had a king and a roll-away bed available upon check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks and Embarcadero Mall across the street is very convenient.

review.title: Zen Oasis in the Financial District
review.reviewText: The executive partial bay view room was the best value I've received at a hotel in SF! Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Super comfortable and great location
review.reviewText: Super comfortable bed and great views. You have to go downstairs for coffee in the morning, but it is proper coffee. Close to a lot, easy cab ride to some of the best restaurants. Valet guys were nice and quick.
review.locationRemarks: Gitane and Bar Agricole - really good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Best Hotel I Ever Stayed In!
review.reviewText: This was a modern, classy hotel with great service. There is a lovely restaurant in the lobby and the concierge was extremely helpful in giving directions to highlights in the neighborhood. After checkout I had an early flight and there was a driver to take people to the airport for the same price as a cab, and I was on my way quickly. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco!

review.title: Really Impressed
review.reviewText: Big and beautiful room, great location, friendly service. I will definetly will be back to this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Chinatown, Embarcadero

review.title: Decent Hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Room was spacious and clean, no coffe pot in the room though. Room service was prompt and food was good. Expensive parking.

review.title: Great central spot in SF
review.reviewText: The only complaint I have is that the bed was VERY firm, too much so for a side sleeper but understand that you can't please everyone all the time.

review.title: Excellent, well located hotel
review.reviewText: Room was clean, well appointed. Friendly, helpful staff. Very nice fitness room. Generous with morning papers. But no free WiFi in a pricy, business hotel? Free continental breakfast would have been nice also. Definitely would come back.

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel! If you're driving beware of the $60dlls valet fee. There are parking garages all around the hotel that run between $32-36dlls per 24 hour period.

review.title: Great room. Great views of the Bay.
review.reviewText:
Staff was very professional and extremely friendly !

Had breakfast in the dining room with excellent service and delicious food.

Package including the parking fees was better than expected. Would highly recommend Le Meridien to anyone staying in the Financial District !!
review.locationRemarks: All of San Francisco. Greatest town except for NYC. Love it there !!

review.title: Overall good hotel with some service issues
review.reviewText:
Pros:
Large room, good matresses, great location, clean

Cons:
Service was not very good -had to ask three times to get coffee maker to be brought to our room, also they did not replace the scale in the bathroom that did not work
Bathroom has a weird sliding door that did not close properly

review.title: Great view of San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel was great with a great view of an amazing city.

review.title: Marshmallow beds! Best place to wake up while hungover!
review.reviewText: My friend and I searched for a long time to find a comfy and clean hotel. This hotel was well price, perfectly maintained, with poliet and helpful staff. Location was just what we were looking for. Recommend this to anyone who like luxury and comfort while out of town.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown/ North Beach, Mission, downtown and Lower Haight

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: An older hotel in good condition, nice location for walking all around San Fran. Would recommend staying here.

review.title: Definitely top notch hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service. They are determined to make your stay comfortable and are always available to help with any questions concerning needs, such as a last minute dry cleaning. When they say they will do something, it is always in a timely fashion. I've stayed during slow times and when they are full to capacity. They never seem to be understaffed, and are always extremely friendly. Will stay here whenever in San Francisco.

review.title: Great downtown hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the financial district of San Francisco. It is in a very safe and convenient location. The night hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, yet the day staff had a bit of an attitude. The hotel is 5 star quality and the rooms are very modern and large in size. I would definitely stay here again, I felt so comfortable and relaxed here. I would highly recommend this hotel to any traveler.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel in a Great Location!
review.reviewText: Nice room/ bathroom. Could see the bay from our window. Easy walk to Wharf, Chinatown. Loved the concierge! She was helpful with directions and had a great demeanor.

review.title: Julie
review.reviewText: room sound insulation is very bad, 2 nights suffered from next room by loud noise in the middle night, security can't do anything. 2nd night I have to moved to another floor at 2:30am. Will never stay again at this hotel!

review.title: would like to go back
review.reviewText: This was my second stay in a studio suite at Le Meridien. In general it was good. However I learned not all of the studio suites had a couch. So when a room with two chairs was given this time initially, I talked with the front desk. First they insisted that it was still considered as a suite. When I requested my complaint to be communicated to the managed, someone from the management changed the room to a studio suite with proper seating. So there is a chance of not getting what you pay for at this hotel.

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at Le Meridien for 5 days and thoroughly enjoyed it. Rooms were clean and comfortable, service was excellent, and location was ideal for walking or taking a short cab ride to see all the sights. We highly recommend it!

review.title: Great Room, Great Location
review.reviewText: I stayed in an executive suite overlooking the bay. The view was stunning and the room was very comfortable with lots of storage space. Ironing facilities were provided in the room and the bedding was luxurious. The only negative thing I could say about the room was the size of the bathtub and the sliding door to the bathroom .. the bathtub was small and not a good for a nice soak ... . Bathroom door was a slider, so privacy could be an issue if you're staying with a friend. That said, the bathroom was spacious and well organized.

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Nice modern design in the room. I appreciated the pull-out mirror with extra light. Nice breakfast with extra smoothie treat and loose tea instead of tea bags. The staff was friendly and I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Pricey but good
review.reviewText: The hotel's room rate does not include the daily parking fee. Restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch only. Food is excellent. No mini-fridge or microwave in the room. In-room dining is available but pricey ($4 delivery charge plus 21% gratuity).

review.title: A Good Choice
review.reviewText: We had two adjoining rooms at the hotel with a view of the water and Bay Bridge. World class shopping in the Embarcadero, and a short walk to the Ferry Building. It was a good choice for a busy weekend in August.

review.title: nice spot close to lots of things
review.reviewText: Hotel was great...staff was very helpful...concierge staff was outstanding!!!!they can help with anything

review.title: Small but nice
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was very nice. We wanted to stay away from 'touristy' places and the location, of the Meridian was perfect. Away from all the 'tourists', but central enough to enjoy different areas of San Francisco (Embarcadero, China Town, North Beach etc). The rooms are small, but nicely furnished. The beds are too small if you are sharing. We had a million dollar view though. As we didn't stay in our rooms much, we were very pleased with it. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: More Than Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText: Awesome! In the heart of Financial District. Take a cab or pre-reserve a car from SFO so you're not carrying your luggage from Embarcadero Station to the hotel. Once at the hotel, there is transporation is all around with just a brisk walk. Wear comfortable shoes. Booked a Studio Suite and asked for room on a high floor...got the top floor. Incredible views! Room was just like the photos and very quiet. Staff was outstanding, ESPECIALLY Laura at the Concierge desk. She went over and beyond to help us with our excursions and point us in the right direction to see the major landmarks. Rained the 3rd day of our trip. Hotel gave out umbrellas to borrow. Ordered room service one night. Hamburgers were huge! Great stay, great staff, great hotel!

review.title: Almost Perfect
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Will definitely go back. Only complaint was we had two double beds and three people (myself, my wife and our son). We forgot how small a double bed is! Otherwise the perfect stay.

review.title: Poor Beds
review.reviewText: Queen beds are twins really.

review.title: Excellent location....excellent hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Close to everything. Would definitely go back.

review.title: Love it!
review.reviewText: I love staying at this hotel. It's close to everything & the rooms are very clean & comfortable.

review.title: Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: We had a beautiful room with a great view on the 23rd floor. Everything was perfect. The room rate was reduced 40-50% by going through Expedia and paying ahead (non-refundable). Hotel is in a really good central location.

review.title: Great Rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel was incredibly sheik and impressive. For what we paid for the night, the room was outstanding! The only thing wrong with the place was that it's neighborhood was shut down over the weekend. Though, that could be a good thing- since the place was quiet and safe. Great hotel!

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: The view was great, everyone was very helpful. Pillows were fantastic. we selfed parked across the street, with a savings.

review.title: yees
review.reviewText: getting a little run down ...re painting , wood work , carpets... but made up with great people working at hotel .

review.title: A mixed review
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at this hotel about 6 times and never come away feeling totally pleased. Yet I returned once again because of the value of the suite and great location. At check-in I was told that they no longer had the room type I booked and offered to "upgrade" me. They moved me to a higher floor but the room was decidedly inferior in size to what I booked. I complained at the front desk that the room wasn't satisfactory and reminded them that I pre-paid for the room and therefore ought to have the room promised or be refunded. After some effort the manager stepped in and over-rode the clerk, putting me in the room I had origninally requested. It was a "city-suite" and a very nice room.

Unfortunately my problems didn't end there. The walls are paper thin and a group of girls in the room next door were carrying on late into the night. I was amazed at how much noise was coming through the wall. I called the front desk and asked for help, who in turn called the room. It was actaully hilarious to hear a girl answer the phone and act surpirsed at the level of noise. I could hear the whole conversation. After, though they tried to lower their voices, I could still clearly hear more than half of what they were saying.

Overall, the room was excellent and I love staying at the edge of North Beach and the Ebarcadaro, but I won't stay hear again.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: A polished place to stay near the Financial District.

review.title: Underwhelming Comfort
review.reviewText: Great location. Comfortable rooms. Lobby area low on service and amenities, but plenty close nearby. Although the hotel was comfortable I was a bit underwhelmed, given that our last stay was at the fabulous Le Meridien in Brussels.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel located in an ideal location four blocks from the Embarcadero. The service is amazing, the rooms are luxurious without pretense and everything is clean. Great bar with reasonable drink prices and free Starbucks in the morning.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: We had a corner room with a bridge view - the room was really nice. Everything about the experience was perfect except our phone was not working and the office printer was broken when I desperately needed it, but the staff worked hard to correct those problems for me. The location is about a 10 minute walk restaurants - you can do better in that regard.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: 11th floor view was "just ok". Not really what I had expected of a view room mini suite. If you stay in one of these mini suites ask for the highest possible floor AND on a corner. You may get a view; ours was of an active office building across the street which forced us to keep our curtains closed.

review.title: GIANT pillows a pain in the neck
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, nice location, rooms a bit dated. There was no way to play an IPod, and the rooms have CD players instead. Front desk seemed unconcerned--just "no, we can't help you with that". This was my second stay. My first several years ago was sublime so I was looking forward to returning. But as I say, it was dated. Our greatest unhappiness was the giant, and I mean giant, bed pillows that left you feeling like you were wrestling them all night. Room service is quite good. Breakfast is over-expensive. Location is good for walking to Embarcadero and Union Square.

review.title: Can't wait to go back and will. So much to do and see and never enough time.
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights in December and the experience was more than we expected. All the lights and delights of the city right there at this location. The weather was great so it was easy to walk or take a taxi. Everyone working at the hotel was polite, welcoming & very helpful. Clean and good sized rooms. The bay views were gorgeous and the lights brilliant. Overall the ambience was great. Loved being so close to the Embarcadero, Ferry Building and Union Square. We had drinks and apps in the hotel the first night (yummy!), but with so many wonderful resturants to choose from we ate elsewhere, Slated Door and Tropisueno, both fantastic. Recommend reservations be made for both.

review.title: Great Hotel near financial district and Embarcadero
review.reviewText: Room was immaculate. Very designed for the business traveler. Really enjoyed the hotel. Pillows were not that great though.

review.title: The Best Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: This is the best hotel in the city. The staff is competent and beyond friendly. The Beds are comfy and the views are insane. Obviously, there is not a lot of parking in the city so expect to have to pay for parking at the hotel, or you can save some money parking up the street in a garage. Safe part of town with lots to do, Cabs in the city are cheap if you need to go elsewhere. HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

review.title: A 5-Star Experience
review.reviewText: My father and I share the same name and I guessed this could be a problem when checking into the hotel. Not so. Checking in was a breeze for both my parents and me. In addition, my mother has some difficulty walking. In response, the hotel upgraded their room at no charge to make it easier for her to use her walker and get around. That is the mark of a 5-star hotel. Yes, the drinks in the lobby bar were too expensive but one can overlook that when the service is exceptional as it was.

review.title: Wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Will def. be back, as we thought the location was perfect and We got a complimentary upgrade on check in. Concierge got us reservations at Perbacco which was an excellent restaurant ,very near by. Linens and pillows on the bed were fantastic! No noise at night, which is always a concern in a big city.

review.title: So far the best hotel ive stayed in SF.
review.reviewText: Room was very spacious, lovely hotel and friendly workers.

review.title: Quiet and comfortable
review.reviewText: Great location between Union Square and Embarcadero/Ferry Building. Financial district is quiet on weekends, and a taxi was always immediately available in front. I was surprised by the view from the 17th floor of the bay to the east to North Beach and Coit tower to the north. Even on weekends, the buses work well. The 1-California (E-W) and the 30-Stockton, 45-Union, and 9x (N-S) will get you Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Warf, Union SQ., Polk St. (great restaurants) and the Marina district without much trouble.

review.title: "Wonderful Experience"
review.reviewText: Our stay could not have been more pleasant. From the great folks at the front desk, to the perfect room. 5 BIG stars to you, Le Meridien!

review.title: Very Nice! No Complaints!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! Everyone was very helpful and very nice. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. The location was great as well...it's located in the business district, so it's quiet on the weekends and it's within walking distance to Pier 39 and the market. We were only there 2 days, but were able to pack in a lot because nothing was too far away.

review.title: The best
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Nice and luxury hotel.

review.title: Great Getaway Hotel
review.reviewText: great location and nice hotel. bar was fun for a late drink. room was big with a nice view.

review.title: Weekend Gem
review.reviewText: Situated in the Financial District, this hotel really caters to the business traveler; however my Saturday stay at the hotel was just fine. Everything was clean, the service was great, and the lounge area was bustling with attractive people.

review.title: UJC's Great Anniversary Experience...
review.reviewText: Great Hotel! Very Clean, comfortable, even got a free upgrade to a suite since it was my Wedding Anniversary. Staff was very helpful, always curteous, they recommended great restaurants. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great Hotel....but parking at $xx per night is crazy....Great Hotel for everything else
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great staff, for what we wanted, great location. Parking rates at $xx per night were ridiculous.

review.title: Cant wait to go back.
review.reviewText: Parking is expensive, but it was worth the stay. would stay there again. Well priced.

review.title: Best Bed EVER!!! You won't want to leave!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Le Meridien Hotel last weekend 11-13-10, they gave us the best room # 2408 with a gorgeous bay view, totally made our weekend special! The staff was so friendly and the hotel is centralized right in the Financial District, just blocks from everything. We went to a 49er game and it was a blast! The guys out front can get you a taxi cab in 2 seconds! Also, the man at the front desk recommended E Tutto Qua, an Italian restaurant, it was the best italian food I have ever had. I would definitely recommend a taxi for transportation, we took one everywhere - to the wharf, china town, union square, the mall, and I think our highest taxi bill was like $9. I will be traveling to New York next summer and I will definitely be staying at the Le Meridien in NY because I was so impressed. One more thing, the bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on and the shower gel makes your skin so soft and the hair conditioner was nice, not cheap quality like most hotels. The whole trip was amazing, thank you so much!!!

review.title: A Wonderful weekend
review.reviewText: Beautiful place to stay in the city.

review.title: Cool hidden location
review.reviewText: The location is great. We went there to stay on a Saturday night after seeing Teatro Zinzani, which it's right down the block from, and in the morning walked down to the Ferry Building for breakfast. It's within spitting distance of Chinatown, North Beach and Union Square. The hotel was clean, efficient, and solidly build. I sort of imagined that since it's built for business travelers more than for tourists that it holds itself to a higher standard--business travelers won't put up with the crap that tourists will, they just won't go to that hotel next time, and they all talk to each other so word gets around. Much nicer experience than some of the "fancy" hotels in Union Square that we've stayed in. After driving there we were on foot, but car traffic is so *not* an issue in that neighborhood on a Saturday night.

review.title: Le meridian
review.reviewText: Had never stayed here before. My first 5-6 choices were booked and others were way overpriced on a very busy weekend in the city. All things considered, it was a decent value in a great location.

review.title: Not for the weekend.
review.reviewText:
During the week, this hotel might be great. The staff was great, but there were a few things that were annoying. The room was nice--but the walls were so thin that the "voices" next door were crystal clear and like being in the same room. That goes for the energetic couple on Saturday night and the loud business conference calls on Monday morning. Thank goodness there was a radio in the room. The room had quite a few light bulbs out, and the fan in the bathroom didn't work (during showers, ALL of the windows and mirrors in the main room fogged up completely. Contrary to what we read, the restaurant DOES NOT SERVE DINNER. They are open for breakfast (which was decent, but the $6 cup of coffee was on par with Denny's) and Sunday brunch.

As for the area, it's in the financial district, walking distance to the Ferry Building and Chinatown (and a few other places if you wear the right shoes). However, on the weekends, the choices of restaurants (especially since the hotel didn't provide one) is severely limited and poor. Hardly any places are open, even during the day on weekends, and even fewer places were open on a Sunday evening. Don't plan on eating anywhere around the hotel.

Overall, it seems like it's a complete roll of the dice to see if you are going to have neighbors who make your stay rather embarrassing and annoying, or if they'll be quiet enough for you to enjoy the beautiful views.

review.title: Excellent SF Hotel
review.reviewText: I was extremely happy with my stay at the Le Meridien San Francisco. The location and the service personnel were excellent. The staff was very professional. The business center was well support. I would highly recommend this establishment. Short walking distance to very good resturants and Union Square for shopping.

review.title: Le Meridien
review.reviewText: Overall, great hotel in a great location

review.title: Pricey but good
review.reviewText: good

review.title: Lovely room
review.reviewText: Usually stay in the area a couple of times a year and this is my first time at the Le Meridien, the price was a little more than I wanted to pay but not disappointed with the hotel.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Nice location; would be great for business travelers, being in the heart of the financial district, and close by the Embarcadero Centre. The hallways looked kind of like a brand new school dorm (bright, sterile), but the rooms were clean and comfortable. At night it's a pretty quiet area without a lot within walking distance, but still seemed fairly safe. Would recommend.

review.title: great bar!
review.reviewText: great place! worth staying...real comfi

review.title: Loation was perfect
review.reviewText: This hotel was within walking distance to the public transportation lines that could take you to any of the great spots in the city. If you don't mind a 10 to 15 minute walk, you can walk to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf and many other great places. The room was so quite that it felt like I was the only one on the floor. Staff was very helpful in giving directions and advice on the city.

review.title: rude bell people
review.reviewText: My teenage son pushed the luggage cart to our room after the bell person loaded our bags on it, due to my son's ignorance, he felt the cart was left unattended in the lobby and felt compelled to take the cart with him. He then left the cart outside our suite after unloading. 2 minutes later a very upset bell person knocked on our door like LAPD. when i opened the door, in his demeaning tone he said " next time you need to ask permission to me when you want to use my cart, you're not allowed to use this cart" turned his back on me and left. i closed the door, smiled at my family and said " welcome to le meridien". but that didn't ruin our stay, i slept and ran the SF marathon the next day. i will be back in town next year to run again, not sure where i'll be staying at. LIVESTRONG.

review.title: Great Location to see the sites
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Le Meridien. We thought the location was great, close to Embarcadero, shopping, Ferry Building, China Town, Union Square, etc. We were really pleased with how accessible everything was to the site. We liked the fact that we were close to the sites but not in the middle of the chaos and crowds in areas like Fisherman's wharf. SF is such an easy city to get around in. The Concierge services at the hotel were great--very helpful with directions, reservations, and answering questions about transportation to and from our activities and how long to allow for travel. Rooms were newly decorated, beds were very comfortable, room was quiet. The rooms were clean, maid service was attentive. We would have liked a bit more lighting in the dressing/closet area of the room and the sliding bathroom door was a bit unique, but overall very comfortable. Also the toilets make very loud flush noise -we could hear flushing in other rooms so we know it wasn't just our bathroom.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Allowed late check out

review.title: Good but shouldn't charge for internet
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, organised and well maintained and in a great location for walking around. The beds were super comfortable. The only gripes were not being ready for an early check-in as requested, and having to pay for the internet access. Come on people! This is the 21st century!

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO'S BEST IN THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT
review.reviewText:
This was the BEST hotel we have ever stayed in. It exceeded all of our expectations in all areas. One of your doorman even ran from his break to get the door for us. Even the complimentary shoe shine exceeded my expectation.

Your hotel even had two weddings going on that weekend and the service didn't miss a beat. We will definitly stay here again on our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Would certainly consider this hotel on a return visit
review.reviewText: Le Meridien Hotel proved to be a very comfortable and extremely pleasant hotel to stay in for combination of a business and holiday visit to San Francisco. The view from our room was stunning and a particularly important part of our experience for this visit. The staff were very helpful and the bar/bistro system worked very well for promoting a casual and friendly switched on atmosphere. Would certainly consider returning to Le Meridien again in the future

review.title: Would absolutely stay here again.
review.reviewText: We travelled to San Francisco in July 2010. Surprisely the weather was cold approximately 60-65 degrees. It took us a little by surprise. The hotel we stayed in was in the financial district. I would highly recommend this location as it is quite, within easy walking distance to all the major attractions. We were easily able to walk to all sites; Pier 39, Chinatown, French district, Union Square, Civic Centre etc. Also close to a Safeway, Farmers Market (on Saturday). Would highly recommend Le Merridain to other travellers. Can hardly wait to return to San Francisco.

review.title: Great option for SFO downtown.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is great option, in the middle of the main landmarks; walking distance to all the nicest places in the downtown, embarcadero and union square; as usual in SFO my main complaint is the parking costs.

Very disappointed about the city situation comparing with las year, less clean, a lot of homeless people asking money in the streets. Not a safe sensation anymore during the nights.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: Great location, close to the Embarcadero, Chinatown, highway access, and shopping. Stylish room (and both my husband and I are VERY picky), great spacious bathroom, good bed. Good concierge service. Only complaint would be the parking fees - $50/nite, super-steep, but that may be the case for all SF downtown hotels, don't know. Also- very good in-room guides to the city, especially the 7x7 magazine. We selected a brunch place based on that magazine, and loved it - it was as non-touristy as you get, a locals-only hole in the wall with the best brunch and nice outside seating.

review.title: Clean and safe!
review.reviewText: The safety of the neighborhood is a big plus. We stayed at a different hotel closer to the heart of the downtown area in San Francisco later on in our trip. We didn't feel nearly as safe and the hotel was not nearly as nice. We will make sure to make our next reservations at the Le Meridien.

review.title: Le Meridien Recommended
review.reviewText: This hotel was great value for the money. It had the feel of a much pricier hotel without the big ticket price. It had a large bathroom and lots of storage for all our clothes. The sitting area in the room was also a nice touch. The bar and restaurant were excellent with great happy hour specials. Starbucks was nearby for early coffee. The Specialty's bakery down the street was also a great place for breakfast. It was close to the Ferry Building. It is within walking distance of many SF attractions. It is also near public transit if walking is not your cup of tea. I would stay at this hotel again if the price is right.

review.title: exceptional - great location
review.reviewText: Le Meridien is centrally located - a walk from all the tourist highlights. A quick ten minute walk to the Ferry Building where you can access public transit to Fisherman's Warf and a number of other tourist highlights.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Excellent location - close to Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building and much more! Quiet on weekends at hotel, which is a nice change from the frenetic downtown. Comfortable beds. Highly recommend.

review.title: "It is sooooooo me"
review.reviewText: I loved the Le Meridien San Francisco. It is a very clean and stylish hotel in a good location. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: All was OK
review.reviewText: Everything was fine. Pretty typical hotel. Photos made look a little nicer than it was but everything was still good. All was OK. I would stay again.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: When we asked if they had a microwave we could use, they brought us one to use for our whole stay! We were thrilled with the accommodations and service, especially Laura the concierege. We needed a private room for a luncheon for 30 guests for less cost than the hotel charged and she helped us find a great place, Il Fornaio.

review.title: Le Merdian
review.reviewText: Being in downtown SF, I expected to have a hard time finding a reasonable & clean hotel. I hit a homerun here. Clean; quite with an upscale lobby & room. Nothing cheap here. Being across the street from the Embaradero office & shopping complex, it gave me a place to go burn some extra time off, rather than walking block after block. The lobby & my room were very nicely furnished & rich in color. About the only traffic sounds I heard were the emergency sirens

review.title: Would recommend to everyone!
review.reviewText: We loved being in the financial district of SF over the weekend. Very quiet! Le Meridien was in an excellent location to get to many areas. Very nice rooms and good view of the city. Good beds and great exercise room. WONDERFUL concierges!

review.title: Very impressed with this hotel inside and out
review.reviewText: Our view looking outside our room was superb. Our kingsize bed was very comfortable, tidy and clean. We made use of the fitness facility which was equipped with modern exercise equipments, fresh clean towels and even apples to munch on after our work out. The place is very secured and the personnel are very helpful and kind. We were provided with a map of downtown San Francisco that greatly helped us as newcomers of this very lovely and scenic, well-known City of USA. We recommend a trip to this great City to everyone travelling the USA.

review.title: A real WINNER
review.reviewText: Great neighborhood; great hotel. Easy walk to the Ferry Bldg and the Embarcadero. The room was luxurious; the bed better than the one at home. Nice view from the 11th floor and no noise from adjoining rooms. Overall a great experience and I would stay there again.

review.title: Marcella
review.reviewText: It was a great weekend. The rooms were comfortable, clean and the service was great. Marcella

review.title: Party Time!!
review.reviewText: Freat Time

review.title: Nice place to look forward to. I look forward to staying there again.
review.reviewText: See above

review.title: Financial District
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. The beds were great and we had a partial view of the Bay Bridge. The staff was helpful and directed us to some nice restaurants. My only complaint was that they charged for internet. When I pay that much for a hotel, you'd think they'd throw in internet for free.

review.title: Flawless
review.reviewText: A flawless experience. Despite being relatively busy, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were VERY comfortable and everything was spotlessly clean. The hotel is conveniently located, even though we were vacation and not business travelers. Because we had an excellent room rate, we were able to upgrade to a King Studio, but it was worth considerably more than we paid.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: We came here on a well deserved vacation. We were very pleased with the location and general condition of the hotel. Some of our friends suggested that not much goes on in the financial district after 5 or so, but that wasn't too big of a problem for us, everything was in walking distance, we had a room with a spectacular view San Francisco. We would definitely stay again!

review.title: "Can't wait to go back" AGAIN!
review.reviewText: We are so glad we discovered this fabulous hotel a couple of years ago. When we can capture a room here as part of our travel package we are thrilled. The best hotel in a great location. The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable in size. The staff at the hotel from the moment you walk in the door will give you the best service with a smile and are very accommodating............always! We look forward to our next visit!

review.title: Nice and conveniently located
review.reviewText: The hotel decor was nice. I wish the beds had been larger and the neighborhood and been a bit nicer but all in all, it was a nice stay. Staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: San Francisco Le Meridien
review.reviewText:
This is a really nice hotel, located in a great part of town. The Embacardero Center is right across the street, which makes shopping easy and convenient. We also like that this area of San Francisco is less busy on weekends.

The hotel is upscale, responsive, and exactly as we expected. Of note, we had checked out of a nearby hotel earlier than expected due to problems with noise and other issues. Le Meridien was a great replacement. It was easy to get to and a breeze to check in. The room was nicely decorated with an enormous bathroom. And, there was even a small balcony right off of the bathroom. My only gripe would be with the sliding bathroom door (which the other hotel had as well).
