It is weird and not really fully closed; so the privacy is limited when you're in the bathroom. I hope this is not a trend for other hotels. But, even with this oddity, we'd still stay there again for our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: "Ferry" Convenient
review.reviewText: What a great place for a weekend retreat for those of us from the East Bay! We traveled on the evening ferry from Vallejo. After a week's work, this hotel was an easy walk from the ferry terminal and close to restaurants along the Embarcadero and California Street. Our evening show along the waterfront was just an easy stroll down Battery. The hotel restaurant had wonderful omelets for breakfast with fine service.

review.title: wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Great location, great price, modern and updated inside and our room couldn't have been better. The view overlooking the bay on both sides was wonderful .

review.title: GREAT SF Experience!!
review.reviewText: A friend suggested I check out the Le Meridian in SF. Am I glad I did. Perfect location and a beautiful hotel. Our room appeared to be newly refurbished and the amenities were wonderful. Super high thread count sheets, great pillows and a really good shower. All of this in beautiful surroundings. The hotel staff was friendly and caring on all levels from the front desk to the doormen to the server in the restaurant. All of this for a very competitive price, especially considering the quality of the experience and the amazing location. Short walk to the Ferry Bldg, favorite restaurants and great shopping.

review.title: Central and inexpensive
review.reviewText: Le Meridien is right in the heart of the shopping district; next to the Embarcadero Center, with a great art-house cinema nearby, and close to the financial district. Lots of great restaurants (Tadich Grill! Perbacco!) and close to public transportation. Nice rooms, friendly staff; business traveller friendly with a room with computers to pick up your email for free. Great deal on the room and nice restaurant inhouse. Highly recommend.

review.title: Love it!
review.reviewText:
We've stayed at this hotel many times before and we always enjoy the location, not too close to all the turistic frenzy, but still close enough to go if you want to (Union Square). We usually have a light breakfast at the Embarcadero Building where they have a great bakery and unbelivable cheeses at the Cowgirl Creamery (not sure of the name but contains cowgirl).
If you stay there ask for a bay view room, it has a balcony with a postcard beautifull view of the Bay Bridge.

review.title: Le Meridien - San Francisco, CA
review.reviewText: This is not a 4 Star Hotel. I would give it 3 Stars. It's unlike any other Le Meridien I have visited before. Firstly, the woman at the front desk wasn't friendly at all upon check in. I just didn't feel welcomed while seeing staff throughout the hotel. I will say the Room service staff were very attentive and friendly. The gym was awful and the equipment was old and some machines were broken. Of course not everyone uses the gym when at a hotel but felt I had to share my experience. The neighborhood was ideal.

review.title: Excellent San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed here at the end of a 7-day trip (liked San Francisco so much I cancelled the airport hotel for the final night and booked this place instead) and immediately wished I'd booked it for longer.

I'd strongly recommend this hotel - not only is it more stylish and less crowded in the lobby than many of the other hotels, the service is good, and the rooms are nicely furnished with good views. Beds are very comfortable, bathrooms excellent.

Best of all, from a practical point of view, the price is sometimes no more than for the many large Union Square hotels. If you have to choose between several hotels at a similar price point, then I'd definitely choose this one - simply no contest in my opinion. If I come back to San Francisco, this will be the first place I'll check on.

Location is good - about 3 blocks from Market Street, BART, MUNI and Ferry Building.

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: great place, great location

review.title: wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: I highly recomend this hotel for its cofort ,location & food. However parking is too pricy

review.title: use your locks and privacy sign!
review.reviewText: The hotel and room were great. The only thing that was unprofessional and would make me rate this hotel lower was the fact that when we were in our room, the door was opened twice (two different days) by the cleaning people. We were inside telling them we were in there and they still opened the door. The first time was right after we checked in, they did not know someone new had checked in and the room had already been cleaned. They should have kept a better check on their list of rooms to clean. The second time, I think we even had the privacy sign up. Also, we rented a car not realizing that parking was like $50/day! Next time, I will not rent a car.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. Fantastic location. Parking was VERY expensive so don't bring a car.

review.title: Look forward to staying there again in September
review.reviewText: I would defiantly stay there again and recommend it to family and friends

review.title: weekend at le meridien, sf
review.reviewText: great hotel, wonderful staff. Even launders gym clothes free!!

review.title: nice place!
review.reviewText: people here are nice. not too far from some neat places ,we have always had a good time here.

review.title: Overall Very Nice, would stay there again.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice. They upgraded us to the 21st floor with a great view for $10 more. My sister got double charged for room service breakfast, but the manager was helpful in indentifying the problem and getting it resolved.

review.title: Average hotel, in good location
review.reviewText: check in was smooth and seamless. Room was clean and as expected. One thing to note was the the walls are very thin, and was very loud. You could hear alot of the activity going on in the hallways and from other rooms (e.g water running, doors closing, etc). Hotel is in a good location, about 10 minute walk to North beach and Ferry Building. Got a great rate from expedia. Tv reception was not the best either. Overall would recommend, only if you get the good rate from expedia.

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText: Great choice for us and all the reviews we read prior to were a big help and right on! Great choice for anniversary!!

review.title: Grea t location, great deal!
review.reviewText: The hotel had a great location. It was an easy 1.5mile walk to Pier 39 area. The hotel bar had a nice atmosphere and reasonably priced bottles of wine. We enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant the next morning. Servie was excellent as was the food. Great mini getaway!

review.title: Local with class!!!!
review.reviewText: Everything so close, take bus or Cable Car to Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39, North Beach has the Best Italian Food on the West coast!!! No Fooling!!!.Its fun just to get a table faceing the street to watch the world go bye..Only being 45 mins from home is a big plus but We love coming to the city...

review.title: Fantastic modern rooms with great views!
review.reviewText: I booked two rooms at this hotel for an incredible rate. I expected to be on a lower level floor with no view, but both rooms were on the 13th floor with amazing view of the water and bridge. The rooms were hugely spacious and modern. The only downside was the $50/night parking. However, I feel that is to be expected of in San Francisco. There is a nearby lot within walking distance for about $30/night.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
I got a great rate for a 4 star hotel. The hotel was conveniently located two blocks from the event I was attending.
Two suggestions - cost of valet parking should be clearly indicated and the lounge/bar was closed when I returned to the hotel at midnight.

review.title: good hotel at the right price
review.reviewText: conveniently located. good restaurants nearby. shopping and the Ferry building within waling distance. really fun happy hour bar. comfortable bed, nice linens

review.title: Clean, Convenient, and Affordable!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel- very nice, clean, affordable, and centrally located! Only downside is cost of valet parking- $50 a night! But there are other parking garages around the corner that the valet staff can direct you to for $30 a night- not great, but better. Concierge was extremely helpful with planning our day activities and suggestions for our time spent in napa!

review.title: Top 3 in my book!
review.reviewText: Le Meridien was the best. The hotel was great, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was huge, the view was fantastic, the food was good, and the staff was fabulous. I had a jr. suite, so the space was great. If you're going to San Francisco, stay at the Le Meridien. I researched for weeks before selecting the Le Meridien, and my research paid off. Now, since I've done all the hard work, you don't have to. Just take my word for it....stay at the Le Meridien the next time your in San Francisco. I will be back!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Spent two nights at the Le Meridien, got upgraded the second night to a business suite. Accommodating service, although we did get called for some noise complaints despite just having a few friends over with no music. Walls are a little thin, but aside from that, an excellent experience.

review.title: Might return - like Starwood Hotels in General
review.reviewText:
The hotel is terrific, overall, although I have some comments about the specific room we were in.
.
One of the beds (doubles) squeaked very loud, waking me up during the night.
The door to the bathroom was really heavy, hard to open and close and also squeaked very loud. I don't know how a disabled person could open and close the door.

We were able to walk everywhere we wanted or needed to go. If we had chosen instead, we could have used SF's public transportation.

review.title: I would love to go back!
review.reviewText:
When we first arrived, we were greeted by friendly valets. They were very knowledgable about the surrounding area, which garages would give the best rates, etc. I opted to park the car at the hotel valet. I was impressed with their helpfulness in taking bags from our shopping voyages to our car.
The hotel inside was very clean, and orderly. I was very much impressed with the inside decor, very modern and clean lines. I enjoyed it.
The concierge inside was very helpful in finding the cheapest yet most effective ways of traveling around the city which helped us from paying for additional parking in the city.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Great service, upgraded to a suite, good location.

review.title: modern and upscale
review.reviewText: great hotel

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We checked in 2 hours early and upgraded to the top floor for a small additional fee. The view was fantastic as well as the comfort of the bed. Very quiet as well. The only negatives would be no coffee pot in the room and only order room service if you have deep pockets. Breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel was terrific. We will surely stay again.

review.title: Paying for bells and whistles? Fail!
review.reviewText:
We paid a premium price to stay at a nice hotel on our honeymoon, instead we paid a premium price to say we stayed at a Starwood hotel. Too bad they don't mean the same thing. All of the friendliness, pampering, and plushness you expect at a hotel like this was not offered. The desk staff could not be bothered. Every interaction with them seemed to exasperate them. Our room was not equipped for our stay: one bathroom, one set of towels, no fitted sheet on the bed. I called housekeeping, and we were given another set of towels. The alarm clock went off at 2 AM on our first night. The phone in our room didn't work. The second day, they took our bathrobe--and were not given a replacement. They did put a sheet on the bed (a flat sheet, folded loosely around the base of the mattress).
This hotel is extremely attractive, well-located, and impressive superficially. However, this was not a four-star experience.

review.title: Modern hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice and modern hotel rooms. It has a nice restaurant and bar. The walls were a bit thin, but I suppose all hotel rooms are. Two complaints, one was parking was $50 a day, but the front desk said that is average price for the downtown area. The other was the glasses in the bathroom were dirty; they actually had a hair in one of the glasses.

review.title: It was comfortable and happy to stay.
review.reviewText:
It was good. However, the front desk person was little bit unflexible person.
No smile and look so serious except only one man.
Too much visit my room to clean it and knocked the door.
Sometimes too much tired to going out and sightseeing. They never call me and asked what time they'll come and clean .
Hotel basic motive is stay and sleep feel comfortably.
However, housekeeping was too kind people.

review.title: Best Stay in San Francisco Ever
review.reviewText: The hotel location is a bit off in the financial district, so the area is very quiet on weekends. It is just a few blocks from Embarcadero Station, which is very convenient. The service was amazing: with their connections, they managed to book me in for a last-minute Valentine's date in a nice steakhouse, 5A5 Lounge, nearby when I could not find a darn restaurant on my own that would take a last-minute reservation for 2. They also go me toothpaste when I forgot to pack it. I enjoyed every moment at this hotel. The only negative are the expensive drinks in the lounge downstairs.

review.title: Great Quick Trip
review.reviewText:
We flew out to San Francisco for a quick weekend and since our bodies did not adust to the time change in the 36 hours that we had, it was absolutely necessary to have a comfortable place to relax. Le Meridien fit the bill!
The staff was very friendly and attentive. I cannot say enough good things about their concierge! She was so patient and knew the neighborhood like the back of her hand! She gave us suggestions for dinner both nights we were there and both restaurants were fabulous and exactly what we asked for.

The room was very clean and spacious. The bathroom was especially roomy which was a nice change from most hotels. The beds were very comfortable and the room service was quick and delicious.

I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Excellent Hotel & Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel is on a great location, very close (walking distance) to the subway, bus & rail cars. Also shopping and dinning are very close. The staff were very polite and helpful, checked us in early and allow us late check out at no charge. The room was very clean and very comfortable and the view was great. China Town, Ferry Building are within walking distance. Fisherman's wharf and other tourist attractions are at short rail car ride.

review.title: Very convenient!
review.reviewText:
Can't say enough for the concierge (especially re: Ms. Fairbanks)! They went above and beyond on numerous occasions during my stay. The location was perfect for a long weekend getaway w/ no car (why and where would you have a car in such a pedestrian-friendly city?); surrounded by great restaurants ranging in all prices; located across from Embarcadero Center which featured, among many things, a theatre showing current independent/foreign films. And just when I thought it couldn't get any more convenient, there's a Safeway a few blocks away for buying wine to bring up (the bartender in the lobby even supplied the cork-key).
The only complaint I have is that the rooms need to be streamlined (our bathroom was a huge, beautiful marble-encased heaven, but our TV was circa early 2000s, when we passed by other interior rooms that had flat-screens).
I will return again & again, and recommend to friends in the meantime.

review.title: Can't wait to stay there again!
review.reviewText:
From the moment we drove up the service was exceptional. From the door man to the front desk staff to the concierge. All were extremely helpful and friendly. Everyone seemed to be enjoying what they were doing.

The room was quiet and well maintained. I was able to sleep comfortably which is important to me while on business in various cities.

review.title: Review your blankets before sleeping
review.reviewText:
The first night we arrived late, before going to bed I saw that my blanket was dirty, I was so tired that I didn´t want to complain and I thought it would be clean the next day.. oh big surprise! the next day when I looked at my blanket it was still dirty!! So I was definitively upset and called the cleaning room and the lady came, I told her to change the blanket but she was challenging me until I show her the dirty area she immediately replace the blaket but with a very bad attitud.

The bed was not so comfortable, there were days where I couldnt sleep at all.

review.title: a lovely hotel, friendly staff
review.reviewText: We will definitely go back, even though it's not as centrally located as others we've stayed at. It means more walking, but in SF, that's always a pleasure. And it's worth it.

review.title: Nice upscale hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, formerly the Park Hyatt, adjacent to Embarcadero Center in SF. Rooms are comfortable, staff is friendly and location is good.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean, roomy, updated, a great value. The staff were helpful. The only downside is that I was there on a weekend and the surrounding area is not very busy (the financial district) on the weekend so about 2/3 of the shops and restaurants are closed. But it was a short walk (blocks) to busier areas and I felt very safe. I would highly recommend it, especially during the week or if you are looking for a little quiet on the weekend.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Stayed here on a special rate. For the money, it was excellent. Rooms and beds were nice, staff and concierge were nice. A great stay

review.title: Wonderful bed
review.reviewText: Great location which is why we chose it. GREAT bed and sheets. It would have been nice to have a night light to find the bathroom. Our room was near the elevator shaft and we could hear the whooooomp of the elevator going up and down during the nighttime. I missed a coffeepot in the room.

review.title: ask about parking!!!
review.reviewText:
would not recomend. room rate good but add parking cost makes it a bad deal
not a value. the parking cost is not included.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: I was expecting that a four star hotel located in the business district should have more efficient service. There were a couple times we couldn't get the front desk by phone. Either we got an immediate response or they said they would get back to us but we never heard from them again. Otherwise overall, this is a very comfortable hotel.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely nice. We arrived at 10am and we were immediately checked in even though check-in wasn't until 3pm. The location was fairly central to many sights although it does take a bit of walking. I would recommend the hotel.

review.title: Le Meridien
review.reviewText: Very convenient public transportation(via Bart) from SF airport to the hotel!!

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Le Meridien is right at the Embarcadero Center. The hotel is luxurious and elegant, but was comfortable with having children. Parking is exorbitant, and much cheaper alternatives are literally across the street, inside the Embarcadero Center.

review.title: Lack of cleanliness killed the deal for us. Too bad cause everything was great.
review.reviewText: Park across the street on Battery. $32 per day opposed to $50 at hotel. Awesome meal at Il Forniao on Battery and Trattorino Pinnochia on Columbus. Great breakfast at Mama's on Washington Square but expect a long wait.

review.title: Not impressed with the maid service
review.reviewText:
Housekeeping didn't provide soap for both the shower and the sink. When we requested it, they brought extra, only to take the extra away the next day.
We also felt that $56 per day for parking (including tax) was unbelievably expensive. Because of that the excellent room rates became much less impressive.

review.title: Stay here :)
review.reviewText: Le Meridien is a really nice hotel in a great location , you can walk to the Ferry Building, North Beach, Chinatown or Union Square quite easily and there is always a cab ready to take you to anywhere you'd prefer not to walk.. The rooms are nice and spacious with wonderful linens. They have a restaurant that is quite decent but pricey. There is a pub directly across the street and a Starbucks or Peet's, your choice also on the block. The staff is wonderful! The concierge will answer any question you might ask and get you reservations to dinner or a show or both! They'll also lend you an umbrella if it rains :) All in all a great hotel!

review.title: good hotel at downtown location and good price
review.reviewText: at this downtown location the hotel presents a good deal to the guest in terms of its services, building and room maintenance and trendy interior design. top of that you would have a ocean view every morning you wake up. there are a good restaurant and starbucks cafe right across the hotel for your breakfast if you do not want to eat in the hotel.

review.title: Easy, Comfortable, Stylish - Would Go Back
review.reviewText:
Overall: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights during Christmas. Hotel afforded us a great experience.

Room: We had a great room with a partial bay view on the top floor (24th), but this was partially because we are also SPG members. Room was stylish, comfortable, and large. View was great -- could see the Transamerica pyramid, the Coit Tower, and a bit of the Bay Bridge. I was extremely pleased with the room.

Service: Check-in staff was extremely help and friendly. Only complaint was the eagerness of cleaning crew to clean our room -- I got a call at 9am one day asking when I would like to have it cleaned. During my vacations, at 9am I'm still partially asleep. Remote control was quickly fixed (batteries) after a call.

Dining: Had brunch at hotel restaurant and ordered room service. Both were a pleasant experience. Hotel prices, of course, but good food.

Location: Walking distance to Embarcadero shopping and to the Ferry building. I loved the area.

Would I go back to the same hotel? A resounding Yes!

review.title: good for business, not leisure
review.reviewText:
the hotel is fine, very clean and good staff. however, it is not suitably located for anyone in sf for leisure. it is in the very center of the financial district, so it's fantastic for business, but otherwise inconvenient.
There isn't much in terms of food or entertainment nearby, and the hotel restaurant closes quite early (forces you to get room service, which is extremely pricey).
Although the rooms themselves are nice enough (generic) and have great beds, the decor is very tired, and the bathrooms and lobby/elevator areas could really use a facelift.
it was good for us because we got a fantastic deal over the holidays (no one is IN the financial district doing business then!), but I doubt that we would pick it again, considering the caliber of hotels san francisco has to offer.

review.title: Good price and decor
review.reviewText:
This hotel was a good find for the price we got a one bedroom, nicely decorated suite complete with a living room and full kitchen. Breakfast was also included. We stayed New Year's Eve so the location of the hotel was convenient for us to walk downtown and the Internet was free unlike other hotels I've stayed at. The parking rate was also reasonable compared to the bay area!

One thing that irritated me was a charge for a movie that we didn't purchase as we never even turned on the television that night. The front desk person took off the charge though.
.

review.title: Very nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: We paid for a bay-view room. The room didn't have a lot of windows, and the view was partially blocked (the best views by far were from a large window and balcony off of the bathroom) -- but still worth the additional cost as the San Francisco Bay is magnificent. The room was very comfortable. I thnk the city-view rooms may be a tad more recently renovated than the bay-view rooms, but, as I said, we were very statisfied with our choice. I also liked the hotel's location: although the financial district is not as lively as, say, Union Square, it has a lot of character and is within walking distrance on everything from the Embarcadero to Coit Tower to Union Square to Chinatown to a Bart/Muni station..

review.title: Good for the right price
review.reviewText:
The Meridien is a very nice hotel, but wasn't quite up to the 4 stars I expected. It seemed a bit dated (the bathroom mostly), especially compared to other similarly-rated San Francisco hotels.
Pros: Very comfortable beds, a good amount of space, and a good location (financial district, close to the Ferry Building).
Cons: Older bathroom, worth the regular price but definitely worth it for a discounted price.

review.title: A Hidden Gem
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a only 1 mile from the beach and it is surrounded by shopping, Whole Food store, Pharmacy all walking distance. The staff were helpful and friendly. The complimentary breakfast was super, with great French pastries, Starbucks coffee, yogurt, fresh fruit etc they are just extra-ordinary. Complimentary underground parking, shuttle services and Wi-Fi. The most impressive was the eco-friendly. Each room is equipped with recycle bin.
The walls between the rooms are a bit thin but tolerable. What is lacking in the room is movie channels, however, the room has DVD player which you can bring your own movie or rent something for the night. I will definitely stay there again and again.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, staff was very nice. of course, parking prices are high in San Francisco and you have to pay for your valet parking here (46.00 a night). But it was a luxury treatment and was nice. The beds were the best and I kept thinking I was home because they were so comfortable. But, the financial district is not the ideal place to stay for tourists.

review.title: Exceptional!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. My room was ready when I arrived and it was clean and beautiful. The room view was panoramic of San Francisco. The concierge was helpful and accommodating, as was the doorman. I was within walking distance of BART transportation. I couldn't imagine a better hotel experience.

review.title: Great for downtown SF
review.reviewText: Just a really good and pleasant hotel to stay in.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Very friendly and polite staff.

review.title: Ready for a return visit!
review.reviewText: My husband and I have been visitng San Francisco for twenty years and have stayed a many different hotels. We typically lean towards hotels in the Union Square area and decided to try the Le Meridien in the Financial District this year. We were quite please with our choice - not only the location, but also the hotel. The rooms were great, and the staff seemed to go out of their way to make us feel welcome and appreciated. We were pleasantly surprised to learn that they offered complimentary laundry service for work out clothes. That was a fabulous touch and one that we really appreciated!

review.title: Would Not Book Here Again
review.reviewText: My husband and I travelled for Thanksgiving. The hotel was "nice" but I expected a little better than "nice". I was very distraught after the fact that everyday when we returned to our room, I found hairs on a daily basis, either on the bathroom sink, the tub, or on the toilet seat. I have short hair and definitely they were not mine. The hotel restaurant closes after lunch and if you want to dine you need to do it on the bar on the lobby. I found their food outrageously expensive and the hotel location not the best unless you are conducting business and need to stay at the Financial District. Everything closed on Saturdays and some even after 6;00pm. Next time will look for something in Union Square.

review.title: Beautiful place to stay
review.reviewText: I stayed here for a 3 night stay, and this is a first class hotel. Services were all wonderful, and the room comfortable and clean. Great bed!! Short walk to Union Square, we actually walked through Chinatown all the way to Fishermans Wharf. Love this hotel at the price we got.

review.title: Great, especially at weekend rates
review.reviewText: Nice

review.title: Great Hotel. Real Bargain!
review.reviewText: The only negative was that the parking was Steep! On weekends, there is a lot around the corner that if you get your car by 8 AM the next morning, it's very inexpensive.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Le Meridien was very comfortable. Simple, elegant decor. The room was a good size. A problem with our running toilet was fixed quickly. The hotel accomodated our early check-in/late check-out request. Great weekend rate.

review.title: Great location, terrific concierge!
review.reviewText: My husband & I were stayed at LeMeridien for only 1 night. We were very happy with the room, service and location. The concierge was extremely helpful with restaurant selections--we ate at a great little Spanish Tapas place the first night. Came back through to retrieve a jacket we left and the concierge referred us to a lovely family owned Italian restaurant.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied about our stay in this hotel. The only negative points we experienced is that the internet was not free. Also the price for breakfast is high.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: all requested items were granted,great staff, clean room.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff , excellent acomodations . Close to the best attractions .

review.title: Never again!
review.reviewText: While we thought we got a great price on the room we soon learned why,there is no parking with the exception of valet parking at $55.00 per day. We were on a motorcycle and valet could not drive the bike to park it so they "let" us park near the service entrance for the great deal of $55.00 per night, what a deal! So we stayed 2 nights but paid for 3, never again.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, fabulous location
review.reviewText: Our weekend in San Francisco was made all the more wonderful by our stay at Le Meridien. We got a an executive king room with a view of the Bay--worth the few dollars more--and loved looking at the sailboats in the distance. The rooms are furnished with stylish, modern clean lines; the bathroom was fabulous; room service; the staff really friendly. An added bonus: the location. The hotel is connected by a bridge that goes over the streets to the Embarcadero Center. From there, it's a short walk to the Ferry Building and restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel but disappointed with parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and we enjoyed most aspects of our stay - food, concierge, room size, cleaniless of the room - but were very disappointed with the parking option. We could only valet park - or so we were told - and they charged $50+tax. We were told that all hotels in SF charged this much but I stayed in NY and other expensive cities and never had to pay this much. I won't stay here again and look for other options.

review.title: Great stay! We'll be back!
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel! The decor was modern and hip. The room was spacious and clean. We got a great rate and it was worth every penny. The location was great too. Walking distance to Chinatown and the Ferry Bldg.

review.title: Great Hotel w/i Walking Distance of the Embarcadero and Downtown SF
review.reviewText: The staff were very warm and friendly. The view, location and comfort of the bed were all fantastic. The lobby bar was a little pricey, but the service was amazing and attentive. I would definitely return to SF and stay here again.

review.title: Was Impressed
review.reviewText: Le Meridien was very modern and rooms were large and had a nice view of Golden Gate bridge. Rate was not bad either for what you got. I highly recommend the hotel.

review.title: Will visit again!
review.reviewText: I frequently visit family in the bay area, this time we chose Le Meridien for our long weekend. The room was beautiful...awesome views. The hotel staff was courteous and friendly. Parking was expensive though....I would go back tomorrow if I could.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The customer service was so poor! Acquiring information from staff was terrible. Not once did someone ask if we were doing okay. I will never use the hotel again! The staff semmed to have attitude.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Loved it, Loved it...Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel at good location. The breakfast buffet could need some improvements (limited selections).

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: Loved the service and the balcony

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful decor, courteous staff, several nice lounge areas near the lobby where you can have drinks. I had an overall great experience staying at this hotel.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: Great stay, the consierge was amazing and made the entire trip very enjoyable.

review.title: I Loved It!
review.reviewText: When I first walked into the room I went "WOW!" because of the view from the windows and the chic modern decoration of the inteior designing. I absolutely loved the huge floor to ceiling windows, I could see the partial view of the ocean (SF Bay) and the bay bridge. Loved the view of the city also. I ordered a room service and the jumbo shrimp coktail was to die for!! They brought the food really fast which was good because I was hungry. Loved the down feather comforter and pillows. Loved the bathroom. Clean and nice interior. Loved the bathrobe. I had the best time staying here. I would stay there again and definitely recommend to friends and family.

review.title: Very comfortable, luxurious and convenient
review.reviewText: The rooms were remarkably quiet and the bed was very comfortable..much like home. The hotel is smaller than you would expect; however the business center is very convenient and the location can't be beat...walking distance to most attractions. And you just have to cross over the bridge to catch a late movie at the embarcadero art house. We stayed in a studio suite...nice size however the couch and chaire were surprising uncomfortable and therefore pretty useless. A standard room would have been sufficient.

review.title: Great hotel but very pricey
review.reviewText: The Le Meridien is clearly one of the best hotels in SF. Location is great and the staff is super friendly. Only the high price for the room and additional charges for any other services (internet, breakfast) limit my enthusiasm. If you are in SF only for business and cost are a factor, there are plenty of better deals out there. If you want to feel pampered, this is the right place to go.

review.title: Great hotel with a view
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a good price. Easy walk to most tourist area's. Get a room with the bay view, well worth it.

review.title: San Fransisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: The Le Meridien is very modern and beauitiful, This was the cleanest hotel I have stayed in.It does not have coffee makers in the room but they are happy to bring you one.

review.title: Time for a little TLC
review.reviewText: Over the years, I have stay at this property both under current management and when it flew a different flag. I was always pleased; until now. My suite was dirty, and it was clear someone had smoked in the room. The sofa and chairs were stained, walls marked and carpet stained. The hallways were also scratched and unsightly. They need to spend a little money and clean the place up, or at least the floor I was on. Hotel seems to be attracting the tour bus crowd.

review.title: A great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: If you would like a nice quiet hotel centrally located to all the SF hot spots, I would highly recommend the Meridien. The financial district is perfect and close to the wharf, the embocodero, etc. And it's a lovely hotel. Everyone was very professional and the maintenance is excellent.

review.title: Excellent hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Had a great 7 night stay with my wife - we had a studio suite on the 21st floor which had glorious views of the bay and coit tower. everything worked out fine,the only negative was that the walls are a little thin and neighbours and one group of mature revellers did keep us up on a couple of occasions. Apart from that no complaints and would reccomend it absolutely.

review.title: Comfortable with no frills
review.reviewText: The hotel offeres large, clean rooms although the promised view for the room we payed for was minimal at best. I was not happy about having to pay for internet access along with the relatively high bill.

review.title: Great Hotel....beware of the parking!
review.reviewText: Great location. Convenient access to public transportation. The hotel room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. Great views of the Bay Bridge. One drawback was overnight parking cost....they say $49 per night, but there are extra "charges" so the total was about $56 per night....which was MORE than the car rental fee....either look for alternative lots or use public transportation! Otherwise great experience.

review.title: Great Hotel In Financial District
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Le Meridien in San Francisco. The hotel is in the financial district and away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. It is a few blocks from Little Italy and Chinatown. It is next to the Embarcadero Mall with great shops and restaurants. They accomodated our request for early check in and pet free room since I have allergies and asthma. The room is clean. Nice bed and linens. The hotel staff is also great. Very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we go back to SF.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel is fairly good. Position of the Hotel is very good for visiting San Francisco. They charge for Internet and they overcharge for parking and valet. The desk in the room is foolish.

review.title: will go again.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, and location. Staff very atentive.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: beautiful. Friendly staff. Greagt location near shopping and entertainment

review.title: I'll Go Back
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for the San Francisco Marathon. The hotel staff were very good and were ready for the influx of runners. They must be used to this event year after year because they clearly catered to the needs of the numerous runners staying at the hotel.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: It was fun to stay in the financial district...a different neighborhood which was a nice change from the touristy sections near the wharf. Our room was very nice and had a view of the Bay Bridge. The staff was accommodating and granted a late checkout due to a special event we were attending in the area. $50 for parking for one night was the most I've ever spent in the city...but, it is San Francisco after all.

review.title: A nice stay
review.reviewText: Overall I was pleased with Le Meridien; the location was great - pretty central for walking everywhere and the service, especially housekeeping, was great. The only downside is that the sliding door to the bathroom doesn't provide a ton of privacy. Otherwise I really enjoyed my room and the hotel - I had a really stunning view of the Bay and my king sized bed was luxurious.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. It was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, great location, and comfortable rooms. I did not have to use my car at all, because everything was within a walking distance.Parking fees are quiet expensive.

review.title: very comfortable
review.reviewText: very quiet and good central location with view.

review.title: Very Classy
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel! Got a great price and we were very impressed with the services offered, location and staff. Only issue was that we requested two doubles and they weren't able to accommodate and we had to share a king instead.

review.title: Nice weekend getaway
review.reviewText: We stayed here on a Saturday night to celebrate my husband's birthday. The hotel was clean and service was fine. The only complaint we had was not really the hotel's fault. The room next door to us ended up being a "party" room for a wedding and the noise was incredible until quite late. We were just about to call the front desk, when they finally quieted down. This hotel is very convenient to the Embarcadero and its shops, as well as the very popular Pier 19 with its restaurants and farmers market. Parking is expensive, but luckily street parking is free on Saturday beginning at 6:00 p.m. through Sunday.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: Disappointing considering the location and price.

review.title: Wonderful Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Le Meridien Hotel was very clean, comfortable and very roomy. Staff was very helpful. It was a wonderful place to stay in San Francisco and walking distance to everything.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Great location to explore San Francisco on foot - e.g. in on one direction, it is walking distance through The Embarcadero Center to the Ferry Building, the waterfront, and the Giant's ATT Park; in another direction, one can walk through the city to experience Chinatown, North Beach, and touristy Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel first put us in a room that smelled of cigarette smoke; but easily relocated us with apologies to another truely non-smoking room.

review.title: Just what we wanted
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the business district, but it was easy to get anywhere. The ferry building and the art museum were within walking distance, as was the BART and the buses. There was lots of parking in the area at night and on Sunday, but you are better off without a car. Cabs are relatively cheap, and the hotel charges $50 to park a car overnight. The concierges were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: very nice hotel --great staff--it is a perfect place for a get away weekend in san-francisco---quiet but still close to everything--

review.title: Our go-to weekend hotel
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I often take spur of the moment weekend trips to San Francisco. Over the last three years we have tried quite a few of the 4+ star hotels in the Union Square and Financial Districts. We believe that the Le Meridian is the hands down best value on weekend nights. We have stayed over half a dozen times and been nothing but delighted with the service, quality and comfort. Great bedding, great bathrooms and bath products, always clean, prompt service--just no complaints.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: No complaints.

review.title: Quality hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in the financial district, about 4 blocks to the Ferry building and Embarcadero. the room was modern and clean, and had a peekaboo view of the bay. This is not the area for shopping on weekends as everything is geared towards the business week, but great if you want to catch up on your sleep (very little traffic on weekends). The terrace restaurant was great for brunch (weekends). Really recommend this hotel if you can get a decent rate. It is one of the few 4 stars that is truly a 4 star.

review.title: Anniversary Weekend
review.reviewText: Had the studio suite... great room, would go back for sure. One bad thing... don't order the late night menu pizza, we would have been better off going hungry.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I was traveling with my husband and 2 year old from Southern California. The Hotel was very curtious and checked us in immediately, the location of the hotel is great the bridge attaches to the Embarcadero, and Pier 1 is only a 5 minute walk. The room was a great size for my child to run around and play in. Loved the shower head and the decor is very modern. The only negative is the walls are a little thin and I could hear the neighbor.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Le Meridian for a leisure trip. We stayed for two night- saturday and sunday nights, its located in the financial district and muni/bart are all within 10 minutes walking distance. Although keep in mind most restaurant shops are closed during the weekend. Rooms were clean and very well maintained.

review.title: classy
review.reviewText: Hotel was very classy, clean, and well managed. We probably could not normally afford a place like this but we got a great discount at the time. Hotel was very conveniently located and walking distance to Chinatown, Fisherma's Warf, Bart, Cable Cars, and other downtown locations.

review.title: Hidden Jewel
review.reviewText: We always like to stay in the Embarcadero area on weekends because it's much quieter than other areas of SF. We stayed here for the first time and will definitely be back. Great location, great service and the room was wonderful (we got a studio suite and it had great views). The lobby served coffee in the mornings and has a nice bar for drinks and appetizers.

review.title: Great for business not so much for a getaway.
review.reviewText: While the hotel was stylish and conviently located in the financial center of the city, I found the overall vibe of the hotel to be geared more towards business travelers. However, I was there for a weekend getaway and being located in the financial hub of town the area was dead.

review.title: Really Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We really, really loved this hotel, and the staff. We put in our comments section under our booking that it was our 10th wedding anniversary, and they upgraded us for free for 8 nights! The conceirges were completely amazing, and kind and helpful! We especially liked that it wasn't in the heavy tourist area down by fishermans wharf, it was close to trolley cars, embarcadero, piers, coit tower, china town etc...

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Le Meridien was a really nice hotel. We arrived really early at 8am and they got us checked into our room right away. The hotel was walking distance from a lot of areas so it was great.

review.title: Fabulous hotel!
review.reviewText: Outstanding value. We had an amazing room, with a beautiful view of the bay. Conveniently located. I would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else..

review.title: 4 Star Hotel at a 3 Star Price
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the Le Meridien San Francisco. I chose it because of the pictures on Expedia and the special rate that I got. I got a better deal on this hotel than other hotels that I knew were of a lesser quality. It was a chic modern hotel. I really enjoyed the decor in the lobby and lounge area. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. I never ate at the hotel because I thought the food was a bit too expensive for what it was. Initially I was disappointed because I was in the Financial District on a weekend, which means that almost everything around it closed early and wasn't open on the weekend, but it is actually walking distance to the Ferry Building and to a BART station. Great staff, great rooms. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Except for being woken up by some protesting employees at 7 am on a Saturday morning (the hotel staff was very apologetic), this was a great stay.

review.title: Beuatiful Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Last minute trip planned to San Fran. Decided to stay at the Le Meridien since we were bringing our 21 month old and needed the room of the 535sq ft suite. Took the BART train from SFO airport which was a half hour ride, 5 bucks and 2 blocks from the hotel. No hassels and got to the hotel around 11am. Went to drop off our bags with a plan to walk around the city for a while and the front desk let us check in early. Awesome! The suite was spacious as advertised with a 42" plasma that swiveled from the king size bed to the living room with a small view of the bay bridge. Walking distance to everything and plenty of dining nearby. 1/2 price Happy Hour to boot in the hotel. Great lobby for hanging out and kids were welcome. Grat stay and can't wait to go back. Thanks Le Meridian for a memeorable weekend!

review.title: good..
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the place alot!

review.title: Great hotel in the Financial district. Close to restaurants, movie theater, cigar store.
review.reviewText: Great service, lacking a good in hotel restaurant for dinner. All other meals are in the 3rd floor restaurant that also has a patio.

review.title: The best hotel ever!!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I went for a get-away weekend. The room was spectacular, the food delicious, and the location was wonderful. No need for a car, so many wonderful sights within walking distance. I would go back there again and highly recommend it!!

review.title: would definitely return
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time staying at Le Meridien and had gotten a great deal on a long weekend stay. We loved being close to Fisherman's wharf and walking through the city to the shopping district. After finding so much good food everywhere in the city, we were also really thankful for the hotel gym (which is more fully equipped than most) and complimentary water, fruit, towel service and earphones that they offered.

review.title: Excellent SF hotel
review.reviewText: We live in suburbs of SF and wanted to spend 24 hours there. This hotel had extremely low wknd rates and made for a great weekend getaway. Well located. Parking is very expensive but the affordable hotel room helped.

review.title: Excellent hotel, great location, friendly staff!
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely, the staff was extremely friend, it was reasonably priced, and in a great location. The rooms themselves were very nice, extremely clean and SO comfortable. I would recommend this hotel 100%.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay. Everyone was helpful, pleasant and really went out of their way to make us happy. The hotel is perfectly located and we shall certainly return.

review.title: Really enjoyed this hotel.
review.reviewText: I really ejoyed my stay which was only one night, I would like to go when I can stay longer and enjoy more of the amenities. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. And, it smelled so good, I love that.

review.title: nice bed
review.reviewText: confort

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: I stay at Le Meridien several times a month for business. It is an outstanding hotel in the heart of San Francisco's business district, yet close to local visitor attractions as well. Friendly staff, top notch cleanliness and comfort.

review.title: Convenient & Comfortable
review.reviewText: I stayed at LeMeridien for 4 nights to attend a professional conference at another hotel a few blocks away.(I found a great deal on Expedia for this hotel.) My room was extremely comfortable and I can't say enough good things about the concierge. She was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. If you are lucky enough to be there on a Saturday morning you must walk down the street a few blocks to the Farmers Market. I didn't eat at the restaurants or order room service since I was on a very tight budget and they were a little pricey for me. But just across the street is the Embarcadero which has a fair variety of less expensive food options. And there is a Starbucks on the corner. If I am lucky enough to go back to SF and can get a good deal on the LeMeridien I'd be there without question!

review.title: Great Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for the first half of our San Francisco vacation and we loved it. Very conveniently located to the Ferry Building,the Embarcadaro and walking distance to Chinatown. The staff was very helpful and the hotel itself if quiet lovely. It has a great gym that is well equipped and they provide free internet service in the business center which is a big plus. I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Wonderful place to stay, but the parking and food are pricey.

review.title: Unaccomodating Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: I had to stay at Le Meridien for six nights on business. When I checked in they admitted that I had one of the nosiest rooms in the hotel (due to nearby mechanical systems), and yet throughout the stay they refused to switch my room. While the bed was comfortable due the noise I got very little sleep. The staff was polite, but very unaccomodating. Since I am now traveling regularly to SF for work I will be staying at another hotel since I cannot afford to miss more sleep.

review.title: Good place, clean, comfortable bed.
review.reviewText: Great service - excellent location.

review.title: A real find!
review.reviewText: A nice hotel in a great location, walking distance to China town, Union Square and a long walk to Fishermans wharf. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was a class act!!

review.title: FABULOUS!
review.reviewText: From the first time to the last time we walked through the doors, our stay was absolutely wonderful. The room had every comfort possible (the bed was amazing). My only gripe was that the concierge was a bit capricious, however, we were capable of finding information on our own, so for us it didn't matter. For others it might. We've already booked a stay at the same hotel, different city.

review.title: Lack of communication
review.reviewText: The staff should have had better communication in regards to their "normal" operating procedures. A huge hassle could have been avoided had the staff answered questions in full detail.

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, great location, rooms and staff. Will definitely return for another stay.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel is pretty--nice new lobby, and rooms appear to have been rennovated with marble countertop in bathroom. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. But amazingly, considering the amount of money put into making this place nice, they apparently did not spend a dime on insulating / sound proofing walls. We could hear every word uttered by the people on both sides of us, plus their TV. It's great to have a nice flat screen TV, but I only want to listen to the one in my room! That said, the location is great and the staff friendly. If you have time, take the 76 MUNI bus from Market across the Golden Gate bridge--you won't regret it.

review.title: Increadible views of the Mississippi
review.reviewText: Great food, great bars, great service

review.title: Excellent service!
review.reviewText: Our room was very clean and beautiful with windows that opened right onto a view of the city. The concierge was extremely helpful in securing a rental car for us when the cars were in short supply over a holiday weekend.

review.title: Thoroughly recommended
review.reviewText: Even though we arrived 90 minutes before the check in time it wasn't a problem, the lady on the desk couldn't have been more pleasant and upgraded us to a bay-view room on the 20th floor. The hotel is in the financial district and this means if you stay over a week-end the area is very quiet but this isn't a problem unless you need a coffee after 6pm... There is no pool but the fitness room is well equipped. A business centre is located just off the lobby with 3 terminals and a printer so flight check in and the printing of boarding passes can be done easily and for free. The staff are excellent, our 5 year old banged his nead on a bannister in the lobby whilst we were awaiting out cab for the airport and within a minute 2 ice packs, a box of tissues and a glass of iced water were presented to him.

review.title: Clean, modern and convenient. Friendly staff.
Le Meridien
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and clean. Our room was decorated with contemporary furniture which I always love in a hotel. Service was excellent. Location was walking distance to the Ferry bldg which we loved. My only complaints are that room service was too expensive but that is all hotels and now that I'm used to watching TV in digital, the TV looked like crap. They need to move to digital broadcast.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The Hotel was beautiful, the staff were awesome and we loved our stay with them. They are good examples of what great customer service is all about. We were celebrating our 33rd wedding anniversary and they made us feel so special the whole time we were there. Great location, nice walk to the Ferry Building nice walk to Pier 39 plus nice walk to North Beach. We had a wonderful weekend and from now on will only stay at the LeMeredien.

review.title: Great for business travelers
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in an excellent business location. Clean, modern and good service.

review.title: Great hotel if you don't have a car
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nihgts in March 09. I can't fault the hotel or the staff. The location is quiet but a little out of the way if you are a tourist wanting to see the sights on foot. The valet parking is very expensive at $49+tax per night.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: first time to SF - great location. No spa in hotel and room service food wasn't great. There's a supermarket a couple of blocks away. GREAT pizza joint down the street.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Room was clean. Appetizers were very tasty and the menu offered a good variety. Close to many venues, friendly staff.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My husband was attending a seminar at the Hyatt. We prefer a more intimate setting and greatly enjoyed Le Meridan. There are some great restaurants within a short walking distance.

review.title: Very, very nice
review.reviewText: Great hotel, excellent location, awesome room service.

review.title: Clean and comfort hotel in Financial district in San Fran.
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with the staffs and my room. However, it was hard to find restaurants, particularly in weekend. Everything else was great.

review.title: Great location, great rooms
review.reviewText: The room was fantastic. The sliding glass doors let in fresh air and really brightened the room up. My only complaint was that the bed was really uncomfortable. I woke up with a stiff neck and back each night. Other than that, the hotel was fantastic.

review.title: City hotel with fabulous service
review.reviewText: Greatly enjoyed our stay at the Le Meridien. Hotel was extremely comfortable with terrific service, especially from entire concierge staff. Hotel is within a half mile of most major tourist areas. If cabs or walking are not your thing, perhaps stay at another hotel closer to the action. Otherwise, you can't go wrong with the Le Meridien.

review.title: Amazing !!
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautiful, location perfect and rooms were spacious and super comfy and clean. Staff called us by name and were beyond friendly and helpful

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: I was very happy with my stay here. I came into the hotel around midnight very tired were they welcomed me and treated me very well. Even though most people going through the doors were in suits and/or nice clothes I got treated very nicely in my wrinkled jeans and sweatshirt. I got a complimentary upgrade to a suite. With the good rate I got on Expedia, I couldn't of got more for my money. Very happy. The only knock I have was the wi-fi wasn't free, which I expect from any hotel especially a nicer one. And they accidentally charged my room for a meal we didn't order, but were very quick to offer apologies and make it all better.

review.title: Wonderful room with a view!
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean and quite just what my husband and i were looking for. Front desk was great at recomending a resturant for dinner.

review.title: Nice... except the bed....
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good service, Valet parking a bit too much, but the Bed was terrible. So uncomfortable, and made both our backs hurt. The pillows didn't help either, you can ask for extra firm or nothingness. We got a great price, the location is good, but being in the room made our trip difficult.

review.title: Great view; clean and quiet
review.reviewText: Stayed on 24th (top) floor, overooking Coit's tower and the water, fog-permitting! Go to the Ferry Building for food - highly recommended and a 5-minute amble from your well-appointed room. Gym is empty at 6am - perfect for those of you, like us, jet-lagged and up and about at the crack of dawn...

review.title: Nice property and location
review.reviewText: Everything was great however one of the evenings I had to leave the hotel because the hotel Workers had a March surrounding the hotel demanding that the hotel be a Union hotel. Very loud and disturbing.

review.title: I'll definitely come back
review.reviewText: The best!

review.title: Always our favorite
review.reviewText: As always Le Meridien was excellent. Service was impressive, rooms clean and beautiful. Beds were heavenly. Almost every room has a great view. Our favorite part is the silence. It is one of the quietest hotels I have every stayed in. You are guaranteed a great nights sleep. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Union Square and just a few minutes walk from the embarcadero.

review.title: stylist and comfortable SF getaway
review.reviewText: We live in the suburbs and wanted a night in SF. This was relaxing, quiet, yet cool and hip. We enjoyed the lobby bar and modern hotel room. The price was excellent!

review.title: Luxury in the financial district
review.reviewText: This was an unexpected delight. The staff allowed me to check in hours before the listed time. My room was large and comfortable with a fabulous bathroom. My room service breakfast arrived on time, and was delicious. The hotel is a few blocks from the Ferry Terminal , a brisk walk to Chinatown and Union Square, and across the street from the Embarcadero Center. I'd love to return.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The price was right - but parking was expensive!

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Beautifully appointed rooms and close to BART, the Ferry MarketPlace, Union Square.

review.title: Good location for business
review.reviewText: Front desk was courteous; rooms were large and clean and staff made us feel welcome.

review.title: ok, but not great
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice, in a convenient location for everything, away from the general bustle of San Francisco, and the staff are very polite and helpful. However, I think this is the first hotel I have ever stayed in, regardless of star rating that does provide simple tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. I ordered a wake up call that never happened. It has a very small lobby bar which is useable, and upstairs a dining room and another bar but they are almost never open despite the number of people walking through the area and asking why its all closed (even at 8.30pm on a Friday and Saturday night!) The hotel has a small well equiped gym, but no pool. I'm not sure it really deserves its price nor its stars, I'd stay elsewhere if I were ever to visit again.

review.title: Excellent hotel in every respect.
review.reviewText: My room had a beautiful view of Telegraph hill and the bay. The room was very attractive; staff was very helpful.

review.title: high tone but understated.
review.reviewText: The Le Meredian is a very nice hotel. My only beef is that the windos opened only 1 or 2 inches and the ambient air which is always fresh in SFO, was unavailable. In it's place was the heater, AC or at the least, a fan circulating spent and stale air.

review.title: Great Value and Service
review.reviewText: Chose the hotel because of good reviews, although it was in the "business district." Found the hotel to be well run, clean, and consistent with expectations. Would certainly book this hotel again, and recommend it to others.

review.title: Le Meridian
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great part of the city. Close to embarcadero, shopping, fine dining. Can walk to nearby sites.

review.title: Loved the LeMeridien!
review.reviewText: Stayed here Jan 17th & 18th for my birthday before going to Hawaii. The hotel was modern and comfortable. Front desk and concierge were very nice and helpful. Location was excellent and views were terrific, right next to the TransAmerica Building with views of the bay.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: We got a great price that was very much worth it. The location is great. Near Chinatown, near North Beach, near the Ferry Building (great farmer's market), near Union Square, near BART. The service was excellent and helpful. The room was very comfortable. I would most definitely come here again--especially if they were offering the same price.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: rude staff

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: This hotel was centrally located. Gorgeous view.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyed a three day stay at this hotel, and found the room to be very comfortable, spacious and nicely detailed. Excellent quality all around and a great value for San Francisco.

review.title: it is not 4stars hotel
review.reviewText: -front desk people are so rude -no Restaurant in hotel -in room slipper cost -25$ -parking cost -almost 59$ per night -TV set up is so confused so it could easliy get into on demand I was at other branch before so I had great experience on le meridien but SF one is soooo bad, I am not recommend any of them!

review.title: Beautiful, Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was truly impressive. It was beautiful, the staff was helpful and courteous, and I think our room had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in at a hotel.

review.title: Nice place in the financial district
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very clean and well maintained. Staff was very accommodating. I will come back when I have more business trips in the area.

review.title: Decent hotel in a very good location with good service
review.reviewText: The hotel offers good service and very nice location. The staff is very friendly as well. The only problem we faced was due to loud guests in the near-by room. The hotel staff could not shut them up.

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel located within walking distance to Union Square. Our room was beuatiful and very clean. Im very picky about the cleanliness and it passed my standards. I would definitely stay here again. The one and only downfall was the uncomfortable couch in our room. It wasn't a huge problem becuase we weren't there very much, but if you plan on relaxing, lay on the bed instead. The couch looks nice, but that's about it. Otherwise, it was a fantastic place to stay. Alex at the concierge desk was so friendly and helpful!! We would definitely go back!

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very modern with great views of the Bay. It was located near the Embarcadero Shopping Arcade which was convenient, as well as the world-famous SF Farmer's Market on the weekends which was a treat. Only critique was the parking valet service which was very slow, especially on the day of check-out, but other than that, this was a wonderful hotel and we plan to return again.

review.title: Outstanding Hotel
review.reviewText: The minute we arrived the staff was very attentive. They went out of their way to help us in every way the could. Our room was beautiful and the hotels location was excellent.

review.title: What a wonderful time!!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful! The staff was wonderful! The location was perfect, we were only a 5 minute walk from Union Square and just a few steps from the embarcadero. The only downside was the parking which is run by a different entity than the hotel. We waited 45 minutes two days in a row for our car to brought up. The hotel to their credit took the charge of the parking off of our room charge and sent us a bottle of wine for the inconvenience. We couldn't have asked for more

review.title: Le Merdien
review.reviewText: Quiet area after banks close for the day. Located close to Ferry Building. Hotel property is clean and comforatble. Rooms are well insulated, so quiet. Apppointments & furniture nice quality. Television system is too complicated. Room sizes are above average. I did not taste any food here. Parking costs more than $50 per night. The car should get a little chocolate on a pillow, too.

review.title: Very nice, if expensive
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, although a bit on the expensive side for my tastes. It was, however, very close to where my class was being held. The staff was efficient and pleasant.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: We had a nice corner room and the bed was extremely comfortable. We made the mistake of ordering the Truffle Pomme Frites, and both ended up very sick. They taste excellent, but we both got physcially sick to our stomach. Aside from that incident, the overall hotel experience was a good one.

review.title: LAP OF LUXURY
review.reviewText: What an incredible hotel (and sshhhh, don't tell them but Expedia gave us an unbelievable rate). Don't miss the intimate "bar" in the lobby where you get the best service in the world. The Concierge even sent a FAX for us. Perfect location. Grade of A plus plus all the way!

review.title: SF Le Meridien
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice but parking is a problem and expensive. There is no coffee maker in the room and they charge $1 for a toothbrush

review.title: Impressive premier hotel
review.reviewText: Impressive hotel near the Embarcadero Center as well as the Finasncial District. The room I had overlooked Telegraph Hill and the Bay. Am incredible priceless view!! Service is outstanding without being overbearing as it is in some premier first class hotels.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was exquisite! They were very helpful and upgraded us to a room with a fabulous view at no extra charge. They allow dogs and were extremely kind to us. Would absolutely come back!!!! In fact it will be the only hotel I will stay in when I visit San Francisco again.

review.title: Excellent Service and Quality
review.reviewText: We stayed at Le Meridien when we were in the city for a concert. From the first greeting by the valet as we drove up to the last goodbye from another valet as we left, the attention and quality of the service was five star. The hotel is modern and clean, and is located in a good area of the financial district downtown. We used the concierge to find a nearby restaurant for a quick dinner and we were very impressed by his choice. The rooms were comfortable, even with the expected city-hotel thin walls (hope for quiet neighbors). We'll gladly return to this hotel.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel!!
review.reviewText: We had high expectations for this hotel and most of our expectations were met. It sits in the middle of the financial district, so we didn't really have things right at our fingertips, but it was still a nice location. We would definitely go back!

review.title: Expensive Breakfast
review.reviewText: The room-service breakfast was very expensive and lousy. I paid $35 for eggs, orange juice and coffee! Other than that, it is a very quite hotel in a beautiful and green complex...

review.title: Very Nice High end Hotel at a great price and location
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the room and the Hotel staff, especially the front desk and concierge who were wonderful. Room service for breakfast was served hot and was so Very good (and I'm picky!) all served in 20 minutes from our call.

review.title: Great Room at Reasonable Price
review.reviewText: The room was very nice & modern. Concierge was awesome.

review.title: The BEST
review.reviewText: Best hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Would love to stay at this hotel again!
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The bed was extremely comfortable and the view was fantastic.

review.title: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is located in the Financial District of San Francisco so the area is quieter out of business hours than more touristy areas like Union Square for example. However it is located at the Embarcadero shopping centre and within easy walking distance of the Bay wharfs and trolley/cable car and tram lines. Fares are cheap and public transport easy and even fun to use. A number of good cafes and restaurants are very close. This is a very good hotel. GH

review.title: Efficient and practical
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 8 nights in September. The King Room with Bay view was large, well furnished with an excellent bathroom. All of the facilities - the TV, HiFi etc were all excellent as was the view from the room. It should be noted that the daily charge for wifi does seem a bit harsh, it really should be free in a business hotel as it is in the UK. The bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the room's furniture was suitable and perfect. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and were very welcoming, although other staff tended to have a slight attitude and when I didn't tip for someone passing me my bag, I thought perhaps they were taking things a bit far! The hotel is excellently located for business and pleasure and is a great point to start your trip from. I only wish they had coffee on demand, rather than just in the mornings or facilities in the room. On the downside, the room wasn't cleaned very thoroughly every day with surfaces being ignored, bins not always emptied, nothing tidied away, towels not replenished etc. Would this stop me from returning? Of course not, no, it was a small detail in what was otherwise a great stay at an excellent hotel. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great service! Looking forward to another stay!
review.reviewText: The care and attention by the front desk was superb. Gave an upgrade that was truly impressive and based on dedication to the customer service. The only thing was that the walls must be rather thin in this building, because our neighbor complained to the front desk about noise in our room. Granted, it was 2:00 am, but still-- for a corner suite-- we should have been able to talk and enjoy ourselves in the room without disturbing others. Other than that, the room itself was positively excellent, very nice amenities, and the bed was luxurious and comfy!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The front desk staff need update on customer service.

review.title: awesome view of the bay bridge & the bay!
review.reviewText: what a modern, beautiful, & extremely comfortable place to stay! (they even had cotton balls & q-tips in the bathroom for u) overtly polite staff-all around pleasant stay! i def recommend!

review.title: We will return!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise. It is centrally located for many different activities, whether it be taking the ferry to Sausalito, taking the Muni to the ballpark, or the cable car up California street. The staff upgraded us to a room on the top floor. They were very friendly and efficient. The room was elegant, spotless and affordable. We will return.

review.title: Really Good Service
review.reviewText: We were not expecting to much from Le Meridien San Francisco, we achieved a great deal for three nights through Expedia in August 08, the hotel foyer is a tad tired, furniture needs recovering etc. the room was a corner suite, very large and comfortable with a good bed really important especially as my wife has back problems. The service was first class, especially the Concierge who recommended some fantastic restaurants at short notice, sorted out flight check in and arranged all transport with infinite ease and courtesy. Well done!!

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Expedia was offering a good deal which attracted us in the first place. I was a little worried that Le Meridien is in the financial district, but in fact it is totally irrelevant. We found that the central location was much better than the position of the hotels on Fishermans Wharf, as most things were within walking distance. We had intended to have 2 interconnecting rooms but somewhere along the line this change into 2 seperate rooms. The hotel staff sorted this out with no fuss whatsoever and moved us on the second night for the rest of our 5 day stay.

review.title: Best hotel on our trip
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were helpful, delivered coffee making facilities when requested, had a business centre offering free internet access and printing facilities, hotel was clean and rooms we stayed in appeared to be newly refurbished (looked like new hotel inside). Rooms were also quite large unlike other hotels we stayed in. Only 5 mins away from restaurants and a few minutes in cab to Pier 39.

review.title: Modern, elegant, and sophisticated hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was really nice. The room was comfortable, very clean, close to the main attractions in San Francisco. I love the modern and contemporary style. Next time visiting San Francisco, I will stay on the same hotel.

review.title: It was a great hotel for adults, but not family friendly at all.
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at this hotel, but with little one's it would not be the best choice. The small conviences for the parents to help with children were not there. If it was a get-away for the parents..PERFECT! Super location for lots of things. We would stay here again if it was just my husband and I.

review.title: 5 Star Calibur Indeed
review.reviewText: The Hotel is beautiful. My room, the restaurant, the business center, and the location were all excellent. What really made my stay even better was the Staff. They were all genuinely hospitable, accommodating and extremely professional. This is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine but not as good as the ratings indicated. Lobby very dark and not attractive. Room were fine. Hotel attractively located in the financial district.

review.title: Good Service Good Location Good Rooms
