review.reviewText: Hotel service was very good, prompt and polite. Rooms were clean, spacious and very comfortable. Location was very good with parking opposite the hotel on Battery St entrance. This financial distrcit location means available parking and a short 10 minutes walk to Union Square, 10 minute walk to Ferry Building for restaurants or 15-20 minute walk to Pier 39, 15 minutes to Coit tower.

review.title: Weekend Stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. Great views of the Bay and the City. Excellent front desk staff. I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: No Free WiFi
review.reviewText: I would have been completely satisfied with this hotel if it had had free WiFi. WiFi was $12.95 per night. Inexpensive hotels have free WiFi. There's no reason why luxury hotels such as this one shouldn't offer the same.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice big rooms in the financial district of S.F. with easy access to Fisherman Wharft, Market Street, Chinatown, and North Beach. Can't beat the location: sightseeing, shopping, restaurants; all in walking distance.

review.title: Fantastic in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at Le Meridien in July 2008. Cannot speak too highly about it. Our room was beautiful with huge plasma TV, sound system etc. Many rooms are cunningly located with two sliding patio doors (no balcony, just a balustrade) giving views in two directions. The hotel staff are incredibly helpful. I needed a dentist and the concierge booked me an appointment for half an hour after my request!The Embarcadero centre is linked by bridge to the hotel. It is possible to walk virtually to the waterfront along rooftop gardens, past a range of eateries. Great for business in the Financial District and great for Leisure visiting China Town and the waterfront.

review.title: Wow, so much more than expected.
review.reviewText: Right from check in, staff was very polite, friendly, and helpful with great advice for dining, shopping and entertaiment. The room (classic king)is posh, very comfortable, and relaxing - not a heavenly bed (Westin) but close. There is a lot of 4 star hotel competition in SF - Le Meridien holds its own. Very much recommend Le Meridien San Francisco.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: parking is outrageous at 50 bucks a night. wouldnt let me check in early at all...and trying to get a late checkout is like pulling teeth and they only gave me a hr later.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Parking is too expensive.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing! I was very impressed by all staff members. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and the food was fantastic! We got a great deal on our room, but we would definatly try and stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel. New rooms, great location. Beware of the $49 parking cost though.

review.title: best for business travel
review.reviewText: Really comfortable, clean place. More a business-type hotel than for traveling. Kind of far from attractions.

review.title: Elegant and Comfortable
review.reviewText: Le Meridian is a comfortable and elegant hotel conveniently located near many attractions. The 1st day we walked through the Embarcadero Shopping plaza and enjoyed the sights at the Embarcadero market place. Many restaurants and lots of fun sights and people nearby. The second day we walked about 4 blocks to China town and concluded our sight seeing through the area of North Beach. We love this hotel and would definitely stay here again. The room was so comfortable and very elegant. Also very family friendly they brought up and set up a portable crib for our little one.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Amazing staff- a clasic in the making! The room was spacious, and very clean. Parking was a little on the pricey side.

review.title: Geared more for business travellers.
review.reviewText: Le Meridien was satisfactory in most aspects except that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in room. Ordered tea and coffee on room service, had to wait 30+ minutes, and charged a fortune. Was told coffee machines available if requested and duly got one, eventually! Service for breakfast was very slow and expensive. Thank God for Starbucks! However, hotel was 3 blocks from the Ferry Building, a short tram ride from Fisherman's Wharf and the California Cable Car only 2 blocks away.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Great stay

review.title: Close to fun, but far enough away for quiet evenings
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel allows close proximity to many places of interest, yet it is deep enough into the financial district that weekends are quiet. The only problem is that many nearby eateries are closed along with the businesses. However, we were able to walk 15 minutes in any direction for all the entertainment we needed.

review.title: Enjoyable Experience
review.reviewText: Well the rooms were completely updated with a nice design and a plasma TV; the picture on the website does not give it justice. Everyone in the hotel was wonderful except maybe the valet. I had an issue with parking and left with a sour taste in my mouth. Parking is about 60 for 24 hours and they will charge you another 60 on the 25th hour - I had asked to pay hourly after my 24 hour period was up so I could attend the giants game. I complained until they finally allowed me to do it no charge. the funny thing is that I was willing to pay, just not 60 for 3 extra hours. In a nice hotel you shouldnt have to fight for something so simple. My recommendation charge guest by the night not check in time.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful room that has modern accents. Friendly staff. Walking distance to Union Square shopping, located on Battery in Financial District.

review.title: Noisy nights, uneven service
review.reviewText: The Meridien in SF is trying hard -- but they need to hire more consistent staff and train them better. We had the following issues interfere with enjoying our stay: First and foremost, the valet used an obnoxious train-sounding whistle to signal taxis that was clearly audible from our room at night. We called the front desk to complain about it the first night of our stay and he was asked to stop. Then we had to call the second night too because he was at it again. To my dismay, when I called the front desk the person working there stated, "well, he has to be able to signal taxis." The whistling stopped, but I really resented the defense of this stupid practice voiced to me at 10:30 at night when we were supposed to be sleeping. The other issue was the restaurant. When we went there the first morning, there was no host to greet us and we stood for a while. Then the busman came to play "host", and was rude to us while we decided whether we were going to eat there. He clearly had not been trained to play the role he was playing. The service once we got in was excellent. The service from housekeeping was good but uneven with requests. We asked for 4 extra pillows due to orthopedic problems and we were brought only 1. The Meridien states in their letter to guests that they want to make your stay a perfect 10 out of 10. They have a ways to go.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay at this hotel. Great reception, speedy check in and wonderful service. Even quiet enough to sleep with window open.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This was our first overnight stay in San Francisco. We found Le Meridien staff professional and courteous. Our room was impeccably clean and tastefully decorated. We sure will go back again. J&J

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Le Meridien proved to be a very good choice on a recent visit to San Francisco. The location is great and within walking distance to Union Square and the Wharf along the Embarcadero. The front desk clerks were extremely friendly and we received an upgrade to Bay view without asking. The room appeared to be newly renovated with lovely duvets and soft sheets. Everything was immaculate, and although the room was a little small it was fairly comfortable. I would have liked one comfortable chair to replace the hard desk chair however. The granite in the bathroom was most impressive. We graciously received a coffee maker on request for our early morning departure. The only disappointment came the next morning when we requested at 5:30 A.M. that our car be at the front door at 6 A.M. It was not there and the valet remembered the request and did apologize but we still did not receive our car until 6:15. This left us rushing to the airport unnecessarily. Overall however, Le Meridien was a very positive experience and we would definitely stay there again.

review.title: great weekend getaway
review.reviewText: 4 star hotel in central location, can walk to embarcadero, chinatown, union square, and even ballpark. Tadich grill right around corner one of SF's oldest restaurants with great food...awesome workout room with all the amenities..financial district, so you can get good deals on lower used weekends

review.title: memorial day weekend
review.reviewText: This hotel had a n excellent location near embarcadero yet close enough to union square shopping. Parking was a bit expensive. So if you don't get lucky finding a space on the street, your best bet is to park in the garage across the street for max of $30 per day. Restaurants and shopping are close by. Hotel and room quality are excellent. Great room for the price!

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: We booked three rooms, and all rooms are about the same size. The front desk and concierge are extremely friendly and helpful. Room are extremely clean and no one knockes at the door in early morning to clean your room. The only downside is that the restarant in the hotel is smallish, and the surrounding areas (2-3 blocks) does not have many places for breakfast other than starbucks. My mom can not walk long, so that is a problem. Other than that. Everything are great. It is a bit of walk to the pier, but walking in San Francisco is what makes it special. So we did enjoy the trip.

review.title: love the pillows
review.reviewText: Except for a couple of minor issues...I'm very picky - the hotel was great. The Concierge staff was the best I've seen. Great help, recommendations, spent time with you locating information, etc...

review.title: Would certainly recommend
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel in a reasonably quiet location, but still easy to get to all the attractions, shops etc. However, drinks in the bar very expensive.

review.title: Weekend convenience
review.reviewText: Great place to stay for weekend and be able to walk to a number of attractions: Embarcadero waterfront and Saturday market, Ferry Building, MOMA, Union Square, City Center. Small restaurants and businesses in Embarcadero Center and nearby are closed on weekends since this is the business center of S.F. but you'll never go hungry or thirsty! Staff was responsive, prompt and professional. Concierge was creative with getting reservations at a busy restaurant on Saturday night. Only issue we didn't like was that bedding was a heavy comforter that was too warm. The only alternative was sleeping with just a sheet, so we had to crank up the temperature in the room. If we stayed there again, we would request a blanket.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: This place was very nice and conveniently located to many major attractions. The room was very clean and the bed was really comfy. The workers were also very helpful and polite. The hotel was located in the Financial District but it was a short walk to the Muni and a short walk to the Piers. I will be staying here again on my next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Absolutely Perfect
review.reviewText: Our room was spacious, comfortable and meticulously clean. Great location within easy walking distance to most tourist attractions. Definitely would go back there

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: great place to stay!

review.title: VERY Happy
review.reviewText: Stay at this hotel. Great location, clean, excellent.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: My wife and I loved the hotel. It was right next to the Embarcadero Plaza a few blocks to all Embarcadero Center where there plenty of neat shops and restaurants. The hotel it self was very nice and they had great fitness center. The weekend rate was terrific, but I understand it is very expensive during the business week.

review.title: Nice atmosphere, modern hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, modern, great work out gym

review.title: Gem of a Hotel
review.reviewText: What a very pleasant surprise after a hellacious day of being bumped off of flights due to the FAA inspections. We finally arrived at Le Meridien at 2:00 AM. Because all of the rooms at our weekend rate were already taken, we were bumped up to suites with Bay views. Oh, I hate when that happens, LOL. The views were amazing, and the hotel location being right next to the Embarcadero was perfect for all of our day trips around the city. The hotel was very clean, and the service was excellent. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. We will definitely go back on our next trip!!! I am a very picky traveler, so it's rare for me to give such high praise unless it is deserved.

review.title: great location, and very clean
review.reviewText: Our hotel room was smaller than expected, but overall we were pleased. The only thing we would like to suggest is that the rooms have a coffee maker.

review.title: Wonderful location and nicely decorated.
review.reviewText: We were looking for a nice hotel with a reasonable rate. The Meridian was perfect for what we needed. We could walk to the Farmer's Market at the Ferry Building and also to Union Square. The staff at the front desk were very accomodating and friendly. We would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel for Business Travel
review.reviewText: Impeccably clean room, ideal location for business travel in the heart of the financial district. Walk to the Embarcadero and nearby fine dining establishments. Comfortable bed, nice linens, appropriate services for business travel including overnight dry cleaning.

review.title: A High Point ...
review.reviewText: Look up the meaning in an old English dictionary of Meridien and its old meaning is "a high point" and this place hits the mark. Great business rooms .. seperate office space with another TV, flat panel in the main room, great shower that just flows on the draining floor, super well lit bathroom, well stocked mini bar and good room service, I had breakfast in bed on Sunday morning exactly on the time I ordered and it was hot .. ! Highly rated, I'm going back again on my next San Fran trip, I even sent an e-mail to the hotel to praise them, something I would never normally do.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: I highly recommend the Le Meridien we had a wonderful stay there. The room (Exekutive King) was beautiful and the bathroom very clean and nice. Service is 5star, atmosphere great! The only negativ thing is, that we had a bay view room on the 22nd floor and on the opposite side of the road is a fire fighter station, in the night they have 3-4 calls and the horns of the emergency vehicles are very loud! Have a nice stay there!

review.title: Great Service !
review.reviewText: I've never been at a hotel where I was treated better. We arrive with 3 families and the front desk was more than willing to help us get situated close together. The doorman greated us each time with a friendly " hello " and a big smile. The concierge helped us with tips on how to navigate San Francisco and best routes to our destination. When checking out, the valet attendants were quick to attend to our luggage and asked to be sure we knew how to get back on the freeway from the hotel. I felt that everybody actually wanted to help and that's what good service is all about.

review.title: Real nice Hotel, Great location for the ballpark.
review.reviewText: Clean and quiet Hotel Room. Great view Corner room. Bed is great after an all day tour & exploration of SF.

review.title: Where can you find a meal?
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable. The unfortunate part was that the beautiful restaurant in the hotel was only open for breakfast. I could not get a dinner in the hotel except in the lounge restaurant adjacent to the lobby and nobody seemed to know what was on the menu. They told me on the house phone that they only served light meals and appetizers. In fact, when I checked it out myself, they served full entree meals including New York Steak, chicken dinners, etc. I ended up eating there but it was later than I wanted to eat because I started looking for alternative restaurants based on the mis-information given by the hotel staff. Not what you'd expect in a nice hotel.

review.title: Nice and stylish hotel, helpfull staff
review.reviewText: Le Meridien is one of the best hotels I have stayed so far. Studio suites are gorgeous, very comfortable and big. It has a counter in the middle of the room with a rotating TV stand in cabinet to separate the bed and living areas. We put our kid to bed and rotated the TV to the side with the couch to enjoy it. Couple of concerns, valet parking is extremely expensive yet not too uncommon for SF. Bathroom is huge and stylish but the shower base is made of stone and can be uncomfortably cold to the touch. Every detail is thought of but they could have provided slippers to make it even perfect as some parts of the room floor don't have carpeting and made of granite.

review.title: Great experience; very impressed!
review.reviewText: Great location in the financial district of S.F.; close to down town area. Not far from sights such as Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, and just across the street from Embarcadero Square. Room was fantastic; one of the nicest hotel rooms we've been in. Only drawback was the down comforter: too thick for comfort.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Very clean. Within 15 minutes walking distance of everything we wanted to visit. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

review.title: One of the best hotels in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My party and I had an amazing time at Le Meridian. The concierge accommodated me with extra services that I requested, with excellent service. The bay view room was exquisite!

review.title: excellent service
review.reviewText: overall service outstanding

review.title: nice and clean
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel. It was clean and nice and staff were really helpful people. Room was big and nice but no city view for us. Good location close to shopping centers. I wish parking was a little bit cheaper; it was 50 per night that is quiet expensive.

review.title: Wonderful Trip
review.reviewText: My wife and I had a wonderful weekend at la Meredien in San Francisco just before New Years. The hotel was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Room service was excellent as were the restaurant and bar. Overall it was a wonderful experience and we will definately return.

review.title: Very Good Stay
review.reviewText: Concierge service was excelent. Near a starbucks, an irish pub, Mc Donalds and walgreens, what else could you ask? Bed very very comfortable. The only thing is that you have to take taxis or the F1 trolley to go anywhere you want (union square, china town, Pier 30's) or you better like long walks

review.title: Great...everything!
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. We were there for a Christmas Eve trip to SF -- we live in Napa Valley. The location is wonderful for in and out to downtown, the waterfront and everywhere you'd want to go. The staff were prompt in responding to any/every request. Valet parking is convenient but expensive -- but there is parking across the street at the Embarcadero Center parking lot. We were able to get this hotel for a low special rate which made it do-able. Normally, this is a high end & expensive business traveler hotel but the holiday rate was a bargain and we loved our stay!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed the hotel. It had great, comfy beds and sheets, which is a real winner in my book. My husband always loves when they have great mini bar, and it was in walking distance to Union Square. Everyone working there was really nice and it was just a great hotel. We will definitely be returning.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Wonderful rooms, well located hotel and first class breakfasts. A definite recommendation for business or leisure travellers.

review.title: After staying in S.F. for 30 years this was the best in every catagory!
review.reviewText: I never comment on hotel stays unless they were not satisfactory. However our stay here was so exceptional I felt compelled to write a review. I have stayed at almost every hotel in the City. This was by far the best I have ever seen. From the second you pull into the valet parking to the front desk to the bellman to the room. Its 100% first class. The people really care. There are NO, repeat NO dissapointments here. Add the perfect location, close to everything and you have the best experience you will ever find anywhere. Walk to waterfront clock tower shopping, union square, north beach, and chinatown. To top it off there is a Safeway 2 blocks away, parks and restaurants everywhere. You will always remember this hotel if you are lucky enough to stay there.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Everything you would expect from a 4* hotel, a little more intimate than some of the bigger hotels in the area. Only down side: no iPass wireless access like the rest of the Starwood hotels.

review.title: you will be delighted
review.reviewText: Room was beautiful! Clean, hotel very accomdating! Located in the heart of North bay, lots of yummy Itlian food! Hotel Restaraunt was good, but very pricey... I would stay here again in a heart beat!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: wonderful view of the Oakland Bay Bridge

review.title: Great Location, very clean and updated
review.reviewText: Le Meridian in San Francisco was great. The staff was friendly, the room was immaculate, and it was in a great location. I would stay again.

review.title: Would go back for sure
review.reviewText: Room was very nice, very clean & comfortable. For the most part, the service was excellent. A bit of bungling on their part in checking in, but they paid for our drinks while we waited (although we had to prompt on this) AND they gave us a hand-written apology PLUS complimentary credit for all our breakfasts at the hotel for our stay -- so we had very nice breakfasts for all 3 of our mornings, and the credits covered it all. Nice recovery on their part.

review.title: check out bedding
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine in most respects EXCEPT the sleeping part and that is what we are here for. They ought to get their decorator to sleep there. 14 pillows on the bed are overdone and a very thick and hot comforter without any other blanket option means you sleep between a sheet while wrapped up in a robe. Otherwise no matter how low you take the temperature controll you roast. I will trade a good nights sleep for charm anytime. The manager said they could have brought me a regular blanket if I had asked at 2:00 in the morning (maybe). If you go there demand a regular blanket or I guanantee you will have a poor night sleep.

review.title: Would go back in a heart beat
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is ideal and walking distance to everything. It was quiet and the rooms were great. The staff couldn't have been nicer.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Clean room. Polite staff. Great price.

review.title: Best Concierge that I have ever found
review.reviewText: We got a great rate at this hotel for a long weekend. We had never stayed in this neighborhood...mostly on Nob Hill in the past. It really does provide the easy access to all the sights of San Francisco. The concierge, Laura, and her co-workers were awesome. We asked her for dinner reservations. We watched her straighten out missed tours, great regular customers and make the usual dinner and tour reservations. Nice hotel...

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Nice rooms,great beds with down comforters and pillows. My room also had a really nice cd player and tuner so you could listen to some music while enjoying the great views. Overall I was very satisfied and would stay there again.

review.title: We will go back
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent a full week at the Le Meridian SF during the month of September 2007. There was a special nice feeling about the place. The staff were very kind and helpful, the location was perfect and the cleanliness was first class. We will go back again.

review.title: This hotel was very nice and the staff was extremely efficient.
review.reviewText: Although I would give the hotel a 4+ rating, I probally wouldn't choose it again in San Francisco because of the location. The locale was cold and uninstering. I would have prefered to be closer to boutique shopping, fine restaurants, and more of the city's flavor.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It was very nice, good service..

review.title: The Elevators and Noise brought it down a couple of notches
review.reviewText: The two bad things about this hotel were the slow elevators and the music in the elevator (bird noise, water dripping noise) everyone over the weekend commented on how weird the noise in the elevator was.

review.title: A real gem!
review.reviewText: Our anniversary stay at Le Meridien was fabulous! Accomodations are luxurious, the bed heavenly,and the views spectacular. Very nice lounge areas in the lobby. We like the location of the hotel away from the tourist crowd yet only a few blocks from the cable cars and waterfront. This was our first trip to San Francisco(can't wait to go back) and will definitely stay at Le Meridien. It was a real delight and exceeded all our expectations!

review.title: Wonderful stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: I took my girlfriend to San Fran to meet my family and we enjoyed the hotel thoroughly. The room was beautiful, the down duvet was heavenly and the view of downtown was excellent. The thing I was surprised and impressed me the most was the quality of service. Everyone was extremely helpful.

review.title: Excellent Stay in SF
review.reviewText: We got a great deal on this hotel and our three nights were great. The room was clean, the view from the 17th floor delightful and the staff nice.

review.title: Definitely would go back!
review.reviewText: We stayed at Le Meridian for our anniversary and all the reviews are accurate (and more)! This was a very elegant hotel and the rooms were fabulous! The staff was great. They have a cocktail bar in the lobby -- very nice atmosphere. I do not have one complaint - and we'd definitely go back. It's in the financial district so it's quiet on the weekend (which we liked) but close enough that you can walk to Union Square. I would give this a 5 out of 5 for satisfaction!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The most remarcable is the employees. They are very kind and helpful. The hotel is very nice and modern. The location is close to Ferry Building and Embarcadero Center. A few blocks from the Union Square, but there is not nightlife around. You have to pay for the wireless internet.

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very nice and professional. The room was amazing. The bed was not like any hotel bed I have ever stayed in. It felt like you were at home. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends and family.

review.title: parking
review.reviewText: Parking is $50 a night ..very nice hotel..but parking is abit much

review.title: good location, great hotel
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel for the location. It was close to th Embarcadero center and the ferry building. It was also very convenient to mass transit.

review.title: A very nice stay
review.reviewText: I got the room at half off, and felt so pampered as a reward for my web savvy! It was almost a shame leaving the big, comfy bed. Awesome gym. Vast bathroom. Helpful concierge, all as expected. The financial district's a fine location, too. I will say I was surprised to have my foot hit an outlet cover or something metal and rather sharp sticking up a little bit from the cut carpet near the window. It could really do some damage to a bare foot!

review.title: Excellent hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Decor (not your usual chain hotel) is very tasteful, sophisticated. Views are great. Location convenient to BART, Union Square, Embarcadero, Nordstrom, Bloomingdales, great restaurants. Hotel restaurant too pricey for breakfast--$45 for 2 people--but food good & service excellent.

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: great location - easy access to restaurants, fitness trails, etc. great rates - especially for weekend travelers. service was friendly and concierge was very helpful. the hotel considered the notes we left on the reservation and upgraded us before we checked in. would definitely return!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Meridien Hotel helped make our visit a special one. Some of the highlights..views of SF Bay from our room....knowledgeable concierge service... execellent nearby restaurants... Central location so short walks to the Ferry Building for lunch, church service in China Town, Dim Sum for another lunch, shopping at Union Square, etc. Will definitely stay there on our next visit to SF

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This is by far the best hotel we have experienced in San Francisco. Loved the location and quality of service from the valet, doorman, bellman, front desk, room maid, technicians, etc. A very comfortable room nicely appointed w/bath (both good in size). Great dining and lounging in The Grill Restaurant and Bar 333. They have a fine gym too! What a find, it really should be rated 5 star!

review.title: Everything I expected
review.reviewText: Everything you'd expect from a top of the line hotel. The room was beautifully appointed with a great view and the beds were very comfortable with lots of pillows. We were on the 15th floor and it was very quiet with just faint street noise. We requested early check in (10:30 am) and they were able to accommodate us. The concierge assisted us by checking us in for our departing flight and printing our boarding passes. Negatives: there was always a line to talk to the concierge, and you have to pay for internet access!

review.title: No Surprises
review.reviewText: Having recently stayed in an overpriced boutique hotel in San Francisco where the room was so small 2 people could barely get around eachother, it was a pleasure to walk into a spacious, well-appointed room, knowing I was paying less and getting so much more. And the location was ideal.

review.title: Would return
review.reviewText: We came in for a long weekend on Saturday.They had several groups of us wait in lines for over an hour past check in time, to keep checking for available rooms because none were clean yet. The a/c in the room did not work very well and there was no top sheet on the bedding, which didn't seem that sanitary. Other than that the staff was extremely helpful and friendly and it is a great location. The public transportation is just a couple blocks within walking distance. The rooms have excellent views and are very spacious.

review.title: sign me up!!
review.reviewText: Le Meridian is top notch--first class all the way. Great staff-they know where to eat and how to find the best shopping, helpful and very friendly..made me feel lucky. The location is great. They have wonderful beds and view rooms--great for families with connecting rooms available. We were a bit late checking out but there was NO hassle about it and they go that extra mile to make you at home! Awesome place!!

review.title: Definitely worth another visit
review.reviewText: Le Meridien is centrally located by the Embarcadero Center and other must see San Francisco sites. The staff is very friendly, knowledgable, making a guest feel very welcome.

review.title: Awesome hotel
review.reviewText: Great location - close to the Embarcadero, room was great

review.title: Concierge was great!!!
review.reviewText: The concierge at the hotel was fantastic. They knew where to go and how to tell you to get there. They even make reservations for you. The view was great in the room and the bed as usual were heavenly!!! The hotel was quiet even though we are near an elevator. We checked in late thursday night and still got a great room. Would stay there again... any starwood hotel!!!!

review.title: Great Location, Great Service, Great Time!
review.reviewText: My wife and I and our two daughters recently visited San Francisco and stayed four nights at Le Meridien. I must say that I was more than impressed with the room and especially with the friendliness and service of the hotel staff. We needed a car for a couple of days and the Consierge took care of everything. Everyone at the Concierge desk was very helpful and readily answered all of our questions and went out of their way to make sure we had a good time. When we get the chance to go back to San Francisco (and we will DEFINITELY go back - what a great city!) we will most certainly look for accomodations at Le Meridiene.

review.title: Enjoyable and convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel room had gorgeous view of the bay and the Bay Bridge. Furniture is bit old and shaky but people were very nice. Concierge desk was extremely helpful. Position of the hotel is a great balance. It close to the site seeing and shopping places for a walk but far enough from tourist crowd. Only suggestion is to add a full facaility restaurant.

review.title: Great stay at Le Meridien San Francisco
review.reviewText: I stayed at Le Meridien for three nights during late June, and I'm glad to say the hotel met all my expectations. Ride from SFI Airport was about 20 minutes with no traffic, and approx $35 USD. Le Meridien is centrally located in the Financial District, next to the El Embarcadero Center, and within short walking distance of Chinatown, the North Beach area, and Market Street. Check-in was fast and friendly. We booked a "Studio King" room, which was very spacious, clean, and well-appointed. Room #1906 had great panaromic views of the bay, and city! Housekeeping was efficient, although we only received Turn-down service on one evening. The hotel does have a nice-looking restaurant, but we opted to go out for all our meals and enjoy our time in lovely San Francisco. Concierge services were very helpful, specially Angela who helped us with restaurant recommendations (try Chaya!) and renting a car for a wonderful day out in Sausalito and Muir Woods. This was my first time in San Francisco, and I am glad to say the comforts and relaxation of Le Meridien made my trip even better.

review.title: Great stay at Le Meridien San Francisco
review.reviewText: I stayed at Le Meridien for three nights during late June, and I'm glad to say the hotel met all my expectations. Ride from SFI Airport was about 20 minutes with no traffic, and approx $35 USD. Le Meridien is centrally located in the Financial District, next to the El Embarcadero Center, and within short walking distance of Chinatown, the North Beach area, and Market Street. Check-in was fast and friendly. We booked a "Studio King" room, which was very spacious, clean, and well-appointed. Room #1906 had great panaromic views of the bay, and city! Housekeeping was efficient, although we only received Turn-down service on one evening. The hotel does have a nice-looking restaurant, but we opted to go out for all our meals and enjoy our time in lovely San Francisco. Concierge services were very helpful, specially Angela who helped us with restaurant recommendations (try Chaya!) and renting a car for a wonderful day out in Sausalito and Muir Woods. This was my first time in San Francisco, and I am glad to say the comforts and relaxation of Le Meridien made my trip even better.

review.title: Great hotel all round.
review.reviewText: We spent three nights here and we were very impresed with the room itself (great city views). The staff were very helpful (concierge esoecially for eating out etc). The hotel has been recently renovated and the room's decor and the furnishings and bedding reflected this. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. They also provide free internet access. Good little bar across the road, serves good food too.

review.title: Efficient, helpful staff, lovely room
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to the Embarcadero, four blocks up from the Ferry building. Streetcars or buses stop close by, so this is convenient to to China Town and Fisherman's Wharf too. I have stayed here twice, and both times was satisfied with the service, attitide and helpfullness of the staff. My room was super-clean, and lovely. The bed was comfortable - the view wonderful. I would stay hee again.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Modern, clean & comfortable. We had a great view!

review.title: We will always return to this hotel
review.reviewText: This is the third time we stayed at this hotel and always found the hotel clean, luxurious and the staff very friendly. Before arriving I called the concierge to help with reservations for dinners and a car service. They were very obliging and the restaurant selections were excellent. But most important, above all, we had a medical emergency and they did exactly what I told them to do immediately: send hotel staff to our room and call 911 for an ambulance. I told them to clean the bathroom while we were gone and change the linens, etc. They did all that and more. When we returned to the hotel, I called them for several things and they were "johnny on the spot". I am immensely grateful for their assistance and will always return to stay there.

review.title: Fabulous Room with a View
review.reviewText: This was my daughters first time to SF so I thought we would stay a nice hotel. This was my first time at the Le Meredian and was extremely impressed, it is walking distance to Chinatown, and the hotel is connected to Embarcadero Center which makes it easy to pick up a few things if forgoten. Also it is a short walk to the Ferry Building. And thanks to a wonderful concierge we were able to find our way around town with ease. The hotel is spotless along with the room which had a beautiful view of the city and bay. Will deffinately stay here again.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText: Very upscale and beautiful hotel. My room was on the 16th floor with a 180 degree view of the bay, telegraph hill, St. Francis Church, Transamerica pyramid. Wonderful amenities and fantastic customer service.

review.title: Excellent Place
review.reviewText: Great place to stay in the Financial District. Complimentary car service. Staff is very helpful with dinner suggestions and reservations.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The service was excellent. We would stay there again.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: The TV is too low but otherwise nice place, good location.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: The TV is too low but other than that, nice place.

review.title: Excellent Accomodations
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean hotel. I've stayed here several times, the hotel is very busy at all hours, sometimes service might be lacking a touch, but the comfort, style, and cleanliness of the rooms and bedding outweight this 10 time over.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Too pricey with not enough amenities. Should at least provide free internet

review.title: Nice hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: Great location at the heart of the financial district. Located next to a mall for quick purchases. Professional staff. Great rooms but can they get a couple of comfortable chairs?

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great location excellent staff, amazing views.

review.title: Costly Stay
review.reviewText: Nice but bring your money

review.title: What a Jewel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel with a very professional and accomodating staff. We loved it here. While it is not on a destination it is close to cable cars, trolleys and the Embarcadero. Lots of great restaurants and night spots near by. We will return.

review.title: Exceeded Expectations!
review.reviewText: We had never been to San Francisco before and the staff at the hotel gave us great tips. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. I has very impressed with the hotel and its staff.

review.title: Nice Hotel - great location
review.reviewText: very pleasant stay. hotel staff goes out of their way to be friendly. Housekeeping service is average at best - didn't empty trash or clean room well.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The staff was very friendly, courteous, and helpful. My room was outstanding. It was beautiful and comfortable. The restaurant served delicious food. I will definitely return!

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: We loved everything about this hotel except for the expensive valet parking. Even the valet would have been of but our car was just taken without being asked. Weekend parking is free on the street and 28 a day across the street instead of 43 for the valet. Parking is expensive in SF no matter where you go. Cannot ask for a better staff from top to bottom.

review.title: Amazing Luxury Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: I stayed for five days in Le Meridian in August, 2006 and was very pleased with the hotel. I booked a bay view room and got a very nice suite with a separate office and big bathroom. My room 1119 was on the corner of the hotel facing the Bay bridge and also had a nice balcony. The decor is modern, comfortable and very comfy. This is a great hotel, just renovated and very luxurious. The bed was comfortable and the office was a dream. Service was excellent. I noticed that the Nakamichi stereo in the room had a blown speaker. I called the front desk and an engineer was there in under 5 minutes to fix it. He promptly replaced the speaker. While they have a little gym area in the hotel, for a serious workout there is a 24 hour fitness just 2 blocks away. The hotel doesn't have a pool or spa, so 24 Hour Fitness was very convenient for a workout and dip in the hot tub. Also the Embarcadero transportation hub is really close. Its an easy walk to restaurants on Columbus or over to the Embarcadero area. There is also a small art house cinema next door with 5 theaters so that's handy. The concierge staff was very helpful and recommended some great restaurants. Parking is extremely expensive, but about the same as other SF hotels. Only negatives were the lack of a spa in the hotel and a bit of street noise (sirens, loud motorcycles) but I think this is par for an urban hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for business travelers or those on a SF vacation.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel is very clean and very nice. Service is exceptional and the beds are awesome.Would recommend to all

review.title: Nice Hotel...but...
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel! It used to be the Hyatt. The only thing that I was disappointed with is I set up two in room massages and we were very cramped..they didn't really put us in a large enough room to accomodate two massage tables (that would be the concierge's fault...also the room we were in had this thing in the bathroom ceiling (looked like a fan)it sounded like the shower was on all night...all we could hear was running water. Although a nice room the water sound ruined it. Don't stay in Rm 622. next time i would ask for a room on the very end they are the biggest.

review.title: Excellent location/outstanding bed!
review.reviewText: Since my daughter had not been to SF, we wanted to be close enough to things but not in the center of noise. It felt very safe. We easily walked to several attractions. The concierge personnel were SO helpful! Room service was quick and fresh. The bed was difficult to leave!!

review.title: Quiet and Classy
review.reviewText: This is a nice subdued, well-kept hotel that is close to everything. The staff is well trained and professional. I put this hotel well above some of the other high profile names in the City.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The location is ideal, the views and service are excellent. I would definately stay there again.

review.title: Very good hotel with great location
review.reviewText: Great Location, very good condition

review.title: Awesome view of the Bay!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the hotel. The service, cleanliness and especially the view, made my stay worthwhile. Our visit was for leisure and although I am familiar with the city, I needed help determining some good night life. The concierge not only gave us information, they courteously drove us to the location we selected in a very nice automobile.

review.title: a comfortable night's stay
review.reviewText: the hotel clerks weren't the friendliest but the room service attendants were great. as usual the hardest working people are the ones who are at the lowest levels of service. it would seem to me that if you are paying the price to stay in a hotel all staff should make that effort to make you feel welcome and be of assistance. in my job i have been trained to observe human behavior (ie: body language, affect, content of speech) and i was not at all impressed with the hotel desk clerks presence. and when i had to call down to request a personal bar price listing the clerk attempted to argue that i had one in the room when in fact i did not. i wonder if that is not just a way for the hotel to get guests to use items from the minibar without knowing how much they will be paying in advance. but i will say the bed, bedding and the bathroom were very nice. but don't be deceived by the virtual tour and photos of the rooms. you will not get what they have put there for you to see as their example of a bathroom or view.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful. Changed room at request for better view and all all hotel amenities were top notch.

review.title: Good For the $
review.reviewText: smoking room no choice but worth the view

review.title: More First Class, Less Expense
review.reviewText: From the 17th floor I thought I owned the Bay. Spacious room, verry comfortable bed. Good closet and drawer space. Friendly, professional-looking staff. Prompt greetings with a warm reception. Location off Jackson Square a very quiet neighborhood, but at the end of the Embarcadero shopping complex. Terrific rate. For once I really thought I got a deal.

review.title: ideal location
review.reviewText: within walking distance of Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf and only 4 blocks from a MUNI station. enjoyed the hotel except for a rude Christmas night bartender. terrific fitness center plenty of places to dine close by. unless you are on an expense account, avoid dining in the hotel. Two of us had a simple, but well prepared breakfast there one morning for $75!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: It's a great hotel! The staff is very courteous & polite. The location is great - in a less busy part of DT San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect place to stay!
review.reviewText: I was very happy with the great service and the beautiful view on our trip.

review.title: Excellent hotel and service
review.reviewText: I can usually find something to nitpick, but not here. Service, condition, cleanliness and comfort are all tops. I arrived at ten in the morning. The front desk found an available room and I was able to check-in early, rather than wait for 3 pm check-in. I couldn't ask for more. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Now the only place to stay for my husband & I when we visit San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Beautiful room, view, and staff.

review.title: okay
review.reviewText: had a problem with checking in, but everything else was superb

review.title: Very impresses
review.reviewText: We had a great time and the hotel was wonderful

review.title: 5 star hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with breath taking views. Elegant rooms and great location. Service was top notch. If your looking for a upscale hotel w/ all the room amentities, this is it.

review.title: Room Service
review.reviewText: The room service is very responsive and comes very quickly.  The food comes at the appropriate tempurature and is delicious.
